text: These aren't awful donuts, but they certainly aren't the best. I've tried their donuts on three different occasions, and each time was a lackluster experience. Dry donuts describes it best.
Great staff. We got there late when most of the day's supply was already gone. But the staff was very friendly and still had some great options available for us. Also very affordable!

An amazing find!  The staff was spot-on with their recommendations...which was definitely needed, given the large variety from which to choose.  We had the Boston Cream, strawberry shortcake, and lemon cheesecake...all were wonderful. The lattes were very good, as well!
We had the opportunity to meet the owner...suggested we get the French Toast Donut (another customer had ordered...looked incredible).
We will definitely make this a regular stop for future visits to Vegas.

Have been waiting for this place to open since I first heard that they were coming to town.  It was everything I hoped it would be.  Donuts both in classic and unique flavors.  They were absolutely delicious.  The Donut Bar is awesome - great donuts and awesome service.  It's great to have them in DTLV!

We've been to the original location in SD while visiting the area. I just want to Thank the owner for coming outside to tell us about your training and how your donuts are made, even give the few kids that were in line a cute free donut. It's nice to see new places downtown. The donuts were awesome. I ordered a vanilla latte also - excellent! I love that you have stump town coffee (one of my fav's and to find out you have it on tap!  best donuts in Las Vegas!

I'm from San Diego, I miss home and to know that Donut Bar opened up here in Las Vegas I had to go! Not your traditional donuts, these are more like your own personal small cake if you would. The size of this donuts are enough to feed two or three people. The place is great easy to find especially with neon sign out side the door. Staff is awesome, ambience is great, , owners always there to great you and thank you with a friendly smile. The only problem I have with this place is that I don't know what Donut to choose, I go inn for one come out with half a dozen.  It's all good I can munch on them all day. Great job guys and thank you for opening in Vegas.
These were definitely worth the wait! Drove all the way across town to try them. Service and donuts were great!

Love the donuts! I am very disappointed on the service. I finally made a trip to donut bar today, I was extremely excited to taste these donuts. The person that took my order was helpful and her recommendations were excellent. She even up sold me on other donuts and coffee. The checkout was excruciating, I had to ask for my coffee. The coffee was spilled by the cashier.  The cashier forgot a whole box of donuts. Ultimately, I had to make a second trip which took an extra hour of travel time to retrieve my second box of donuts. The cashier mistake ruined my whole experience at donut bar.
The staff was friendly and welcoming. The donuts tasted fresh and were delish! Especially the Mexican hot chocolate one . This was our first time there and we'd definitely go back.

It was our first time visiting this place after following them them on instagram. The customer service was amazing... everyone was friendly. Best of all, it was clean and well kept. The donut ice cream was delicious and we instagram'd it right away... especially if you like cinnamon and sugar with your soft serve. Plus get the drizzle... it comes in caramel, chocolate or get them both. I am definitely going back again!

Been to this place many times, while you're in downtown LV in the morning, check this place out! Nice staff, good prices for donuts and coffee, and there's vegan options. The menu rotates everyday so you can have different options. I hope to try their other donuts on their menu, my favorite is the birthday cake oreo, blueberry meyer, and raspberry.
I buy their donuts for my clients all the time and they are absolutely amazing. Service is fast and friendly and espresso is delicious!

I am not even all that much of a donut person, but this place is AMAZING!!!!!  The donuts are light and fluffy, not greasy and the flavors are absolutely delicious!!  Drip coffee is $1 which is a very welcome surprise!  I would stop by even just for the coffee because it is delic.  The staff is so welcoming and friendly.  I cannot say enough good things about this place.  I tell everyone I meet to go try it!

This is a great little donut place. They have chocolate and strawberry milk on tap. Their coffees are so smooth and addicting. I've tried a few of their donuts and have loved all of them so far. They even have a donut with a pop tart in the center! The donut ice cream cone is by far the best.
My absolute favorite coffee donut spot in the valley. Always fresh and delicious.  Fabulous variety.

We went overboard, but it was totally worth it!  We limited ourselves to 6 (Big Poppa Tart, Salted Caramel, Creme Brulee, Maple Bacon, Pumpkin Spice Cream Cheese, Butterfinger)  Our favorites were the Big Poppa Tart, Salted Caramel, and Pumpkin Spice Cream Cheese.  The maple bacon wasn't anything unique and the butterfinger was a cake style donut, which we preferred as an afternoon donut.  The creme brulee had no flavor (or maybe it did but the others were just that overwhelming)  Overall it was amazing, the staff was very patient as we made our decision, well worth the early wake up and drive.  We got there just after 7am and had no line, however while we were inside 4-5 other people came in.

Finding this place was a total fluke as they have a back enterace which I thought was an apartment building. There were people eating at table's in an open air type patio which reminded me of San Fran. I heard loud music, saw an incredible fish tank, and had to check it out. Shocked to find it was a donut shop since it seemed to be "hip". Didn't know such a thing existed.  Wasn't hungry, but I wasn't going to leave without trying one of their many unique donuts. Crazy combinations. Poptart inside a donut? Who'd of thunk? I got the Strawberry  Shortcake, or was it Strawberry Shortpuff, as it was loaded with whipped deliciousness topped with strawberries. Spent 10 minutes in bathroom taking photos. Check this place out! Must pay for parking, but no big deal. Machines take all forms of payment. Worth it.

Giant.

Giant donuts.

Delicious giant donuts.

Amazingly puffy delicious giant donuts.

Fresh and amazingly puffy delicious giant donuts.

Great variety of puffy delicious giant donuts.

I failed to eat just one giant donut.

It was a delicious giant donut.

Giant donut!

Giant!



Be sure to get there early because they are open until they sell out.

This place is a lot of fun. The line was a bit long when we came, but I always take the as a good sign. They have a nice selection of interesting flavors and they have vegan options as well.  We ordered a variety of flavors, the creme brulee, lemon pistachio, and strawberry strawberry split are my top picks. Their coffee is also pretty good. They are a bit pricey, but most of the donuts are huge, and they are pretty fancy donuts.

I am proud to have this donut bar in Las Vegas! You guys are amazing! If you are looking for a really cool place with an amazing vibe and couple that with some of the most UNIQUE and TASTY Donuts found ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD! Then this is the place for you!

May you continue to serve donuts in Las Vegas for next 100+ Years! 

I would rate this one 10 MILLION STARS!

I finally came early enough to get a French toast donut! I had been teased for weeks by this donut, from Instagram and yelp! I tried the Sunday before last and missed out as I came too late, surprisingly 9:40 is too late even though they open at 8! This place is very popular. Unfortunately, you have to arrive super early to get a FT donut which they only serve on the weekends. I arrived last Saturday before the doors opened and it was well worth it! The donut was so soft and tasty, it went down smooth with the milk I ordered. I have to say it sucked sitting at the eating area as the air is blasting which made my French toast cool after a while. I only ordered the French Toast so I'm not sure about the rest of the donuts. I do plan on going back this weekend for another FT donut so maybe I'll try some others as well. The 4 stars is because I feel they should have the FT donut all week and because the hours they are open is so short, some days they close at noon. They could be making so much more business!

I finally visited Donut Bar after a few weeks of stalking their Instagram and frequently checking Yelp. Overall, it was okay. I came in around 11 AM on a Monday, and they still had quite a selection left to choose from. It's a cute shop with a nice outdoor section to enjoy your donuts, too. The music is a bit loud inside. The staff is friendly and helpful; I asked a few questions, and they were happy to help me pick out my donuts. 

The only donuts I really enjoyed and would probably come back for are the creme brûlée, Homer's donut, and the "Oh My Birthday Cake Oreo." I didn't get to try the strawberry split I was also interested in, but maybe that will be for another visit. 

Not a bad experience at all, just a little bit less than what I was expecting.

Really really amazing donuts! I could eat the donuts without the fancy icing even, because the dough is that good. We came Thursday around 10 am and walked right up to order. Staff is very kind and helpful! We got a dozen to try all the flavors and every single donut was delicious. Nothing beats the donut bar! Thanks for the treat, we will be back soon!

This place is near Fremont street. Had to pay for parking out front, but it was only $1. We ordered the French Toast donut and two creme brulee donuts. The French Toast donut was AMAZING!  The creme brulee donuts were not very good. The sugary top was very hard and the doughnut was honestly just not good at all. The 4 star rating is more for the French Toast....the creme brulee would have gotten 1 star.

I'd eat here again.  Their menu was awesome and they still had options around 10:15am on a Saturday morning. Go early though, certain donuts sell out quickly!
The donuts were delicious, we tried the creme brûlée, the vanilla bean, and the poptart! We will be back before we leave Vegas!

Great place for donuts lovers. donuts flavors are original and you have a lot of choice. Much much better than dunkin donuts (which is the level 0 of pastries) but a little bit too expansive just for donuts... That's why I don't give 5 stars.

We sought this place out to try the donuts but they were completely sold out of all donuts on a Saturday morning. Poor management and planning in my opinion. Don't waste your time walking through a somewhat sketchy area to only be disappointed.

They have donuts as big as your face and flavors that sound plain awesome!

Luckily, they have more "normal sized" donuts on the racks behind the glass counter. That said, we went small, a Red Velvet Donut and a Chai Spice Donut.

These were... awesome! 

Simple drip coffee in the back was perfect to wash it down.

When I'm back in Las Vegas... I'll find my way here on the mornings.
Place was packed as usual, can't go wrong with these humongous fresh donuts. Back for my second time... First time as a vegan and happy to see the vegan options

Go, just go!  Five bucks a donut and iced mocha  in Vegas is a treat; however, donuts approved by local deputies is a sure sign you have found the best donut shop in Vegas.   The friendly staff has reason to smile because they know you are in for a real treat when you order any of their donut creations!

Awesome. Staff is very accommodating. A wide variety of specialty donuts will have your mouth watering. The coffee is great, try the Portland blend.
The kids get balloons and a cool child's donut. Gotta end this review. I'm heading to Donut Bar now!

Awesome donuts! Got to try the French Toast donut! The owners, Joe & Jeff are incredibly welcoming! Eating donuts and listening to a playlist that I reminisce living back in the '80s, Great overall experience!!!!

AND please come and make a home in the Bay!
Price is good and blueberry cheesecake donut is to die for.
Amazing donuts! I'd commute for these they were so good. Lots of variety and new flavors. Friendly staff and a clean facility. A bit pricy but unlike any donut I've had before

What's not to love? They have iced coffee on tap, donuts as big as your head. When we were there, we had a buy one get one option. If I were needing a sugar shock, I might have tried the Homer (a pink frosted donut with sprinkles straight out of the Simpsons), but i wasn't feeling so bold.
Instead, I opted for a chai cake donut. My boyfriend got a Boston cream. We tore through them so fast I considered getting more. 
This place is off of Fremont, but still worth a quick grab and go breakfast.
The doughnuts were delicious.  So many different choices.  Also they have great outdoor seating.

So disappointed by this place. The donuts were just sad. They look amazing but taste like disappointment.

We got there in the afternoon time so they were doing $10 boxes (as many donuts you can fit in a box for $10), we were so excited to get to try a variety.

Smores on fire - eh & cake donut was sad
Triple chocolate - more like 1 chocolate 
Blueberry & Meyer lemon - decent
Creme brulee - eh, cream was gross
Chai - okay
Chocolate covered old fashioned - gross
Poptart - okay but so overly sweet 
Nutella - the only one where the donut dough was good
Chocolate milk - don't get it, not worth it

2 stars cause we would eat 2 donuts again (blueberry & Meyer lemon & nutella) and the staff was really nice

So many choices - with none of ours leaving us with regret. Grabbed some donuts to go after having some breakfast at EAT, and noshed on them later that day. 

They were serving french toast donuts that looked pretty good too. 

Would recommend if you're looking to satiate that sweet tooth!

Located downtown right next to Carson's Kitchen downtown makes this quite the journey for me but I still do it. Love the maple bacon cronut! The best! They typically sell out of the most popular items really quickly. Almost everything is pretty much gone by early afternoon. If you want to get the goods head there early.
Awesome place and vegan friendly . Donuts are fresh and huge. Staff was very helpful and full of smiles. If you have the time stay... have your donuts outside scenery is great.
Brought my daughter in today... very cool, modern place with donuts everywhere!  We had the strawberry cheesecake and the Nutella galore... so good!

This place was legit.  We showed up a little later so some most options were already gone.  For the options that were left, they definitely lived up to the hype.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone in need of a donut.  They will impress!
Got a chance to try Donut bar this morning and I must say it was soooo good. My family and I enjoyed it all. Also we received 3 free birthday donuts just for ordering. I can't wait to come back!
Awesome donuts. They really are as billed, the best donuts in the world. Terrific flavor combinations, wonderful atmosphere, accommodating staff. I just wish they were open later in the day.
Awesome, huge donuts! Great coffee. We were here for a mid day snack. Nice stop and in the summer heat of 105 it was nice and cool inside.

Awesome donuts they were very moist, soft and fresh!  I found my new donut bar! :). They also
make cake donuts!
this is probably my favorite donut place ever.  absolutely delicious.  will definitely return. only wish is that there was one closer to home ;-))

I don't understand the positive reviews. I have been at least 5 times (just to make sure there wasn't something i was missing), and they're terrible. These are some of the worst donuts in the valley. O Face had previously raised the bar at this same location, and donut bar slapped it right back down.

Fritters... "how can you mess up a fritter?" well they do. Grocery store fritters are better. Every donut tastes like stale bread with a different design or flavored icing on it. People must love stale bread. The cinnamon rolls are dry and burnt, with or without bacon - don't let them fool you.

The 2 stars are for their creme brulee donut, and their french toast donut. Creme brulee is really well made, and worth a trip itself. The french toast donut is really good too. French toast is a great use of giant pieces of stale bread. Just stay away from everything else

Absolutely fantastic. Such an approachable vibe, the people are helpful & nice and the donuts are WORTH THE HYPE. I recommend their famous Big Poppa Tart - it has a poptart INSIDE it. Other notable ones: birthday cake with an Oreo inside, blueberry cheesecake, and red velvet. Price is very reasonable for a "gourmet" donut. Also, Chef Jeff is the best 
Truly the #bestdonutsintheworld !
If you like donuts this place is a must.  Just get there early as they will sell out of the choice donuts.

Went here yesterday morning because of all the raves. They supposedly had the best doughnuts in the world.  We had the coconut, blueberry cheesecake, creme brulee and birthday cake oreo doughnuts. First of all they were all very dry. My daughter hated the birthday cake oreo doughnut, she said it was overly sweet, even when I took out the oreo it was still very sweet. We also ordered their strawberry milk and chocolate milk. They tasted like regular milk. Going there was a mistake. About 2 hours later my daughter started getting sick, my daughter is still suffering until now. I'll take Krispy Kreme over this place anytime.

Got here around 9 am on Saturday and line was okay. Some of the donuts are huge! But they are airy and worth the price for 4 we paid around $14. My boyfriend has the biggest sweet tooth and loved the Pop tart one I liked the cake batter. Will be here next time I'm in Vegas.

If you are craving a delicious donut, well....this is the place for you. They are huge and makes you want one everyday for breakfast. It's a bit pricey but well worth it for sure. The next time I am in Vegas, I will definitely be coming here for delicious donuts.

My husband and I just got married in Vegas, and instead of a cake (my mom almost spent $800 on a cake that feeds 20-30!), we got a shit-ton of donuts from Donut Bar for $250! We worked with Chef Jeff who was super prompt in responding to our emails, and he gave us everything we wanted. Very professional and reliable. 

We ordered 8 different types of donuts, including a few vegan ones and a dozen donuts with Vegas-y designs. Our flavors ranged from Lemon Pistachio to Nutella, so everyone was satisfied.

Overall, they were a huge hit, delicious, and a cheaper alternative!

I've been waiting to try these donuts for the past month. Reading reviews after reviews and finally said today is the day. Packed my family up and headed over, paid for parking and walked in. Small space but loads of beautifully decorated donuts behind the case.

Kids got the free monster Inc donuts, I ordered the strawberry split and creme brulee, hubby ordered an apple fritter and the espresso donut. I also wanted to try the pop tart donut and a few extras. $25 later we are walking out happy to try these award winning donuts.

My first bite of the strawberry split underwhelming, I could taste old oil along with a flavorless donut. after sampling the rest of them my family came to the same conclusion, the old oil taste took over the flavor of all the donuts and we were very disappointed after waiting so long to try these.

Located in downtown Las Vegas near Fremont Street, this donut shop is cranking out the most mouth watering, unique donuts I have come across!

Walking into the shop you can smell the coffee and the donuts being freshly baked. The donuts are displayed behind a glass from almost top to bottom and all look amazing. There is a little sign that tells you all of the flavors - there are a lot! The service here is great and they answer all your questions for you and are also REALLY patient - since there are so many options it is definitely hard to choose just a few. 

- Creme Brulee Donut - THIS IS A MUST GET! The crack of the hard sugar shell and the custard on the inside all inside a soft donut.. yes, please. ($2) This is a little bit smaller than some of the other selections, but you do not need much since it is very sweet and rich.
- French Toast Donut - another favorite, light, airy, and the perfect balance between a donut & french toast. Also comes with syrup, butter, and jam ($5)
- Birthday Oreo - A birthday cake donut with an oreo inside - this is the same size as the creme brulee donut
- Caramel Latte Donut - This one is huge! The frosting is exactly like a caramel latte
- Big Poppa Tart Donut - ALSO HUGE! Looks just like a huge pop tart and has strawberry filling on the inside. 
- Burning S'more (or something to that name?) - looked fancy and tasted like a fancy s'more. If you like s'mores, you'll like this. 

Serve Stumptown coffee here and make great Americanos. All our donuts and our coffee cost about $28 (this includes tax and tip) and we got two of each of the creme brulee and birthday donuts. The smaller donuts are less expensive and the bigger more expensive, but totally worth the splurge (might as well on donuts instead of losing it gambling, right?)

Can't wait to come back!

I absolutely love the donut bar! By far my favorite place to get some donuts. They have a crazy amount of donuts that are all different assortment of colors & flavors. I am super pleased every time I come here. You always get greeted with smiles & lots of energy. Even on holidays they dress up & make you feel awesome for being there. They had a margarita donut on cinco de mayo & I wish they would bring it back! But the creme brûlée donut is my all time fave! Always coming back to this place.

The atmosphere was great. The staff is awesome. The donuts look amazing, but I was not overly impressed with what I got. I had the creme brûlée donut and the Elvis donut. Maybe I was expecting too much. I regret not trying the other ones I had considered. 

The creme brûlée was weird. The burnt sugar didn't work for me with the donut. It was a little too thick and works much better when it's just over a custard. 

The Elvis had a peanut butter topping and a banana Bavarian cream center. Loved the peanut butter but hated the cream. It tasted like banana candy. Very artificial. I love banana and peanut butter, but real banana is better. 

Maybe I'll try it again in the future, but currently I don't think paying for parking is worth it.
The donuts are GREAT! They even give the kiddos free donuts certain days of the week. I still have yet to try the donut Icecream cones but looks so delicious when I see the pictures.

Three friends and I stopped in during our annual Vegas trip. We like to try the new and unique. This place did not disappoint.  Very friendly staff, quick service, and most importantly amazing donuts and delicious coffee. A little tricky to find but worth the 30 second search.

Overrated.

Stumbled upon "happy hour" and got a dozen of their donuts.  Was so hyped up due to the reviews.

Good ones: 
- Cream brulee: small and creamy
- Nutella overload: the nutella makes the donut
- Special of the day: Rasberry pistachio
- Good design on the donuts, huge portions

Not so good:do
- Butter beer
- Mud pie

MINUS one if not two star - the dough on almost every single one of their donuts are too dry and not soft/moist.  Example:  The butter beer donut was big and had great design, but when 85% of your dough is dry, you are left trying to eat the overly sweet cream to compensate.  Takes away from the overall enjoyment of the donut itself.

Best donuts in town!! Joe and Jeff are awesome!! The French toast donut is out of this world we love every donut we tried they have a homer donut it's a awesome huge pink donut with sprinkles for only $3 can't beat it! The bathroom is one of the coolest things in there! They have milk on Tap! Very cool place and yummy donuts!

I had all but given up finding a nice, big cup of coffee for a reasonable price downtown until I discovered this place!!!  I just moved about a block away and love swinging in for a cup of coffee on my way into work. They offer various iced coffee options (not really my style) including a "nitro" iced coffee on tap! The donuts are always delicious, but can't go for donuts too often if I want my clothes to fit! My go to is a large Hawaiian Hazelnut drip coffee, delicious and at only $2 a pop I can treat myself pretty often! The one and only downside is that the shop closes when they sell out of doughnuts, sometimes noon and sometimes 2:30-3 so I have missed my afternoon coffee a few times.

I finally had a chance to go here, mainly because my tattoo artist in conveniently next door ;) i didnt realize at the time but i was quite lucky to go in without having to wait in a long line that stretches around the building. Also, i was lucky enough to get donuts because, from what ive heard, they sell out frequently. 

I had a decent selection to choose from for it being midday. (One of the guys told me theres usually much more to choose from but they all sold out) i got the strawberry cheescake, peanut butter something, the elvis and an original. It was a "meh" for the original. The elvis was delectable, banana cream with caramel. The peanut butter was a little dry. As for the cheesecake, i cant comment because i ate it the next day.

Will definitely be going back again, mainly to try the churro-looking donut cone they have. Also, the staff was very friendly.

Insanely yummy!  Was able to sample three donuts (chocolate, maple and 'vanilla' with white icing) that appeared to merely-be oversized items that any supermarket store sells. The comparison ends there. Amazing!!  Seriously... who uses real vanilla bean in their donut glazes anymore? These guys do!  Whose donuts are like eating soft billow slices of cake? These are!  More please!

I was not impressed with the Donut Bar. The French toast donut and latte I got were pretty good, but everything else I tried was flavourless. Like a lot of other reviews mentioned, the sugar topping on the creme brûlée donut was way too thick, the red velvet donut was very dry and didn't taste like anything, and the Nutella donut was less dry but still had almost no flavour.
So fresh, ... So good! I was not a fan of the bacon bar. It was not good and not worth the $4 price tag.

Just had the Oreo cookie B-day cake donut 
Idk how many calories I just consumed but that thing was just outrageously delicious.....good thing that I live pretty far from their shop.

GET THE CREME BRÛLÉE DONUTS! I'm surprised more specialty donut shops don't do this. Super fluffy donuts filled with vanilla custard and topped with crunchy caramelized sugar. Not only are they delicious, they're also fun to eat. 

We also ordered a maple bourbon donut, a coconut donut, and a Boston cream donut. All were great! I wish we could've tried more. The shop is a cute little place and easy to find. I'm glad we tried it this time around.

Uhh . . . Portland (voodoo donuts) , we have a problem. These are amazing donuts. Strawberry stack, chocolate old fashioned, and creek brûlée with a hard shell! The strawberries are delicious and the whipped creams is light and fluffy! The old fashioned do it itself is not sweet at all and has a crunchy outside and the chocolate is dark and slightly sweet. The creme brûlée is amazing! The filling is a rich not-too-sweet custard. Wow!

I don't even like donuts, they tend to be too sweet. Huge fan!

Donuts are delicious! We tried the big poppa tart, vanilla bean donut and the chocolate milk (which was amazing by the way). They also have pretty cute shirts and hats. If in the area, you should support this donut shop!

Donut bar takes donuts to the next level. I have had three donuts from here (homer simpson, boston cream, oreo birthday) and all were great. There is a new menu each time with some staples. The donuts are $2-4 each but delicious and some are really meant for two people. They also have caffeine drinks. 

The location is a block off of Freemont so pretty easy to get to. But, it is pretty popular so don't wait too long to go. 

Go early, go hungry, buy some extra to go for later!
Love this spot. Creative, interesting donuts. Be sure to come early or they will sell out. I work near the area so it's easy for me to swing by some mornings. Good coffee too!

Tried their creme brulee donut, maple bacon donut, and crumb cake donut. All were as advertised! They even had a bogo deal so that made our donut experience that much sweeter. Only reason I'm marking off a star is because of their hours (they close at 1pm)... Sometimes I want a donut in the afternoon!

The donuts here are unique and tasty, but I am not crazy for them. I like to take friends who visit Vegas here because they have donuts like the Creme brûlée and pop tart donuts, which you can't just find anywhere, but you won't find a regular glazed here.

If you like really sweet donuts, this place is for you. If you like simpler donuts, you might want to find a different place.

on a recent trip a friend said to stop by and try the donuts and give him my thoughts... well not  a fan of the two donuts i had.... first i was surprised by the size of the donuts... huge. almost too big... i am not sure you can call them donuts.... doughnut planet in nyc has big doughnuts but these were far bigger..... the variety was varied and all interesting but the two i selected were flavor-less. vanilla bean and boston creme... the cakes of both had no flavor but the filling of the boston creme was delicious. the shop is cute enough and the people friendly but please donut bar invest in paper bags for the donuts..walking out of the shop with two donuts in a box seems like such a waste and not what the earth needs......

I'm a huge donut guy and people always mention Donut Bar in SD and they tell how great and amazing they are. I've never been to that location but I was in LV right when they had a soft opening of their new location there. Being the donut snub that I am, woke up at 7am and took an uber from the strip to their shop DTLV. 

I liked the shop a lot. Warm and inviting with lots of donuts on display and the staff was super friendly. I came all the way from the strip so I wasn't just gonna order a couple donuts, specially when everything looked so good. I ordered a dozen. 

The good donuts: homer, mexican chocolate, triple chocolate and big poppa tart. 
The not so good: old fashion, red velvet, s'mores and chocolate bar. 

As you can see they are good at making your typical donuts, but not so good at making cake donuts (which are my favorites). The old fashion donuts were really dry. Extremely disappointed by that since it's one I always enjoy. The red velvet and s'mores were also dry. Since I was paying a premium for each donut I was expecting high quality. 

However, the homer and mexican chocolate saved the trip. Those were HUGEEEE, really good, fresh, soft and delicious. If I ever go back those are the ones I would order again. 

I've come to realization that the over-the-top donut shops aren't my favorites. I've visited several ones with high expectations but I always end up a bit disappointed. Donut Bar was okay but not dying to comeback.

It's a neat place! I a little Ali Wong's definition of hipster. But my old age I felt comfortable. The donuts were huge and cooked like remember they were 35 years ago back in the dinosaur era.
My choices were an apple bacon fritter and a maple bacon log! I don't care what my wife and mother in law got, I had bacon in front of me! They said, " it was good they'd come back and tell others". I had their coffee and yes!, they'll make you what that startakeyurbucks place can make I believe I like this place better. Place is located downtown Vegas and the area is really becoming a great place geared towards us locals and giving us the non-commercial franchise associated crap local Las vegans are looking for!

Great little place!
Big do-NUTS!
Better caffeine beverages than StraveYourBucks!

To me I wouldn't call these the best doughnuts, but it was good! The shop is cute and staff are super helpful in helping you, if you have any questions. I was super excited about the cream brûlée donut, but that was just ok the outside was nice like a candy shell, but they center was too much like vanilla pudding instead of cream brûlée taste. But, my kids loved the Oreo, vanilla glazed and the Nutella dough nut. ---extra points for the vanilla glaze doughnut, one of the more simple doughnuts they offer but hits the spot---
Awesome place for donuts!!! I would recommend the pb&j donut as well as the strawberry cake donuts. Friendly people and big delicious donuts!

The donuts are amazing! It's no wonder why they go quick. Whatever Jeff and his staff are doing behind the scenes they definitely should not stop. I had ordered an assortment for a birthday party donut wall and Donut Bar LV did not disappoint, it was a total hit!
One of the best donut shops in Vegas! We had the creme brûlée, lemon cream, and strawberry cream donuts and they were all delicious and fresh but the lemon was my favorite. The coffee was good too.

Doh!! This place is a no brainier for the best donuts in Las Vegas!! The Homer is a must for any Simpons fan who loves donuts. Great tasting and super creative creations won't disappoint as long as you get here early

I finally got to try their creme brulee donut after seeing it in a facebook video. Wow the donut does not disappoint! The crack is pretty loud and wished it delivered through the video that I posted. The donut itself tastes even better (as if the crack wasn't enough). It wasn't overly sweet like I thought it would be. The custard was smooth and delicious. I wish I ordered more. I also got the blueberry cheesecake donut, which I didn't eat until 12 hours later. It was still delightful to me, but I'm sure it would've tasted even better if I ate it fresh. For $2 per donut, this place wins my heart! Not a bad drive from the strip either :)

DONUT have one!!! LOL. Amazing donuts. The crime brûlée donuts are so fun to crack open, but my fave was the red velvet donut.  Worth the über ride to get there. My 2 wishes... Closer to the strip and if they deliver to California.
100% naughty goodness!!! Yum meter is 11 out of 10!! Gourmet donuts done right. You can't go wrong here.

Great customer service, yummy diet killers; I mean donuts This place is so cute and it close to the freeway so you can run in before work and still make it on time. Not and everyday place but definitely an occasional allowance.

Def a fan. 

Keep in mind these donuts are very fresh and do not do what I did and leave a Strawberry Shortcake one out in the box on the counter overnight. 
It will turn into a green fuzzy science experiment.

Hubby went at 8am one morning and when I woke up I woke up to a dozen vegan donuts...ummmmm no way we were going to eat all that madness. 

This review is for the vegan donuts only.

I found my fav was the green tea. Second fav was the creme brûlée.

Just get what you are going to eat that day...they will hit the bin the next day if not :)

Easily one of the best Donut shops in the world. Excellent customer service, consistently good donuts. Great deals on donuts when they need to sell out. Additionally they sometimes give balloons and free donuts to children.

I was originally just going to get one donut because my pastry threshold is usually one but after stepping inside Donut Bar you quickly realize how hard it is to just buy one. That's why we have two hands right, to double fist in morning sugar rushes?

I ended up getting their signature Creme Brulee and a Nutella bar with a Cold Brew. If the donuts didn't do me in, the coffee did because it rocked my Friday morning. It was all so good I bought a round back for my co-workers to share the wealth.


TIP: This cute, cramped donut shop is literally always popping so make sure you strategically find parking beforehand!
This place is amazing! The donuts are always fresh and delicious. The staff is energetic and courteous. The Big Poppa Tart is a foodie lover's dream come true!

It's a doughnut shop. If you like specialty Donuts you'll probably like this place. Personally I'm not a big doughnut fan and the one I tried was just incredibly sweet. Too sweet in my opinion but others may not think so. Service was very good and friendly. Their lattes are horrible however. On top of that I burnt my mouth on the first sip. I like giving other businesses over Starbucks my money when it comes to specialty coffees but I have to look for someplace other than Donut Bar to get one.

I've tried donut bar before, but I came here for the ice cream donut cone. They don't serve them til after 10 am, so plan accordingly if you want to try it. 

I also ordered the creme brûlée and strawberry cheesecake. The creme brûlée has a hard caramelized top that I think is way too thick. The filling inside was really good, however the donut itself was a little dry. The strawberry cheesecake had an ample amt of filling but the dough was also dry. Onto the reason I came here...the cone isn't really a donut. It's more like a pastry covered in sugar. The soft serve was good, but for $6, would I get it again? No

This place is a cool concept for sure. Donuts and beer. This makes sense to me. Every day their vegan selection changes and you take your chances if you don't get there early. But since they do change out their vegan selection you might be able to try a variety of flavors in just a few visits. The service has been great the two times I've been in. Sadly I haven't even paired a donut with a beer just yet. I'm slacking on my day drinking apparently. All the donuts look awesome and I'm sure are good. I've heard good things about the samoa Girl Scout style donut. I've had the creme brûlée... I wish it had more filling. Had to eat the whole donut before finding any filling until the last  bite. I am anticipating some flavors like the spiced chai for sure. I will definitely be back and you should swing by if you haven't yet. They close at 1pm and happy hour is just before. You could score two for one!

Stumptown coffee, amazing gigantic donuts...get here early or they will run out of your favorites. Free parking around the corner in the lot by the juice store. Met  the owner and founder ...everyone in there is so nice. Will have to be back soon too many good choices.

While enjoying a healthy breakfast from Smoothe Eats, the owner told me he also owned this cool donut shop! We tried it, loved how sweet they were, but left it to a one time treat to ourselves! Their donuts are HUGE, but they also have normal size donuts as well!

We had our wedding donuts from Donut Bar and it was absolutely amazing!  Jeff was so easy to work with, and helped us to pick out whatever flavors we wanted.  They were such a hit at the wedding everyone was asking where they came from and wanted to go back for more!  We chose them for the Vegan options and were completely in love with everything we tried. Thank you so much!  Will definitely be back.

I had their pink sprinkles and creme brulee. There was nothing special about them. The filling for the creme brulee was one sided and minimal. The pink sprinkles one was not even moist on the inside. It was very dry. And even with a mustache, the lady called me ma'am lol.

The donuts are awesome. Great selection of specialty donuts and regular. The service staff greeted me immediately and then the manager came over and had a conversation with us before we left. I will definitely be back!

We had the pop tart donut, cremé brûlée and an Oreo donut. The place is super small, but the courtyard behind is cute and nice to sit in. We went around 1030 and they were already running out of donuts though, so I'd recommend you get there earlier than that!

Love me some Donut Bar. Sorry Ace, Ronalds, and Real Donuts, but Donut Bar has the BEST yeast-raised donuts in the Valley. This has become my go to stop for donuts in Vegas.

Donut Bar is my usual go to stop for dessert after I take a visit to the ol' PublicUs. I heard a lot about the buzz going on, how it was considered to be the best donut place in the country, so on and so forth. I just had to check it out for myself, and for the most part, its awesome. Awesome-sauce even.

Donuts are a personal thing, everyone has different likes and expectations when they have a donut. Let me tell you mine. I'm a big fan of brioche-style donuts, ones you normally see on dessert menu's at high end restaurants. So that means I like a sturdier type of donut, one where the chewing experience is very important to me. There are some that like the lighter versions of donuts, where they sort of disappear after you start chewing on them. For myself, I'm not a big fan of those types of donuts. That's where Donut Bar comes in. It does remind me of those amazing brioche style textured donuts, with an incredible mouthfeel, and flavor that is on point. I do like the fillings and creams that they use, they are all balanced, without being too sweet, and they are full of bright, impactful, flavors. IMO, their yeasted donuts are the perfect donut.

The coffee here is outstanding. They use a Stumptown bean, and they offer drip coffee's as well as cold brew, all of it is on point. The service here is also outstanding, everyone is helpful and friendly, and they do a great job.

So you are probably wondering why this isn't a 5 star review. Well, I'll tell ya. While their yeast-raised donuts are 5 star all the way... their cake donuts to me are just OK. And trust me, I've tried my best to like them. I've ordered them on three separate occasions, and it just wouldn't click for me. It might be a texture thing, I like my cake donuts to have a slightly crisp, thin exterior, with a super soft interior. But oh well.

I'll be back, their yeasted donuts are one of my obsessions. Haven't had a fritter yet because they are usually sold out. But you just wait, I will find you, and I will have my day.

By the way, Best Music Playlist.. Ever.

SO GOOD AND SO MANY OPTIONS! I had a field day when I walked in here and it took me at least 10 minutes to make a decision. 

I first tried the Boston cream donut and while it was delicious, it tasted a little bit too fried. I'd get it again but I'd prefer if it weren't as oily. 

I tried mud pie next and I couldn't stop eating it, it was so good. It has a peanut butter drizzle on it, which I don't like too much, so I'd probably try something different next time but the donut part was so good and not too fried like the Boston cream. 

I'm obsessed with the look of the homer donut and will have to try it someday. FYI the menu is posted every day on their instagram!

Get there EARLY I've heard they have crazy lines. I went around 830 on a Monday and we were the only ones there. I'm sure the weekends are insane.

By far the best donuts I have ever had. I traveled all the way from NYC and it was do worth it. They have a great variety and the pricing is beyond reasonable. I will definitely be visiting again if I go back to Vegas.

Best donut place ever! I went here and got a blueberry cheesecake donut on Friday, and it was heaven! The owner of the Vegas location was so nice, and he was helping his employees serve donuts to the customers which was awesome. The people who I was with got a cake batter donut and a regular cinnamon sugar one, and I tried a few bites of theres, and they were amazing! I live in LA, and I hope they will open one (or many)  there ASAP, because it would be wildly successful, and I would eat there a ton. Until then, I will be coming back to this location and all the others and getting new donuts. I heard the poptart donut there is the most popular, and I think they ran out, but I hope to try that next time.

THE BEST DONUTS I'VE EVER HAD!!!

I'm a sucker for raised donuts and their raised donuts are THE BOMB!! There's one close to home but I can never get myself to drive there before the donuts sell out. Thus, since I'm a donut fiend I made it a mission to come here since I was staying on the strip. I absolutely loved the caramel latte donut, it was my favorite. The French toast donut was made to order and it was so fluffy and good. I also got the mud pie and Creme brûlée donut and they were amazing as well. I wish I got to try all of the donuts but that would be too much for a small girl like me haha. I couldn't believe that their strawberry split was vegan and it was huge!! I came with my cousin's gf and sister and they're vegans and they couldn't believe it either. We were all in heaven and were in awe the whole time. The prices aren't bad either considering the amount of dough you're getting! I need to come back here whether in SD of LV to try the other flavors and come back for the caramel latte donut.

This place is such a hidden gem!! So many choices of delicious looking donuts! And they taste as good as they look! They have indoor and outdoor sitting! Perfect place to bring the whole family. Did I mention you can get a donut cone filled with ice cream!!!  Check this place out!

Absolutely love this place. We come here every chance we get and they never disappoint. Today is their 2nd anniversary and they have face painting for the children, raffles and donut eating contest. They're also giving a free birthday cake donut to everyone. The staff is always very friendly and they're French toast donut is very yummy.

This place was good. Gotta go early it will get sold out. It's always jumping but good. It's worth the wait in my opinion and a cool atmosphere. I will be going again in the future because there's more I need to try
Cute little place in downtown LV with some unique donuts. My personal fave was the Lemon Pistachio giant donut. The staff is friendly & the shop is clean with a trendy decor.

such an amazing hole in the wall donut shop!!!! what's pictured is two boxes for $20 dollars  they said it was happy hour time and one box is $10 dollars and you fill it up as much as you can!! My favorite donut was the strawberry cheesecake one and the crepe brûlée! the other picture is churro ice cream cones I was expecting more for the churro ice cream donut cones especially cause they're $6 dollars, the ice cream wasn't up to my standards but you can get chocolate syrup or caramel syrup on it! The donut shop is about 7-10 minutes away from stratosphere.

Had a work trip to Vegas, but had to figure out my own accommodations off-strip for one night. I mostly buckled down and did work, but after getting up early the next morning, I checked out Yelp to find out this place was right down the street. My cold brew was stellar but my whipped cream strawberry donut extravaganza was the real star. Started to walk out the door. Went back for some cream brulee bites. Was not disappointed. 

I was in and out in a minute and had a delicious breakfast, so I had no complaints!

On a recommendation from a LV friend, we ventured to downtown to grab custom donuts. Now, I may be biased as I am a hardcore Simpson's fan and the shop paid homage to Mr. Donut (Homer Simpson), but the donuts we had were truly delicious without being an overly heavy donut. Which was good seeing as how it was 112 degrees out. 

The creme brûlée was fantastic, only to be trumped by the chocolate espresso donut. Loved it. Thanks Donut Bar!!!

I'm not a huge donut fan, but Donut Bar's funky treats are hard to turn down- their DTLV location and available-til-sold-out hours make an actual visit fairly rare for me, but I've come across their donuts at various events and on appreciation tables at work pretty regularly. 

I've enjoyed the Salted Caramel, Mexican Hot Chocolate, Blood Orange and Creme Brulee donuts, while the  Big Poppa Tart makes a good one to share, huge and stuffed with an actual Pop Tart and likely several days worth of sugar. I tried the Matcha on a recent visit and it was okay, small and not too sweet, but the Strawberry Split has my heart- fresh fruit, whipped cream, photogenic and shareable! Eventually I need to go back for the Caramel Latte donut and their Grilled Cheese.

TIP: Go early and check their online menu to be sure they have what you want, selection varies daily.

Love these donut... fresh everyday they range to $2-$5 each I love the Nutella and Burlee... worth the wait if u want to get the first dibs come early coz it does get a long line. The place is really small so expect it to be crowded when they open.

I'm not a fan of fancy donuts. I've always just stuck with chocolate and glazed. nothing else appealed to me. but I LOVE these donuts. I could eat them every day. the pop tart one looked cool but I thought it'd be disgusting. but surprisingly it was my favorite one. nutella over load was amazing also. I didn't like strawberry cream cheese, it was really dry and just tasted like stale strawberry cake. I also didn't like the creme brule.

Came here again because of my colleagues. Of course I decide to order donuts. This time I decide to try something different and ask questions. Don't ask questions because you will get attitude. My colleagues love the fact the girls demeanor changed to rude towards me. You sell donuts lady and you have a customer service job. Smile and put the donuts in the box and the cashier will ring me up. The donuts are good. Yes, they are because they are donuts. The workers there need to humble down. The previous donut shop had the customer service and the downtown vibe.

I eat approximately two donuts a year on average. Not really my thing. Someone brings in a box of donuts to work and I'm not even tempted. Bad for you and I just never find they are really very good.

On our trip to Vegas in April I was doing my research on Yelp and saw the rave reviews on Donut Bar. Heather and I decided to grab a coffee and wander over on our first slightly hungover morning in Sin City. Am I ever glad we did.

The donuts here are next level. So many tasty, colourful creations to choose from. We decided to share a Mexican Hot Chocolate Donut and a Maple Bacon Cinnamon Roll. Both were out of this world. The Donut was fresh and fluffy like nothing I had tried before. The chocolate and marshmallows were perfect. The Maple Bacon Cinnamon Roll stole the show however. The huge chunks of crispy bacon and the perfect blend of crunchy, chewy, sweet and gooey Cinnamon Roll made for an amazing morning treat I raved about all weekend.

A place you must stop in and try just blocks from Fremont Street!

The good: service was great! The Filipino girl at the front line is a great ambassador. She's really warm and super helpful. And despite getting our drink order wrong, she was apologetic and quickly made good on their error. 

The not so good: the donuts are okay. Great novelty flavors, names and combos. But none it them really knocked our socks off. They make for great photos but none of them made me feel like I had to go out of my way to come back here. 

I didn't realize it's the same franchise as the Donut Bar in San Diego.

I've been here twice during my travels to Vegas and I've lucked out on skipping long lines when I've visited. I follow them on Instagram, which I would suggest to anyone interested in going, as they always have updated menus and will let their customers know of any new donuts. I've tried a variety of their donuts: creme brûlée, bacon cinnamon roll, strawberry cream, French toast and more. French toast donuts are only available on weekends and those are must-haves!

They also have a homemade strawberry milk which reminds me of when I had strawberry Quik as a kid. :)
The donuts were good but there is no sitting area. I little disappointed drove from San Diego to try it.

I, like everyone else, saw the creme brulee cracking video on Facebook, so i had to try this place. I was in town for my bachelorette party, but i visit every month so its like I still live here.
I ordered a shit ton of donuts the night before because that's the only way u can try these donuts and guarantee you get what they make that day, without waiting in line.
Metered parking out front, long ass line out the door.
Walked right up and asked for my order. Was prompt, staff was friendly.
Donuts were meh.
The best part was cracking the donut in person. Everything else was grocery store quality.

What a beautiful donut shop- shop is an understatement. It's a glamorous display of gluten-laden deep-fried sugar-coated creatively crafted creations that just don't seem to be fairly priced! Those babies should cost at least 50% more!  The intense labor and attention to detail explains the wicked narrow window of when it is open... I empathize with the time demands and being a slave to crafting such treats, so it's cool to limit hours. Otherwise, they would sacrifice worker sanity, donut quality and artistic freedom to the confines of clock time.

Anyhow.... they have vegan donuts. I repeat, they have vegan donuts. Not the kind that you see and think, "oh, those are the vegan ones." Oh no, you wouldn't even care they are vegan or even know the difference, dear donut aficionados!  Though Judy there one day, of the 4 vegan choices, 3 looked amazingly divine, and all looked just like the rest! Strawberry split?! Apple fritter?! Creme brûlée?! Who doesn't want those if you are going to eat a gluten-laden donut?!

Truly beautiful donuts! I also love that they have some esteemed coffee here to compliment the divine donuts. Stumptown, baby!

The line is long but worth the wait. Everyone is happy here- from staff to customers. The decor has an old-fashioned feeling to harken back to days when people didn't care about carbs as bad for the diet and brain? I love that they put your treats in an open box until they ring you up on the register.

A must try if you eat donuts with gluten- truly beautiful artistic creations. You'll be so happy!
The best place in town, the best place to visit and the best donuts in town! I can't forget the great taste. Amazing staff!!!
How could I give the Donut Bar any less than 5stars? Of course the donuts were on point. This shop is located in the Art District that is totally worth checking out.
Good vegan selection, and so good. Friendly staff especially the owner.

This place is okay, but not amazing. Surprisingly they still had a pretty large selection on a Saturday at 1pm. I've had the Creme brulee donut, the big poppa tart, Samoa, cheesecake, lemon blueberry, birthday cake, and the shortcake. None of them stood out as delicious, and the dough that they use for their donuts is too dense for me. Most of them were too sweet as well. If you come here, I just recommend getting the Creme brulee donut so you can record a video to make your friends jealous. The donut itself was overly sweet.
Amazing! I highly recommend the maple apple beacon fritter! Wowzers!!! Their coffee is on point.

Brought the family Sunday morning and had a very pleasant greeting upon entry. 
Chef Jeff came out with a handfull of balloons and put smiles on my kids faces with the choice of a free balloon and one free "insideout" themed donut.
The establishment itself is very clean with limited seating inside but the have an awsome relaxing patio outside in the back. 
The donuts themselves taste so amazing as I tried the french toast and butter beer donut. It's not over the top sweet and the donuts are larger than how they appear in the pictures.  I wanted to order more but I gotta save my cravings for another for sure visit.
I can see why this place is so popular it is definitely a place that you wanna come and bring a crowd the more donuts the better

We went during happy hour!! (About 12.30pm) you can fit as many donuts as you can in their big rectangle box for $10. Or they have buy 1 get 1. The donuts were absolutely delicious. There didn't seem to be the full selection that's written on the daily board, but that could be due to the time of day we went. I love this area and it's a refreshing little dessert place to try when you are in the area or are going for a specific treat!

Tried this place after hearing about the hype. Had to wake up extra early so try all the flavors before they sold out. This was not worth the hype, we got a dozen doughnuts since we don't live in Vegas. The special doughnuts weren't anything special. The creme brulee didn't have enough filling nor did the other flavors. All the doughnuts tasted normal, flavors weren't special or "wow" about them compared to most normal doughnut shops. I've had better doughnuts in the east coast. This was such a disappointment.

What a waste of time and drive! Came here to buy donuts to take back to LA to our kids for Valentine's day. If your website says you close at 1pm you should make enough donuts to be open till that time....especially on Valentine's Day when you know ppl probably give them as gifts! Paid for parking too only to walk over and find that they wrote on the window that they were sold out and it's only 11:30am! It was dark inside so I'm sure they just didn't run out! Bad customer service and bad planning on owners part! I don't care if you have 4.5 stars on Yelp if your customer service sucks! Won't return! Don't care how good the donuts are!

Donuts were delicious as expected and I am so glad I stopped by for them before leaving Vegas. I ordered the peanut butter chocolate donut and it tasted like crushed Reese's blended into a cake. 

I wished some of the donuts had chocolate/Nutella based filling though for chocolate lovers like myself.

We loved this donut bar! Where else can you choose to have beer or coffee with a donut?! We also loved the donuts. They had such a variety. I tried their pop tart donut and it was soooo good. I had the strawberry and my fiancé had the chocolate pop tart. They are a pound each. So we didn't eat the whole thing but it was awesome to try. It's cute and small and the staff is awesome. They give you suggestions on which donuts to try based on what you like. It's definitely a place to try if you're even close to Fremont Street.

3.5 Love all the flavor choices and cool decorations. My favorite had to be the lemon pistachio, was a little disappointed with the creme brûlée and that was the one I was so looking forward to try. Staff was very nice and helpful. Clean bakery with the racks of fresh donuts. Used Yelp deal for a free large coffee with purchase of a dozen.

First fell in love with donut bar in San Diego! They have the best donuts around. They are always moist and the breeding isn't too dry. They have so many options to chose from including a super unique donut called "big poppa tart" it has a pop tart inside of the donut, a must try and a favorite.

When I first saw the creme brûlée donut on Facebook, I knew that I had to try it the next time I was in Vegas. Well, the 'next time' was much sooner than I thought. 

And for those of you who don't know what I'm talking about, go Google the creme brûlée donut now and watch a video of it in action. It's just one those things where words won't do it justice. 

The thing about Donut Bar is that it is open until the store runs out of donuts. Therefore, I recommend getting there when it opens or going on a weekday. My friends and I got there on a Tuesday morning around 10am, and there wasn't a line. The best part was that there was a ton of creme brûlée donuts available!

We tried the pistachio lemon, maple bacon, strawberries & cream, and the creme brûlée donuts. Out of everything I tried, the creme brûlée is my favorite. The sugar coating is thick and tough, making it impossible to 'crack' with a plastic spoon. The cream filling inside is not too sweet and delicious. The other donuts are the cake kind, which is not my favorite. They're good -- a solid 4 where the creme brulee is a 4.5

I wanted to go here our whole trip, and we finally made it on the last day. The donut selection is amazing and everything looks divine! We ordered the creme brûlée donut, as the girl working told us it is their best seller, as well as the maple bacon bar. 

Creme Brûlée Donut: Very good, except for the fact that it took four bites before we got any filling. We genuinely thought it was just dough with a sugar topping and were sooo disappointed, so when we finally got to the filling we were relieved! It was tasty, but I wish it had more filling in it, as the bites without it just weren't good. 

Maple Bacon: Super yummy! There was a ton of salty bacon on top, which balanced the sweet maple frosting well. 

I would definitely come back here, and next time I would order something more exciting. A lot of the specialty donuts are HUGE, which is what kept us from ordering them this time.

This is a nice treat after being so good all week! The menu options are very well rounded and they take simple American favorites and turn it up a notch! One of my faves is the PB&J. It's a jelly filled donut with a peanut butter frosting on top. So good. They give free donuts to the kiddos on the weekends which helps when you're waiting in line for sure! The cold brewed coffee is also really good! The kids love picking out their own huge donuts which they never quite finish in one sitting. Disclaimer: if you go there really hungry like I did there is a chance you'll leave with more and have extras for the next day! :)

Donut bar has got to be the coolest donut spot in Las Vegas. Didn't realize how spoiled I was until they stopped popping up to Las Vegas Farmers Market where I work. I mean, every week I got at least one donut when they were there at LVFM. It was incredibly difficult to resist.

Their shop downtown is the cutest and they  have the most delicious nitro (and regular) coffee to pair with your donut. 
The employees here are sweet, patient and understanding of the tricky task of selecting the right donut - picking the right donut takes careful consideration when there's a bajillion options! 

I'm vegan so I usually do the apple fritter (holy shit) or caramel brûlée
Such a cute spot! Donut Bar defiently lives up to the buzz that is going around. Went here with a client after they recommended it. Will be back asap!!

There was only few donuts to select through and it was just basic donuts. This was my first time going and will be my last time going. No high chairs in there for my baby. 
Stay away from this place. This is not a donut bar with only 3 choices to choose from.

I'm gonna be honest, I think this place is way over-rated/over-hyped. My boyfriend is a fan. I like their donuts, but it's not my favorite donut place in town. I like the flavor options, but a lot of the stuff I'd otherwise want comes on an old-fashioned donut, and I find their old-fashioned to be super dry. I did have some kind of beer batter donut once that was mind-blowing, but have tried more donuts that I didn't care for from here than ones I have liked. I'm not saying they're bad by any means, but it's definitely not worth the drive to me - shout out to their marketing team for getting this place to blow up!
Tried their blood orange (big ol' donut) and strawberry cream cheese. Both are very sweet and soft. Lots of good choices. Latte was good and right temp. Stop by early as they close early.

We had high expectations for this place.  By 10am, they only had a very small selection left - none of the ones that the place is known for were available.  My regular coffee did not taste good at all.  Very nice service and a pretty back patio but nothing to write home about.

The donuts are huge!!! I ordered the Creme brûle donut and it was a satisfying experience to break it open. The donuts were fluffy and not too overwhelming. Sad that I don't have this in my city! Definitely a place to visit when you're in Vegas.
The grilled cheese donut was amazing! Friendly service.  A hidden gem in downtown Las Vegas.
Oh my god some of the best donuts in town it's a must check out. Freaking donuts are like the size of a fucking pancake it's ridiculous but it's so fucking good.
Wow... great donuts and super nice employees. We tried a half dozen donuts and they were all fantastic

If you're a fan of really funky sweet doughnuts piled high with toppings then look no further. There's no shortage of selection here on creative doughnuts. 

The vibe is fun and hip, very friendly staff and no complaints here on the coffee. 

I will say it's aggressively priced, which is understandable seeing as how they load up most of their doughnuts, but when you're just wanting a good old fashioned or a buttermilk bar, maybe not the best fir what you're paying. Their doughnuts run basically double what any other doughnut shop in town runs.

I was surprised to see so many four and five star reviews for the Donut Bar.  I give it a solid three stars which is A-Ok.  I work within walking distance and deiced to give it a try this past Thursday.  The donut was okay but not near one of the best I've ever had.  The prices are crazy high for a single donut and I do not think you get a discount on a dozen.  I guess overpriced donuts are the current trend and people have no problem paying between $2 and $4 per donut.  I had a strawberry frosted donut at $3 and it was just okay and nothing special.

I think the Donut Bar opens a little late at 7:00 and misses the people that want to pickup donuts before going into the office.  I usually go to Real Donuts or Pink Box Donuts and both places are open very early.  I probably will not go back as I'm content with run of the mill donuts from the other places I listed above.  

I will say the staff at the Donut Bar is very friendly and welcoming.  They greet eat each customer when arriving and offer to answer any questions.

This donut bar is a must see!! Off of Carson and 6th in a old motel. The workers inside are so friendly. On Saturday and Sunday they give children a free donut how cool is that!!! You must go see the store and taste them.

HOLY MOLY the vegan creme brûlée donut was the best thing sweet treat that's hit my mouth this week. I had their Hawaiian hazelnut drip coffee with almond milk and it was the best combo with my donut. 
This place sells out incredibly fast, so come first thing in the morning!!

THE BEST DONUTS EVER! Anytime I'm craving sweets this is were i go. You can satisfy any craving with all the different options and you can tell they're made with love!! Joe & Jeff are the nicest guys as well!!

This place was amazing. Drive by on my way to the golden nugget and decided to check it out. They had a great staff and great selection of donuts. I tried their strawberry shortcake and it was amazing. I was amazed by their selection. The prices were not too bad either. Definitely returning again.
Incredible donuts.  Beautiful and tempting to look at, delicious to eat.  Very reasonably priced.  A grand slam!

The last time I visited in the afternoon, the Donut Bar was closed because they had sold out for the day. Came a bit early yesterday and fell in love with their donut selection. I can't believe they sold out of Butterbeer donuts a few minutes after I checked out. Definitely coming back for more! Their donuts are fluffy and delicious. Not soggy the next day either.

This place is YUMMY.  The donuts are HUGE and FUN.  I love the flavors, the donuts here are the best. I could not decide so I bought so many, we took them home to share with others.. You must go here..

These donuts are a dream come true! I have been trying to go for a while now and I finally got to taste these delicious creations! They do sell out quickly so be sure to go early in the morning. I got the nutella donut and it was amazing. They have some very creative pastries like the Big Poppa which has an entire pop tart baked inside! The staff is very friendly as well. Great service and great donuts what more could anyone ask for?

Donuts. On. Steroids. I mean massive!

Walked in on Tuesday morning around 11:50 with a friend with the understanding that all the good donuts would be picked over. Wasn't wrong about that one, except that they had what both of us came in for. I was shocked to here that they did sell out 70% or something like that of the flavors... I saw plenty to choose from. The employee helping us was warm and was happy to help us with our selections. 

I chose the birthday cake donut with sprinkles because, duh. But also because it was of normal donut size. My second choice would have been the homer but I had errands to run and didn't want to leave the donut in my car in warm weather. My friend chose a chocolate donut. The big kind and he got through half. I ordered a glass of milk while he ordered a coffee. In regards to my donut, I wasn't blown away. It isn't the best I've had because I've had really great, moist donuts that taste extremely fresh, but there's no reason I wouldn't return to Donut Bar for more donuts. It's the first donut shop I've tried since I've been out here so my next couple visits will be in comparison to Donut Bar. I do appreciate the uniqueness they bring to something so classic, I was told they had donuts with a pop tart inside. I got cavities just thinking about it, but innovative concept to say the least. Attractive frosting and designs but traditional as far as donuts are concerned. 

It was a fabulous day out, a cool off after a hot couple of days. We were happy to find we could sit outside where there is a communal patio of the neighboring shops. It's clean and inviting, likely bustling in the warmer weather. I appreciated the art work on the buildings as well. 

I had intended to eat my donut and go back in to order a couple for others. To our surprise in 20 minutes 90% of their stock we walked into had vanished. No they had not put them away, they sold them! I was told they sell out daily! I think there's benefits to showing up fashionably late around the time they close (1p) - you get a bargain! Selection is sparse though at that point - you've been warned. 

Shout out to the bathroom - Homer Simpson, Family Guy art, loved it! Also loved the merch though I didn't purchase. Street parking is readily available around the block and you are in super close proximity to Fremont Experience for you tourists. 

I'll be heading back to try new flavors!

We used to go to this other donut place close to our house, but have stopped patronizing them because of their rude costumer service. Last Mother's Day, my hubby asked me where I wanted to go, and since I have been craving donuts and had the donut bar bookmarked for a while, I asked to go here. It was quite a bit of a drive considering we live in southwest, but we decided to go anyway. We got here around 12:30-1ish, and they only had a few selections left. Don't know if it was because it was Mother's Day, but the lady behind the counter informed us that because of the limited selection, we could get a box for $10 and fill it with as much donuts as we could fit. Although the creme brûlée donut was sold out and it was slim pickins, we were still able to get a decent amount of very yummy donuts. What would normally be a donut worth $3 a pop, we were able to get a full box for only $10! My favorite amongst our choices was the caramel latte donut. I thought it would have been too sweet, but it was actually just the right amount of sugar. Another favorite was the espresso donut, even though I'm not a big fan of the cake kind. We brought the box back to my in-laws house, and everyone was raving about the donuts. 

Fast forward to today-- My husband, son, and I had a hankering for donuts and braved the early Sunday morning drive to downtown. We got to the donut bar just a couple minutes shy of 8am and there was already a long line outside the door, waiting for the store to open. When 8am rolled around, the chef (?) opened the door and gleefully greeted the people waiting in line, and then proceeded to usher everyone in. We could smell the freshly made donuts before even stepping foot inside the store, which only fueled our hunger more. Upon stepping inside, it was such a different experience from when we went during Mother's Day. The cases were full of different flavored donuts, both fried and cake donuts alike. I truly felt like a kid in a candy store! The girl behind the counter offered our son a free inside-out themed donut, which I thought was really thoughtful-- they really cater to their customers at this place! Anyways, it was so hard for me to order since I wanted to try everything!!!! But we settled on the French toast donut (which was made to order ), a creme brûlée donut (obviously a crowd favorite), a Samoa, and a chocolate euphoria for my son. The French toast donut was good, different, and well worth a try. The cup of stumptown coffee they serve there went great with the donut. The Samoa was pretty good but, as I'm not a big fan of cake donut (my hubby is), I think I can pass on that next time. My son enjoyed his chocolate euphoria, and started picking on the chocolate shavings as soon as the donut arrived. Last but not the least, the star among the donuts we chose, the creme brûlée donut. It was quite small, but for only 2 bucks, it was a steal! My hubby did say that the caramelized sugar on top was a bit thick, but we both agreed that the donut was great and surprisingly not as sweet as we thought it would be. The creme brûlée filling was smooth and velvety, just how it should be, and accompanied the donut very well. I would honestly come back here just for another one of that donut, but I would be lying if I didn't say I want to try more. I might just have to make it mandatory that we go here every Sunday so we could try out a different donut each time. The strawberry shortcake donut they had looked mighty good, as well as the s'mores donut... I'm drooling just thinking about it XD

Although there are plenty other donut shops close to our house, the drive to downtown just to go to donut bar is well worth it. Not only are their donuts great, but all the associates we've had the chance to encounter were all so sweet, helpful, and personable. No wonder people keep flocking this place. Customer service is obviously a priority on their list, and there is nothing better than that... Aside from the donuts, of course lol. Donut bar, you have just gained new loyal customers who will try to frequent your place every Sunday :)

so reading the reviews for this shop, I was expecting some deliciousness, some extraordinary, some awesomeness and all I got was another "wtf" moment, and a feeling of "should I call and complain and ask for my money back"...I mean, I dropped $25 for 8 donuts...ya let's get to the review...

so I found myself in the downtown area recently, and remember hearing about a donut that crunched on top, looked it up and was happy it was there. so I drove over to the spot in downtown, and checked it out.

walked into the shop, it's small, narrow, but it gets right to the point. the display of donuts was very nice. they all look delicious, and in my mind I was excited to finally try the assortment I was putting together. I went for 2 of the creme brulee donuts, one that I think had a velvet cake inside, one of the poptart donuts, a white sprinkle, and a chocolate top one and some others. total was $25 (price shock hits, it's donuts!!) but ok I paid it, drove home and dove in with wifey. this is where it just went wrong.

now, I usually don't take photos, but recently I have been of the meals and stuff I'm eating or places I'm going to, and this place got the picture...

every single donut we ate was dry. they were all over cooked I guess. the batter used had no flavor or sweetness. the flavors were not there, it was like trying to enjoy it but not...I only took a bite or 2 of each donut and trashed it. throughout the day just picked at them all. when I got the one that crunches, the creme brulee one, I was just SO let down. the taste was honestly gross. that mixture of the crunch on the top of your mouth, then mixing it with a soft/dry donut that has no flavor was just really gross. and I'm not picky, especially when it comes to what should have been sweet and delicious, was a major fail.

again, every donut was dry, and they all had no flavor or bland flavoring. even the pop tart donut was a bust. the cake mix they use is just no good. I don't know if it was that day or what, but no go for me.

now, I've tried pink box donuts which was ok. the only donut shop here in town that seems to be excellent every time is Winchells on Meadows Lane with the subway. that place is 5 star superb.

I understand though, this donut bar place, it made it on tv or whatever, and people want to see it, but all these 5 star reviews  is just not possible if it's consistently like my experience when quality comes in. check out my photos...you'll see what I mean.

Every time we've attempted to go to the original SD location, we were deterred by the line wrapped around the building. So after our quick brunch at Bronze Cafe, we peeked over at Donut Bar and were shocked to be able to see the front door. It also gave us the chance to continue our tradition of donuts on road trips.

We walked in and perused the daily menu and made our way to the display case. The one that jumped out at me was the split donut stuffed with strawberries and whipped cream. My boyfriend stalks DB on Instagram and knew he wanted the Big Poppa Tart. I asked the sweet girl helping us out what the vegan options of the day were: apple fritter, creme brulee, chai latte cake donut, and yes, that strawberry cream beauty was in fact, a vegan soy-based whipped cream. The decision was easy for me because I'm not a big apple fan. One of each, minus the fritter. 

The creme brulee was of the yeast-risen variety. On top of the golden brown donut was a cap of hardened caramel that shattered at the first bite. Bite two yielded a rich ooze of vanilla bean-specked custard. The chai donut was exactly what I wanted. I'm a lover of cake donuts and this one did not disappoint. There was nothing "vegan-tasting" about it. It was just a great cake donut. The warm spices gave this a Fall feel and I was happy this was an option available in May. The strawberry cream donut was saved for last. I discarded the top because by the time I reached this, it was a little dry. The cream was dense, but still light and I couldn't believe it was dairy free. The strawberries were perfectly selected, juicy and sweet. 

I enjoyed the cake donut over the yeast-risen ones, but that's always been my preference. Still, I was very impressed by the vegan offerings. Street metered parking was easy to find because the location is in Old Vegas area.

Donut Bar... home of the biggest donuts I've ever seen. They are pretty darned tasty too. I have visited here a few times.  The service is always friendly and there is always many choices.  

My favorite is the chocolate euphoria.  Chocolate curls, delicious frosting, and light, fluffy donut.  Today's visit I got a mud pie, lemon pistachio, and cake batter.  The lemon pistachio was refreshing.  The glaze was light and just tart enough.  It had a sprinkling of pistachios.  Perfect balance.  The mud pie was chocolaty deliciousness.  I didn't try the cake batter but it did look yummy.

I recommend Donut Bar for a sweet treat.  Bring your friends though because the size definitely makes them shareable!
