You can get some decent donut here. Not the best donut I've eaten imo but definitely very creative, colorful and comes in different sizes, depending on how much you crave. There is not much space to sit, the service was good, I like the party music they played Vegas style!

Got the vanilla bean ands my daughter got the pink birthday cake.   They were huge and LOOKED impressive and yummy but. ...we're NOT.   Felt like I was eating a loaf of bread with cheap cupcake frosting.  not sure what the hype was ask about. Bleh.

Jessica K. pretty much took the words right out of my mouth.

The only difference is that I had seen folks standing alongside the curb area but assumed they were waiting for some sort of church to open up,I mean the corner looked as though everyone was lined up for free Oprah giveaways
Anyhow I digress.

Overall I had a lovely first time experience the staff appears to have a bond and truly show respect for one another (REAL TEAMWORK)! Also,Upon entering I took the liberty of writing down a list of donuts from their Sunday Menu. I ordered Caramelized Pineapple,DB Nutella,Coconut dream,Blueberry Lemon and Crème Brûlée which were ALL simply delicious.  Indeed the BEST donuts I've tasted thus far
Pretty good. The donuts were a bit 'fancy' for my taste, but I would visit again.

Now I'm a pink box fanatic but will splurge downtown and stop by this place. Location isn't very convenient unless you're walking around, the parking lot across the street is often full. They have a variety of vegan doughnuts which is awesome and I'm not sure if they have any gluten free options. The strawberry shortcake one is AMAZING. Definitely too large to eat yourself, most of their doughnuts are completely shareable and always fresh. I'm not surprised they sell out on a regular.
Very good food and service. Good portions. Good selection. Love this casual location.

Came by from a friends recommendation. We were impressed. Great variety and friendly staff. If you come, you have to try the creme brûlée donut. Also if there is no room inside feel free to go out back. There are places to sit outside in the shade.

My very first time trying this and all I can say is OMG WOW AMAZING!!! And I got there at the perfect time.... HAPPY HOUR. Staff is also amazing, very clean place. They definitely stand by their slogan. Best Donuts in the WORLD!! Wow

This is one of the things that I put on the list before we went out to Vegas and since we had one free day with no shows and to knock off as much as we could we did this. They had some of the their seasonal donuts and a few regulars left. We did have to take a bus out for this one. I came for the highly recommended apple donut or fritter as it is actually referred to in Canada. It was nice and there was a good amount of glaze to batter. They do have a good variety of cake and batter donuts. The customer service was friendly and the prices were very decent since we were off the Strip.

We were staying on Fremont street and saw this place coming back from the strip .. we walked the 7 minute walk the next day -- so worth it .. 
lemon cheesecake filled donut -- amazing
Cream brûlée filled --- ok
Salted caramel donut -- super amazing
Butterfinger chocolate donut --- greatness
Iced vanilla latte -- super good 
Nitro iced coffee -- amazing

Great little place .. the staff was super friendly and fast .. nice and clean inside and had a nice little patio in the back 

Please go and eat a donut!!

Holy sh!t....... This place is fantastic!! The staff was all extremely nice. They gave suggestions and offered up what their favorites are. We got a managers special box for $10!! When we were done we realized we missed some donuts and the owner GAVE us another box for free! We ordered two cold brew coffees (YA THEY HAVE COLD BREW COFFEE!) then my wife changed her mind to an iced mocha. They served us the second cold brew by accident but would not take money for it even after we tried to pay several times. 

The donuts are mind blowing! I will return multiple times every time I'm back in Vegas!!

The donuts here are good; they're dense, unlike a lot of other donut places. You can really tell thy put effort in making them. However, the creme brulee donut was very disappointing. The hype did not match the quality. I think people were just excited about the cracking noise rather than its taste. However, the other donuts were great!

These are real gourmet donuts with a nice price their coffee is also good and the staff is so friendly you can tell they put a lot of time and effort into not only their donuts but to their coffee also I like the maple bacon donut and I got a latte which was awesome!

So happy I finally got to try donut bar !! I've been eyeing this place in San Diego but to my pleasant surprise they also have on near downtown Vegas ! 

We got the mud pie donut which is huge !!! And also a creme brûlée one. I personally didn't like the creme brûlée one that much even though a lot of people recommend it! I thought the shell was too hard on the top. The mud pie donut was pretty good ! Had a hint of peanut butter & was covered in Oreos !! 

The workers were super pleasant and friendly ! The price was very reasonable. My favorite was the outdoor patio in the back where you can sit and enjoy your donuts ! It was cute and quaint ! 

I would definitely stop by if you're in downtown Las Vegas to get some delicious donuts !

Went here after hearing all the raves... it was disappointing. The staff were supper nice, they described all the flavors for us and was very helpful.

The donuts are not the best, the Red Velvet was super dry and not very flavorful. The maple bacon was ok. I have had better donuts for way cheaper. Almost $12 for 5 donuts!
They offer vegan donuts! Nom nom nom... stopped in during happy hour and got a ton of donuts for a low price! The donuts were great! couldn't tell the difference since they were vegan
Love this place can't say enough about it friendly staff clean location Donuts amazing highly recommend you should stop in and try a donut

Just awesome. There are two sizes of donuts. My wife and I each had a small donut, a peanut butter cup and a blueberry meyer lemon, and a large chocolate indulgence donut. She couldn't finish her half. The donuts and two small coffees cost $9 total, tax included. The donuts were all great and the price was far below Vegas standards. Will definitely visit again. Beware, they sell out so you may want to call or order online ahead of time.
This place was fantastic! Took the kids and it was a real treat! Vegas people this is a must!
I don't know what people are thinking. Over priced and not very good.  The donut is dry and nit very tasteful. Bigger is not always better

This wonderful place was included in a Foodie Tour that my husband & I took while in Vegas last fall.  Great donuts - we tried the French Toast, which was included in our tour.  Enjoyed our donut on the patio out back.  Glad that we found this hidden gem in downtown Vegas!!

Go early! 

Holy selections Batman.
During our short trip to Vegas, we visited this location twice. First time was already close to their closing time, despite a fewer selection we still left happy enough to return for more choices.

Second time we came back, we basically overloaded our capacity as everything looked amazing.

You NEED to try the creme brulee donut.
Beat donuts in the world. Never fails when I'm craving something sweet. Been buying donuts for years now & Donut Bar is still my favorite! I recommend to try the Oreo Donut
This little place is hiidden just behind the Fremont Street Experience. The donuts are fresh and amazing! My Faves were the Nutella and the Creme Brulee.

I'm not a huge donut fan but they advertise they have the best donuts in the World so I had to check this place out. I came in Sunday 5/15 around 10:45am. Pictures "donut" do this place justice as many of the donuts looked like they were on steroids, they were huge! Those ones seemed to be more of the plain variety though whereas the specialty donuts were of the smaller size. They have lots of yummy flavors and I couldn't decide what to get. Luckily the employees were patient while I waited to make my selections. I finally chose: 

Strawberry big poppa tart
Creme brulee 
Blueberry cheesecake 
Maple bacon
My dining companion got the french toast donut and holy crap that was delicious. I should have gotten that. 

I thought they were all pretty good. The blueberry cheesecake had a yummy blueberry filling, but I didnt find the flavor to be very cheesecakey. The creme brulee was a fun one. It had a hard caramelized sugar coating on top of it that was totally reminiscent of real creme brulee. I had a couple bites and the inside was a sweet vanilla cream. I brought the other half home to my brother who said he almost broke a tooth on the hard shell, so watch out! The maple bacon was probably my favorite. It was a maple bar with real chunks of bacon on top. The salty/sweet combo never gets old and was a delight to my taste buds. The big poppa tart was really just like an oversized poptart. I thought it was fun, but was honestly my least fave. For 4 donuts it was $12, I dont think that is very unreasonable for what you are getting. I can see myself coming back here for sure.

Pro Tip- If you follow them on IG @donutbar, you can check out their daily menu. They post it the night before so you know what to expect the following day.

Rightfully high in the ranking!
These Donuts are just dreamy and so delicious! Chef Jeff is an awesome guy, we had a last minute order for the next day and he delivered a fantastic customized donut collection for our event.  We had tasted at several other locations, but actually when stepping into their shop, we already knew we would end up here.
The atmosphere is very relaxed, nice crew and great ambiance!

This is the place to go!

As a donut lover, I researched the best donut places in Las Vegas before flying in for my first trip. According to reviews and social media this seemed to be the place to go.

My friends and I woke up early on a Sunday morning and took an Uber to the bakery. When we got there it wasn't crowded at all and we spent time looking over the menu trying to decide what we wanted. Thanks to the pictures I saw on Instagram, the French Toast donut and Strawberry Split donut seemed to be must haves. Along with those I got a vanilla bean glazed, a Nutella filled and a cheesecake filled donut. Go hard or go home right?

The strawberry split was my favorite hands down and I'd go back for that alone. The French toast was made to order and served hot with syrup, jam and butter. Easily a second favorite. The other 3 were okay and kinda let me down. The nutella and cheesecake filled were both good but did NOT have enough filling...I felt like I bit through 3/4 of the doughnut before I tasted filling. The vanilla bean glaze was also okay. However, there are so many delicious looking donuts available that I'd definitely go back to try something new along with my favorites.

Props to Donut Bar for having a back patio where you can sit and enjoy all your donuts. The morning we went there was plenty of seating available. If you love donuts like me, definitely make this a stop on your next trip to Vegas.

We came here around 1:30pm on a Sunday and they were closing up and wanted to get rid of the last couple of donuts they had. We had 2 options: BOGO or one box for $10. The box deal was so much more worth it so we ended up getting 16 donuts for $10!!! WHAT A STEAL. Plus if you check in on Yelp you can get either a free Americano or drip coffee. #win

Blueberry Lemon - Just okay, but I liked how it wasn't as sweet as I thought it would be.

Strawberry Split - Meh. I wouldn't get this again. The donut was just cinnamon and dry (probably because it had been sitting out all day) and the whipped cream inside was dry and tasted like it came from a can. The strawberries were also very plain and it would've been better if they were glazed.

Crème Brulee - My favorite out of everything I tried. The crunchy glaze on top was cool, and I love filled donuts. After eating half though, the cream inside started tasting artificial like cheap cake frosting so I had to come back to it.

Buttermilk Bar - I really liked the consistency of this! Moist and cake-like on the inside and nice and crunchy on the outside.

The other donuts look bomb so I'm definitely going to come try some other flavors. I agree that I've had better donuts elsewhere, but this location just opened 3 months ago so maybe their quality will go up. Street parking was easy to find.

Damn good pastries.  A must try in the DT Vegas area.  I had the cheese cake and creme Brulee, both fabulous.  They even have the Homer pink donut.  The coffee's hot a fresh, and great tunes on.  There's also a cool relaxing fish tank to stare at.

Came here after seeing a video and several pictures of the grilled cheese donut sandwich. To my disappointment, we were told they were sold out -so that was the start of it.

I got the mexican hot chocolate donut, which was $3. I thought it was worth it, not because of the flavor, it didn't taste much like mexican hot chocolate, or chocolate for that, but it did taste like a good yeast donut. It was huge, which totally made up for the price.

My bf got a s'mores donut, which was a big fail. It tasted like a less sweet version of something dunkin donuts (a favorite of mine) would try to make. At $3, and a quarter of the size of my donut, I didn't think it was worth it.

All in all, this is pretty much hype. Try it out and tell me what you think!

Overrated and overpriced. We went first thing in the morning and the donuts were really dry. They tasted like they were old, not fresh. We tried five different ones and I wasn't impressed. I didn't even want to eat them. They did have good chocolate milk though.

The Donut Bar resides in what feels like Portland in Vegas. The place smells of wonderful and fresh baked sugary goodness the moment you step in. You're immediately greeted by the sight of colorful mouth-watering donuts that line up the glass displays. Just be mindful that this place closes by 1pm so plan accordingly!

I tasted the Creme Brulee donut and the Snickers donut. The Creme Brulee donut was a bit smaller compared to all the other donuts but that shouldn't shy you away from experiencing creme brulee in this doughy goodness. What makes the donut so great is the experience of cracking that shell. The sweet creme oozes out and that first bite takes you away to some far off French patisserie. It's a donut you won't find anywhere else and is a must try if you're going! The snickers donut is good for two if you're not looking to start your day on the heavy side. I enjoyed the snickers pieces on the donut but other than that it wasn't amazing. 

If you're looking to try something new off the strip I say stop in and grab a donut. They have a huge selection but they only make a certain batch of each donut. They have custards to french toast donuts and no matter what donut you're loyal to, The Donut Bar has something to keep you happy. Each donut is $2-4 so you won't have to feel guilty about your sugar fix.

Really good donuts! I had a creme brule and Nutella donut. Both donuts were beautiful, big and yummy... all you can ask for in a donut! The staff was friendly and helpful and the coffee was good. The outdoor area in the back is really cool to sit and enjoy your donut and coffee. Great spot!

Only giving it 3 stars because I'm NOT a donut afficionado but the donut coconut dream that's pictured didn't taste freshly made. The batter tasted like yesterday. But I do love the array of amazing choice. It really is spectacular and creative and my husband who loves all things sweet, ahem, enjoyed his donut immensely.

I have been hearing about this place for a while. Just waked in an hour ago and they still had some to sell. 

They were offering two for ones, as they wanted to close up. 

I bought chocolate, coconut, birthday cake and Oreo. My family loved them. 

I have to say they were very tasty and the friendliness of the owner/staff was outstanding. 

Fantabulous.

The Donut Bar has the best donuts in town! I frequently buy and eat their delicious donuts. I also give the donuts to clients and to my staff when I want to say thank you. The donuts look and taste amazing. They have a lot of unique and tasty flavors. The staff is also very cool. If you are looking for the top donuts in town, you need to check out the Donut Bar.

Loved this little spot!

Went for lunch with a co-worker after seeing a photo of a donut from this place on unlokt. Apparently, it used to be O Face Donuts and looks the same inside. I never visited when it was O Face but I'm glad I did visit this time!

I went with the ginormous blueberry donut and it was delish! Co-worker went with the one stuffed with the Oreo cookie. I tried both and I think the Oreo stuffed one was a little better but any donut the size of the one I got gets bonus points for 'more to love.' 

The guy who helped us was super friendly and told us we had to stop back in the morning to see their full display of goodies. By lunch time, they have a smaller selection remaining but I still felt like the 10-12 left were plenty to choose from. Also, at this time of day it was buy one, get one. I love a discount so that was huge for me. 

Next time, I'll try the one with the pop tart inside. I punked out this visit because I was trying to eat slightly less than a zillion calories of possible but next time I'm going for the gusto! 

Final thought: my donut was a little dry but the icing was great. As of my first visit, they didn't steal my heart for best donut in town. But I'm definitely going to give them another shot. 

I say go give them a try!

They had a pop up store at Illumilatte so I decided to buy a bakers dozen for my office. Can I just say I was the hit of the office that day! Each donut was fun inventive and so so good! I will definitely be going back!
Great selection! Fabulous donuts,  coffee was good. What I love about this place is the variety,  cheap price   Go early to ensure you get what you want..... Friendly staff

Who doesn't love donuts!? 

This place has it all.

A cool sign and tons of options for breakfast... 

The decor is simple but elegant.

I liked the fish aquarium display.

I had the bacon bear claw which was huge.

I also tried their iced coffee with nitro.

Got here as they opened so the line wasn't long yet but it was within 15 minutes.

I suggest getting here in the AM to snag parking.  Be warned all spots surrounding this place are paid parking... tow trucks circle around and so do the police.

You can pull up the the loading/unloading zone and be in and out in a flash.

Service was just as good as the donuts. 

Be sure to take a minute to check out the restroom. You can thank me later.

I'll frequent this place moving forward when in Vegas.

Be back soon...

Yummy yummy. 
Super nice staff. Ordered the birthday cake donut. After trying my family members choices, mine was by far the best. Fluffy donut with an Oreo inside. 
 Had the cold brew which woke me up right away. 
Happy we found this place on yelp. #memories :)
The French Toast donut was amazing!! They only make it on the weekends or something but it's good!! The other donut I had was whatever but I'll return to try more donuts.

If you're a donuts fan, this is a must-stop shop during your trip to Vegas! You'll be surprised how big half of their donuts are! Yes, you'll also want to order one just to see if it's possible to finish one. Plus, they have very appealing regular sized donuts, so you may as well order one of those as well!

I am also curious if the fish tank has real donuts at the bottom or fake ones - that was the hot debate in our group. I still say no way those were real! Bonus tip, use the restroom before you leave for the wall art!

Let's be honest. Best donuts in the world.... probably not. That title rightfully belongs to Voodoo doughnut in Portland but however they serve some pretty great doughnuts when it comes to their specialty doughnuts. The maple bacon cinnamon roll is to die for and if you're not a carnivore like me then the crème brûlée is a great choice as well.

The perfect little donut shop! I love this little shop and the customer service was excellent. We went after the Color Run and don't judge this curvy girl likes sweets...lol. They had a huge selection of donuts and some were huge. I got the birthday cake, strawberry and creme, and cake batter. I also tried their grilled cheese that was awesome. Lil Olivia said it was sweet and savory. The only thing I didn't like was that their was only about 10 chairs inside for dining. We had to go to the back patio and it was a little chilly but it would be cute if a little warmer. I am really glad I tried this spot and the prices were pretty cheap. The time we went the line was out the door but went quickly.
Found out about the donut bar through a Google search. It's a gem of downtown Vegas! They gave us two huge donuts at a bogo price of $3! Definitely recommend and will be back

I had been to the Donut bar in San Diego when I was in town for a conference. When I was planning my Vegas trip, I found out that there was a donut bar and it was immediately on my "must eat" list.  We were driving down from Vegas to LA the day we visited so we bought lots of donuts for the ride and every one of them was amazing! I really wish we had one close by!
Great customer service and awesome donuts! Had 4 different ones and took Erica's recommendation. Every single bite was pure joy! I will be back. Thanks Erica for great service!

Soo much to choose from! We happened to visit on their 1-year anniversary so they had exotic cars parked outside you can sit and take pictures with, the owner was there doing raffle for different prizes from touristy things (like bus tour) to free donuts...each person received a raffle ticket for coming in and also a free birthday cake donut. It was a nice celebration! The selection was pretty extensive as well...I loved their creme brulee donut! The glaze cracked when you broke it in half.

Was super excited to hit up this donut shop for a long time. It was nice to know that this time around, an hour before it closed, they still had tons of choices still. This time I was smart to call first before heading there because downtown can be a pain in the butt. The first time I went was disappointing because an hour before closing, everything was already sold out. And that was the time I had a friend in town as well. But this time around, I wasn't disappointed about the options per say, but actually the taste tbh. There was a deal going on that they sometimes do on the last hour of opening and they either do buy one get one, or fill a whole box of donuts for $10. Of course we ordered the famous creme brûlée, strawberry cream cheese and the pumpkin spice. I was too juiced to crack open the creme brûlée. As far as taste, it wasn't that great. It was very sweet. Too sweet. The hard top of the creme brûlée was nice and crunchy but overal it was OK. at least the donut itself was soft. The donut on the strawberry was weak. I could make it at home. The pumpkin spice was the tastiest. The filling was good too. Next time I need to try the ice cream donut cone when it gets warme

Service = The Best 
Location = Classic
DONUTS = The Prototype 
Make the trip to eat here

Gourmet donuts. Stumptown nitrogen infused coffee, strawberry milk BOMB!!!!  They were sold out of donuts today can't wait to try them! I mixed half coffee half strawberry milk and made my own strawberry latte it tastes amaaazzing try it !!!!!!

So 200 plus reviews later not sure anything else can add.....but here we go anyway. I am just about positive am the last yelper that I know in Vegas that finally checked out Donut Bar. I noticed recently Donut Bar has started to open maybe once month or random times at night. So was like NICE finally get to try the pop tart and the creme brûlée. All the videos seen of the creme brûlée and one of the stables pop tart looked delicious. I do love my donuts from time to time. 

I heard that generally there a line when first open and the earlier get here the better. The later you come not really the best idea cause they make only so much donuts everyday and by the end slim pickings (truth nothing worst then stale donut). I got down little earlier because not sure where the place was and parking downtown flat out sucks. Honest if you park near Donut Bar they have self pay parking meters. If ur lucky depending time of day its SUPER easy and cost is cheaper then paying any hotel or parking structure. Dollar on the meter gives you hour. More then enough time (maybe if the line is long then that another story). I was surprise but the line was not that bad only four people ahead of me. Just the fact there was LINE for donut shop still blows my mind. Donut Bar does carry strong name brand. 

Chef Jeff is not only a passionate owner. The guy knows his donuts and all positive vibes. The minute he open the door greeting all five or six of us come on in. Friendly, all smiles, and love the atmosphere. The smell was awesome minute walked in!!! Fresh batch of donuts, the display case truly gives the donuts even more eye candy, the diversity crazy (oversize homer donut, rectangle pop tart, small circle creme brûlée, traditional size ones but nothing traditional with the flavors or colors, and untraditional ones with donut cones fill with ice cream or strawberry split), and it long line of donut goodies. You might forget the selection at the top of the line. The place is small so gets filled up fast if want sit down. It located literally next to Carson Kitchen or look for the famous Donut Bar sign outside. 

The stumpton cold crew deserves shout out. I never had that brand before. I decided try the coconut flavor cold brew in carton. It was perfect compliment go with the donuts. They have other flavors. I believe one was chocolate and the other not sure. They also offer it on tap if you like. 

The donuts the pop tart is HUGE. If one person can eat one that pretty good. The way pop tart melting into the donut not sure if tasted any of the crust associate with pop tart. The filling you know if fan of pop tart is true and true. The icing and the goodies on top just pushed it sugar overload. I loved it. The creme brûlée was good. I think that one better eat it on the spot cause the longer it sits the crack on top break it apart. Rock solid. I had fill out my box was got strawberry split. The strawberries was fresh, juicy, and I keep thinking strawberry shortcake.

A cute little spot in dtlv... 

Very friendly folks behind the counter. Bright and airy. A great display for the donuts.

We ordered the Homer. (My other half is a The Simpsons superfan.) And the Snickers donut. 

The Homer was delicious, soft, moist and really. Yeah. I'll say it. A happy party in my mouth. I would eat it again and again! That was a very well made and thought out donut. Brightly colored, cute sprinkles. Large in size. Easily a donut for two. 

The Snickers donut was a bit of a disappointment. It was dry and lacking. The dough didn't seem like it held up as well, possibly because it was chocolate? It was quite unsatisfying. In fact, it went unfinished.

First time here, and it was awesome!
I came a couple minutes after they opened and it seems they were hard at work setting everything up, the display was jaw dropping.

A good way to start down the road of decadence... Donut Bar offers many varieties of donuts. I must say the creme brulee donut was delicious, while the other donuts were pretty good as well. I got a cappuccino to accompany my donuts, although a regular coffee would have fitted better. 

The space is pretty small, the glass window allows too much sun (joking), and there is a nice patio out back. Pretty cool place.

My mind was blown today when I tried these delicious donuts.  I came in near closing time so there was only three options: coconut,  blueberry,and poptart. We went with the giant coconut and split it between 3 people. It was incredible!  By far one of the best donuts I have even had in my life! 
The customer service was pretty friendly for a hipster place and the service was fast. 
I also tried the Americano coffee and it was EXCELLENT!!! 
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place and I will be sending my hotel guests to this amazing place.

Changed review because they don't open until 7am. Lethal for locals who need donuts for work. For tourist hours will work.

Not since Portland have I been so excited about donuts! These are so beautiful AND delicious! One large donut could feed four people.Amazing and a must stop for Vegas.

It was a bit hard to find but we kept looking after hearing so much about this place.  We only ordered one donut (we were going to a breakfast buffet later!) to taste and it was hard to decide which one to choose.  We got the birthday cake donut for $3.00.  It was huge, fluffy, and delicious!
Came here yesterday... I had no idea the donuts were so large lol.  My son & I got 1 large each & 1 small. Definitely will be back

Love, love, love donut bar. I have gone to the original one located in San Diego. From California to Nevada, awesome job chef! Donuts are still amazing, coffee is delectable, and staff is awesome! Only shocker was the line wasn't out the door like I was used to. Bonus for me, I got all my yummy delicious donuts I've longed for. Glad to see this place expanding, excited to come back soon!

It must be a dream...don't wake me because I never want to leave!  This place is a little slice of heaven is all I can say.  My girlfriend and I were in Vegas visiting her family and I thought I'd try my luck at a local donut shop. I really enjoy cake donuts and specialty donuts, so let's see what Vegas has to offer.  I came across the Donut Bar. The shop is pretty small but the donuts are enormous! I walked in and thought I died and went to heaven...this place is amazing!  I was created by friendly and helpful staff to assist me with my order.  Sooooo many choices and they all look delicious.  I got a dozen because I didn't want to miss out on anything!  I also shared with my girlfriend's family...to help educate them on the finer things in life!  The apple fritter with bacon, I think it's called "the Brad" but it is fantastic!  Apple and bacon together is a match made in heaven.  I also tried the "big daddy" which was a donut with an entire s'more inside (there are other flavors)..genius! The pumpkin spice was also good.  My girlfriend's mom had the creme brûlée...she loved it.  My girlfriend had the birthday cake Oreo donut and wouldn't share so I'll take that as she liked it.  You can't go wrong here.  I highly advise anyone to go here if you're in Vegas...these donuts are life changing!  If I could give them 6 stars I would.

Stopped here last weekend while visiting Las Vegas. Because of the reviews, I made my husband stop by. First of all, they have many different creative ideas (as far as shape and flavor). Secondly, the donuts were fresh!  Third, the staff was nice and friendly and seemed like they liked their jobs. We purchased the creme brulee, red velvet, and blueberry cheesecake donuts. I think what is special about this place is the different types/styles of donuts. I thought the donut fishtank was cute too!!  I also liked the "barstyle" set up (bar table/stools) they have there. The one in San Diego serves beer so I think as this Vegas location grows they should serve different items to stay competitive. The hours are from 8-1 pm on the weekdays and 8-12 on the weekends because it is said they sell out of all of the donuts by those times, however, there were many donuts available around 11:30 am last Sunday when we were there, so I don't understand that statement. No different than other donut shop as far as taste goes but will be back again when in the Fremont district.
My favorites are the S'mores Big Poppa Tart and French Toast Donut (available weekends only). Always a great assortment, menu changes daily. Excellent customer service.
Kind of a cute place, clever Simpson painting on the wall in the bathroom but wishing we left the donuts in there too. Not tasty at all.

Stumbled across this place while looking for a sweet breakfast spot near my office. I had no idea what to expect since I'm a little late on the hype of this place. Walking in the doors I was greeted and I immediately diverted my attention to the array of donuts waiting for me to eat! I did not know what to choose and I couldn't just get 1 so I got 3! Crème Brulee, Strawberry Cheesecake and the Birthday Cake Oreo! The Crème Brulee had all the components of what you're used to, it's a bit dry but once you get to the filling, it just makes it all so much better. You bite into it and you hear that nice sugar cracking and then there's no going back. The Strawberry Cheesecake was my favorite out of the 3 because it was just so creamy and just perfect! It tasted like I was eating a cheesecake and once I had the first taste of filling, I just couldn't stop. The Oreo Birthday Cake was a great combination as well, it had a bit too much frosting for my taste but overall was a good one too!

We frequent the original donut bar in San Diego so decided to stop by the one by Fremont street (downtown Las Vegas) while in town for the 4th of July. The place is pretty inconspicuous so easy to drive past, with paid parking all around, although we risked it and just parked and ran in to grab our doughnuts to go. 

First thing different we noticed was that there was hardly anyone there. We arrived about 35 minutes after they opened and walked right in. Normally at the one in SD you can expect a line of 20+ people waiting before they open. Maybe we caught them at just the right time since we noticed more people start to show up as we were leaving.

The place is a bit smaller, and it seems like the selection may be smaller too. I also noticed that they don't give kids free doughnuts like they do at the one in SD. The staff were just as friendly and welcoming though, and we were not disappointed with the doughnuts we picked, just as delicious!

If you're staying in downtown or have a car if you're on the strip, definitely worth the trip!

I always wanted to go here and after a year I finally got to try it! The donuts are very sweet and huge!! You get the price for the looks.. however the creme brûlée wasn't what I thought it would be, but it was still sweet and delicious! The pop tart donut actually has pop tart in it! It was super sweet, so prepare for your sweet tooth.

Donut Bar is one of the best places to get donuts. It is a hidden gem located inside Downtown Las Vegas. If you visit Donut Bar past noon, they might be sold out of their baked goodies!

On my first visit, I kept it simple with a chocolate donut and was not disappointed at all! My friend got the strawberry cheese cream donut and she loved it. I tried both donuts and decided that the donuts might be a little bit TOO sweet for me.. however I will be back to try more flavors!

Seeing the photo's of these donuts on Yelp, I knew I had to try these babies out. 

They had so many options. Almost every donut was about the size of my head. Ton's of toppings and fillings. The lady behind the counter helping us was awesome. She was super helpful, very friendly, and informed. She guided us through the different options, the favorites, and her own favorites. We ended up with the Butter Beer Donut, Apple Fritter, Maple Bacon, and Crème Brule. 

I personally thought these donuts were too sweet. And really not my type of donut in general. These are mostly bready donut's with super sugary, cake icing. It wasn't bad. Just not my thing. The Crème Brule was different. Creamy vanilla filling with sugar burleed to the top. 

If you are big in to sugar you may love this place. I really loved the people and the experience of it all. Very cute shop. The coffee was good as well. Just not my thing.

Thank you yelpers!!!!!deliciousness after deliciousness! !! Must haves, strawberry cinnamon donut, creme Brule,  peanut butter and jelly ( to die for ), filling goes all the way to the end, wow just wow
Pretty amazing donuts!  Really amazing service!  I recommend it! Try the homemade strawberry milk!  Just 4 stars because it is a little pricey.

Busy and a bit pricy, but worth the wait. I've only been here once and remembered liking the one in San Diego more, but it could just be the donuts I got.
Favorite donut was the Bourbon Maple in San Diego

Donuts as big as your face! I see this place every year on my way to Life is Beautiful and I finally made time to stop in. It's heavenly.

It's located about a block away from Freemont East on Carson and 6th Street and, without the flying pink donut on the wall outside, I might have missed it. Before walking in, you'll notice the posted hours for each day - they close when they sell out - so it's probably better arrive earlier than later.

We ordered four cinnamon rolls, two strawberry cheesecake donuts, a slated carmel and a Homer. I almost went into a diabetic coma because I couldn't stop and they were gone too soon. Each one was distinctive in taste but not overly sweet or dry. My favorite were the cinnamon rolls, they were gooey in the center and melted in my mouth, I highly reccommend them!
Get the Creme Brulee, Maple Bacon, Blood Orange, and Donut Bar's Nutella.

Yes yes and yes! If there were more stars I would be clicking on them. 

I work downtown at Pizza Lotto and have been craving donuts all week thanks to the growing bean in my belly ;) I walked in and COULD NOT BELIEVE MY EYES. I ended up getting a dozen because why not. 

Fast and friendly service and absolutely delicious donuts. Thanks guys!

Went here on vacation, donuts and staff are excellent.  The Carmel, and strawberry whip cream donut were delicious.  The mud pie was ok was a little different with peanut butter, think the one we got was a little dry but still good.  Overall will be back to this chain as donuts and coffee are always a good breakfast!
The donuts here are beautiful & tasty!  Cool atmosphere. Friendly & helpful staff.  Bonus, while we were here, some cops came in, so you know it's a kickin' spot!

For the price, you would expect the donuts to be made that day but they always taste kind of stale and as if they were made two days before. Every time I go, they taste like if I could have bought the same at Krispy Kreme.

Not enough time right now for a verbose review...but just know that these donuts are AWESOME!  Definitely try a creme brûlée donut and a big poppa tart!! So many choices!! Everything that I bought today was really yummy.

Around the corner on 6th street there's a 3 space, 15 minute, free parking area. Use those spaces unless you're ready to pay for street parking downtown.

This place is so far away from home, but it was definitely worth the trip! When I first walked in, I was greeted by the workers and by a pleasant bakery aroma. I actually haven't heard of this place until my cousins from California mentioned it. They wanted to try the creme brûlée donut so we drove the distance to try it out; it's something I definitely recommend. The donuts here are very different from any other donut place, which makes it all the more special. I really just wanted to buy everything and pig out at home, but unfortunately that couldn't happen. I'll be coming back, soon!
Finally tried bacon cinnamon roll it was amazing and totally worth the wait. Delicious donut flavors, amazing and friendly staff.

This place was on our way and dang it, I wanted a fritter! So we stopped. Luckily the line was short. Among the usual flavors (glazed and cake etc)!here was a great selection of different flavors like the Creme brûlée , French toast and grilled cheese donuts. I got my fritter, a chocolate bar, cake donut and a couple other flavors. All were sweet and looked good but ended up being pretty dry. The fritter seemed over fried especially the edges.

My mom had the lemon pistachio donut which was large. She felt like it was tasty and delicious. A nice lemon my glaze that was not too sweet. Could have been lighter but she liked it. Sister had the Samoa which is like the Girl Scout cookie. She said it was dry but it did taste exactly like the cookie. The Oreo was delicious and had Oreo in the middle. We all said we would certainly come back for more in the future. The location is convenient and it's a cute little store front with a courtyard we sat in with our little Yorkie.

Pre-ordered on their website (available from 3-9pm the prior day). Choice to pick up at 8, 9, or 10 am. Minimum order of 1 dozen. Not all flavors are available for pre-order (didn't realize this was the case until pickup). 

Friendly customer service. They have a coffee/espresso bar as well. The Sumpton coconut cold brew sold by the single serve carton was really good. Not too sweet with a hint of coconut.

Notes for the donuts I tasted this time: 

db Nutella - didn't really taste like Nutella, more like milk chocolate with crushed almonds on top. Really large size, frosting was borderline too thin for the size of the donut. The donut part had good flavor and texture on it's own, which is always a good sign. 

Creme brûlée - smallest in size, but I appreciated that. Really enjoyed the crunchy sugar crust. The cream was also the perfect sweetness. My favorite of the bunch. 

Butter beer - larger size. I was expecting a pronounced butterscotch flavor, but didn't even get a hint. The Harry Potter theme was cute. 

Lemon pistachio - larger size. Hey, this one actually tastes like lemon and pistachio! Good balance of sweetness with the lemon.

S'mores on fire - standard "normal" size. The most aesthetically pleasing. The only cake donut of the dozen. Didn't care for the actual donut part which was a little dry and lacking chocolate flavor. The marshmallow on top was good; probably made in-house? 

Maple bacon - bar shape, normal sized. I'm a fan of the whole salty/ sweet thing, but this was just ok.

Caramel latte - larger size. Had good caramel flavor, but didn't detect any coffee at all.

I feel like the names of the donuts set up certain expectations, but when the flavors weren't there, it was disappointing. I am willing to give them another shot though, since I did enjoy the creme brûlée.

1 star for their hours, 5 stars for existing because they really do have the BEST donuts in Vegas. How can you possibly go wrong with such divinely inspired, ethereal masterpieces? With a wide variety of delicious treasures, the Willy Wonka's of donuts has something for everyone, whether you're five or ninety nine.

With donuts as thick as a paperback, one can easily be shared with two. Find your happy morning in Donut Bar. Once you try one, you'll swear off Dunkin forever.

Just get there REALLY early. 12pm closing time may not be convenient for you. It never is for me.

Came by for the Strawberry Split.  Last time we came at almost closing time and they were pretty much out of everything.  I walked in and was so happy to see the Strawberry Split!  It was huge!  My husband got the Expresso Chocolate and my chocoholic friend went for the Triple Chocolate Threat after being disappointed that they didn't have the Chocolate Euphoria today.  Theirs were both cake donuts and we felt they weren't anything too special.  My friend commented the Chocolate Threat was not even Chocolatey enough and I agree.  I came here for the Strawberry and I was not disappointed.  The donut is bit crusty like a croissant.  I would prefer like a soft donut but my husband and friend enjoyed the "crust" the way it was.  My husband also commented that it reminded him of a Chinese birthday cake.  I felt satisfied with what I had been waiting for....months or years...
All donuts were yummy. So many choices wish we were there long enough to try them all.
OH My HEAVENS!!! I'm not a big donut fan but I was impressed for sure!!! The prices, the sizes, the taste! EVERYTHING was just perfect!!! Will be back for sure!! Cute little shop. Loved it

Absolutely wonderful. Everything is so fresh, the nitro coffee is phenomenal, and every single worker was extremely pleasant.
Loved the holiday treats they put out as well. As a local, I will be returning.

Hands down the most delicious and creative donuts I've had in Vegas.
For the location, it's located in a pretty cool place. You can see lots of murals on buildings as you're making your way there.
I love the variety of donuts they had. My favorites were the Creme Brûlée and the Homer donut (GET IT). 
I bought like two dozen. Each a different flavor just to have something to munch on for my road trips.
Every now and then I'd make my friends snag me cause they're very addicting! :)

Pretty amazing assortment and appearance. However, it's really hard to justify spending $3 on a donut. The donuts were good, but not so much better than regular donuts to really justify it (unless you're just visiting and want some exotic donuts).
Loved this place! So wonderful to have another donut shop with vegan options - maybe one day the vegan donuts will be the majority of the menu. A girl can hope. Cozy atmosphere - we love DTLV.

I have visited the Donut Bar twice.  As a diabetic I only eat donuts occasionally. Each time I have gone in I have been greeted by a patient and professional staff member.  When I say patient, I am referring to the fact it is extremely difficult to decide what to get. 

Since the last time I was there, they have made what seem to be "giant" donuts.  Believe me I wanted the giant blood red orange donut!  However, I picked the strawberry cheese cake and a creme brulee.  I really liked the strawberry cheesecake donut even though I thought it should be called a strawberry filled donut more than anything.  The creme brulee donut had outstanding filling!  It was a delicious decadence.  I wasn't into the top of the donut but I haven't had much exposure to creme brulee.  

Just to mention, I have also had their vegan donuts and loved them as well.  I had the vegan donut when I had company in town and bought a dozen for everyone.  It was a bit of sticker shock when the dozen cost me $23 but when you eat the donuts you understand you are getting "every penny's worth." 

Overall, I would have to say these donuts taste as if they were cooked with care and pride in craftsmanship. They are worth the drive when you have a donut craving that won't go away and demands gourmet taste.

Very good donuts!  I ordered several different flavors, including the Boston creme and the Creme Brulee, both of which were delicious.  The shop itself is quaint and clean, a nice place to sit and enjoy a donut and cup of coffee.  They have a nice outdoor area as well.  I will definitely go back the next time I'm in need of donuts!

Tried a donut, interesting selection. I always drive by and they have a sign that reads SOLD OUT on the glass outside. Was late at night so not many donuts left. The cake donut was kind of dry but the topping was good. Apple crumb looked much better than it actually was. The servers were very nice and friendly. I will give them another try when I know the donuts are fresh and the shelves are full.

A friend of mines told me to visit this place for cool awesome donuts. Went by yesterday while on vacation and line was crazy. So this morning went early and I was first in line. Wooooo! Hopefully these last im taking half a dozen home to my sister! Donuts were frickin awesome. Get the maple bacon one it was warm and gooey and delicious as hell!!!

The smell when you walk in is amazing! I brought home four different kinds of their amazing donuts for my family to taste...the chocolate bacon, cake batter, mud pie and French toast donuts. My favorite the French toast donut which was made to order, so hot and delish! The cold brew great too! I can't wait to bring my family.

I was very excited to try these donuts. I finally made time to go to this donut shop on my day off. I purchased 4 donuts & was given an additional 4 donuts for free. The customer service was good, but the donuts were not. I was sadly disappointed in these donuts. I will most likely choose another place to buy donuts whenever I get a craving.

Great selection of Vegan Tasty Treats (Doughnuts and Apple Fritters).. 
So delicious and so Healthy ;)

I don't know why there is so much hype about this place. I was initially amped like everyone else, but was sadly put down in the blink of an eye. I guess living In LA for the past four years really spoiled me because of the myriad of donut shops I've tried there. Donut bar is different from all the donut shops in Vegas I do have to say. They offer donuts the size of your face, flavor combinations that are unique, and esthetics so pretty you don't want to eat them. Unfortunately, I can't say the same about the texture. The texture was not as moist as I had anticipated. With every bite, I had to wash it down with some water. We came at noon and maybe the donuts were sitting there for a couple hours? But that should not be a valid excuse for a shop specializing in donuts. They close at 1pm or when all the donuts are sold out. Would I come here again, probably not. Sorry donut bar but you can do better.

This was one of my planned stops while in Vegas...SO GLAD I stopped in! The menu of donuts...omg...seriously,  how does one decide between lemon cheesecake, Meyer lemon blueberry and triple threat chocolate? You DON'T! You get them all! Not to mention the other delicious, creative flavors, like the donut with an OREO in the middle. Be still my heart! The coffee drinks were fabulous, the staff were so friendly and the bathroom, well, I'll leave it as a secret and just tell you to check it out! Will be back before I leave this town. GO. SEE. ENJOY!

All I can say is delicious!!!  These donuts are.very indulgent, can't visit to often lol but amazing.  My favorite ones were the Nutella donut and the birthday surprise with an oreo .  Their portions r huge so u don't need to purchase many to share. Must come back!

Ok so I only stopped here once for literally 2 mins or less, I was running late for a work function and i was passing by and just had to have some sweets in my jelly belly to make my day more merry. I waltzed in and was greeted by a nice lady who was behind the counter, she was giving me the spiel of the place but  i was in a mad rush so abruptly looked around and saw the oreo birthday cake one so just pointed and said "that one 2 please". and rushed my dough boy butt on outta there. Upon my hasty retreat I noticed that they offer a YELP CHECK IN DISCOUNT: of a cup of fancy  coffee. I didn't even have time for that :/. I was literally eating on the run and my donut was a tastebudgasm and a half of phenomenal yumness so i can only imagine what their other sweet wonders behind the counter must be like. So your's truly Benjamin glutton shall return to this purveyor of fried dough to further investigate but so far i'm a fan :D.
Amazing amazing amazing donuts!! BOMB.com I can't say anything else.. they were theeeeee BOMB SUPER GOOD!
ETA: Try the vegan grilled cheese donut sandwich. It's a one-in-a-lifetime gotta-do-it kinda situation. I think I only need a single bypass instead of a double, cuz, yanno, vegan.

Just as good as the San Diego location!  We get a lot of well known eateries from other cities opening in Vegas.  Not all of them live up to the hype.  Donut Bar definitely does.  

I came in around 11 am during their soft opening.  There was a short line that moved quick.  I was getting donuts for a few people so picked a good variety: Caramelized Pineapple, Caramel Latte, Cake Batter, Mud Pie, Red Velvet, Samoa, Chocolate Twix, Blueberry Cheesecake, Banana Caramel and Apple Fritter.  Half went to work with Hubby and half came home with me.  It is hard to pick a favorite but if pressed I would say the Caramel Latte and Samoa were the faves out of the ones I tried.  

They post the next days flavors the night before on social media.  Check it out before you go so you have an idea of what you want.  They are listed in store too but the line moves quick so be ready.  Not all of the varieties fit on the counter so don't miss a flavor because you didn't read the list.  

Don't forget a drink.  They have Stumptown Cold Brew, Nitro, Chocolate and Strawberry Milk on tap.  See you in line.
Exceptionally good donut that originated from san diego. My triple chocolate donut is so good for a bucks plus staff n store are cool.

I wanted so much to love this place! But for the price and taste, 3 stars is as high as I can go.

Pros: fantastic service - staff were friendly and 
 knowledgeable
Cute shop - set up/ decor
Ginormous donuts and vegan choices
Free Jiggly puff donut for my son
Vegan apple fritter was yummy

Cons: Aside from the apple fritter the donuts were just ok. For the elaborate toppings the actual donuts were alright, nothing special.
Price varies per donut...I paid $18 for 6 donuts ( vegan: 2 creme brulee, 1 strawberry split, 1 apple fritter, 1 cake batter, 1 chocolate euphoria, and a free Jigglypuff donut)
Music was a bit loud and it made it hard to hear donut descriptions and specials from the staff


Had this place bookmarked for a while and decided to try it out.

Apple fritter was good...probably only donut I would go back for.

I was excited to have found this place when I went to Vegas for EDC weekend. I was actually looking for a churro place but I guess this place popped up for their cone dipped in cinnamon sugar. Even more excited that the shuttle got lost and dropped us around the corner from Donut Bar!! So why 3 stars? Let me break it down:

Ambience: 5/5. No complaints. Not the strip, and not a glamorous neighborhood, but inside is cute, the donuts all look amazing. Clean, etc. The board and menu is cute as well. 

Service: 5/5. The girl who helped us out was patient. It was kind of hard being a short Asian to try to see the donuts displayed in the back and not in the counter. She was super friendly, cheery, and overall nice. Service was quick.

Layout: Definitely up with the social media trends with the hashtags and the sign so you can instagram those ginormous and beautiful looking donuts. 

But the most important part is the donut itself..... 
Donut/Pastries: 2.5/5. The donuts LOOK amazing. So much variety. Different sizes. Awesome flavor combinations. I bought 6 donuts. A whole box for $16. BUT the donut itself was so disappointing. The batter was dry and thick. Closer to an old-fashioned when it wasnt supposed to be. We got there right when they opened at 8am so its not stale. Its just the batter itself. All the donuts had the same batter so even if the frosting was different, the dry batter was still the same. 

Creme brulee donut was one of the top ones according to yelp and the girl, but even though the filling (amount was also inconsistent since I bought two), it still didnt moisten the dry batter. However, the crunch of breaking it was satisfying. 

The maple cinnamon which I figured was the closest to a churro was burnt near the top and edges but gooey in the middle. However it was too sweet. Perhaps it was the maple. I still ate 90%. 

I really wanted to like this place but their actual donuts were all disappointing. Could not use the #bestdonutsintheworld. Sorry!

P.s. Apparently, the cone only is available after 10am. So I never even got what I came for. The rating is purely on the 

3.5 stars rounded down to 3 as I do not think its overhyped for the donut itself. Everything was good though. Come for the novelty and not for the best donut in your life.

The early bird gets the worm!  This place only stays open until they sell out.  Everytime I pass this place about noonish they always have written on the window SOLD OUT!  And I'm like damn it!  LoL.  
I finally caught them with a few donuts left.  I got the Mexican chocolate donut with some milk.  This thing was huge!  Took one bite and understood why they sell out so fast.  Best donuts ever!
It reminds me of donuts you get at the bakery in Hawaii.  Not too sweet and the donut is perfect not too heavy but just right.  The chocolate was delicious and the hind of cinnamon on one side and marshmallows on the other side was super yum and cute.  
I need to make it here early to see what else they had.  I was eyeing out their filled nutella donut.  That is definitely on the list!

The donuts looks way more appealing than the actual taste.
A co-worker brought a bunch into the office. There were literally so much to choose from. Green tea, crème brulee, strawberry shortcake, pop tarts in different flavors, blueberry cheesecake, maple bacon, pumpkin spice, cookies n cream, birthday cake oreo and a few others.

Some tasted better than others. Donuts tasted fresh and the cake wasn't dried. I had half of the green tea one. No green tea taste to it at all. In fact, it tasted more like a lemon flavored donut with green colored frosting on top. The strawberry shortcake and blueberry cheesecake however, was FABULOUS!!!!!! It really taste like it sounds. 

I can imagine if you have a major sweet tooth, this place would be heavenly for you. I'm glad I was finally able to try their donuts though. But personally, I'm more of a cupcake kinda gal. Remember...choose your donuts wisely.

Promised my daughter I would take her here to try the nutella donut she has been dying to sink her teeth into.  Came in on a Saturday morning around 11am to find a small line of about 5 people formed waiting to place their orders.  Donuts are priced individually.  Picked up two nutella overloads, one strawberry cheesecake and one toasted coconut; total came to $13.  
Nutella Overload:
Nothing to call home about.  In my opinion, there was no 'overload' of nutella present.  This donut is basically a nutella-filled donut with powdered sugar dusted heavily on top.  
Strawberry Cheesecake:
This is a jelly filled donut (I believe strawberry jelly - hence the strawberry in the name), with a glazed topping and a dusting pile of what I believe is graham crackers.  I don't get any cheesecake from this donut, so I don't know why they find the need to call it a strawberry cheesecake donut.
Toasted Coconut:
An old fashion cake donut with toasted coconut on top. If you like coconut, you will enjoy the coconut topping.
Overall, these donut were not terrible but they were not donuts that I 'gotta have' next time in Vegas.  
Side note - there is metered parking right in front of the business which only takes credit cards.  Best bet, have someone drop you off and circle around and pick you up to save money on parking!
Vegan donuts were yummy  grilled cheese was good next time I will ask for syrup for on top for a more breakfast feel of deliciousness!!

What a great place! I have to visit a local donut joint in every city I visit; so glad I picked this one! The young lady that helped me was super cute (I love a girl who can rock blue hair) & friendly. I was bummed they were out of the salted caramel until I saw the size of their fritters! I got the one with bacon- check out the pic. And I finally got a creme brûlée donut! So happy I did. Both were excellent. A bonus: the "artwork" in the bathroom!
Great coffee actually!! Of course huge variety of delicious donuts -but coffee lovers rest assured, good spot.

We are from OC. Went to Vegas & were recommended this place. I saw that the hours were until donuts sell out,  which was weird (looks like they close on average between 1 & 3). We decided today, on our last day in Vegas to show up right at opening (Thursday btw) we showed up at 6:55 am, we were the 2nd person waiting for them to open (Yes, waiting) the lady in front of us drive from an hour away for a donut for her boyfriend who's bday was today. Before we knew it, 3 more people behind us BEFORE opening. The people behind us also raved about this place.
We purchased 3 Triple Chocolate, 2 Cinnamon Sugar Donuts with Whip Topping and FRESH Strawberries, a Strawberry Cheesecake and I personally tried at least a bite of each flavor & loved them all.
We also purchased a Homer donut, which I didn't try and was told it was a little dry..but it's not my cup of tea anyway..lol.
My husband tried an Apple fritter which he loved so much that he texted me while at work to let me know he loved it. I have a nutella donut saved for tomorrow's breakfast and can't wait!!
I was told that they do not make the same flavors daily,  which is pretty cool and probably a bummer at the same time..but definitely a good reason to come early!! The lady behind the counter was friendly and knowledgeable, quick and patient with us indecisive customers which was greatly appreciated. I had been recommended the Horchata donut but was told they only make those at the San Diego location. Sounds like I'll have to make a trip, lol. But...will definitely be back to this location since Vegas is our home away from home!!

Loved donut bar. It was an honor to meet Chef Jeff.
Thank you once again for having me. You must try their famous grilled cheese and creme brulee donuts. I also really liked the Nutella explosion. The caramel latte donut is another honorable mention. If you get only one thing you must get the big poppa tart. It is incredible, probably the best donut I ever had! It has a pop tart with jam inside of it! Congratulations to Donut Bar on 2 years and once again thank you for having me!

I like my donuts, just look at my Yelp reviews. I visit donuts shops or bars or store fronts often. 

The ambience is great, the decor is definitely interesting, even the bathroom is painted with Homer Simpson and his donut. If you're a fan of the show Tanked, then the fish tank if the lobby will interest you because it's one of theirs. 

Their donuts are definitely a site to behold, all creatively decorated and looking delicious. 

However, I have had better donuts. I got a Wonder Woman donut, it was cute and it was good, but it wasn't really anything to rave about. 

My friend got a donut too, but her's was dry. Like take a but and crumbs everywhere dry. I don't think that should be the case when you eat donuts. 

So it's a cool place to see, but I don't know if I would make the effort to go back.

I've been coveting the Cremé Brûlée donut from donut bar ever since I heard that satisfying crunch on a viral video 4 years ago. (Give or take) l. Well, I finally returned to sin city and was able to get my paws on one. The crunch was just as satisfying as I was hoping, but the donut was overall just ok. Totally worth the money, but surprisingly dry inside. 

The filling is a custard, which helped the inside texture and kept he middle moist, but towards the sides, there was a staleness that was probably from the time of Day we went. I'm not sure how anyone wakes up before 10am after a night in Vegas, but if you're awake, I bet they are better. 

The place is incredibly cute, they have a donut fish tank that was adorable and a bathroom with every donut lovers favorite Simpsons scene. Worth the stop if you're visiting or the consistent visit if you're a local!
Best donuts... Hands down! I love donuts and this place has whilst favorites and other inventive choices. I highly recommend the maple bacon cinnamon roll.... To die for!

Finally made a trip out here!!!! The donuts looked amazing!!!! and of course very tasty and moist! Plus of it all was it wasn't too sweet like most donuts are! If you are looking for not overwhelming amounts of sugar this is place to visit! 

donuts ordered-
maple bourbon
Strawberry split
strawberry cheesecake

All were very tasty! Definitely coming back here and trying the others! 

Also if you are coffee lover, they do serve stumptown cold brew!!!

So Glad they opened one up in Vegas (Downtown) I'm not up super early so I usually grab what's left for a dollar before  they close  and enjoy some of Donut Bars best creations. Nitro Coffee on Tap!! And don't miss the French Toast donut cooked to order on weekends only. These guys from San Diego know how to make their donuts that's for sure. A must stop while in Vegas!
Recently moved from SD and was happy to find out Donut Bar was here in LV ! Extremely friendly staff and the donuts are to die for. Also don't forget your coffee the Mocha's pretty good.

This is new on our list in Vegas.  It will be a stop on each visit.   Order whatever you want...but the creme brûlée and the blueberry cheesecake donuts were outstanding.  Don't go to Vegas without stopping here.

Came here to grab donuts for a friend 
Everyone was helpful ..:.: looked like a little to much for me but I did taste test a little bit with a friend at work was yummy

Good donuts for the price. The salted caramel donut was big and fluffy for 3 dollars. The crepe brûlée was creek filled and had a crunchy top coating. Friendly service and nice place to pick up unusual donuts.
If you have an addictive personality stay away. The donuts are works of art and taste equally good. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and now unfortunately no other donut will ever stack up.

Really love this place ! I've been to the one in SD many times! This place never disappoints and they always have awesome new idea to do with doughnuts. And there Ice cream doughnut is awesome! That's a much have!! Highly recommend this place !!

I am obsessed with donuts, and Donut Bar only makes this worse.

The first time I went there, they had a special on birthday cake donuts.  I told them I wanted one of those, and one of the Homer Simpson inspired donuts.  The server placed two birthday cake donuts in my box, instead of one, as a special treat as it was opening week, along with the Homer donut.  When I told her it was also my birthday and that it was really cool, she put another donut in there!   I've been back several times, and still haven't gotten any other free donuts; however, let me just say, I've encountered the same friendly service!

Consider trying the chocolate milk or coffee on tap, and be sure to use the restroom, well, at least look in the restroom before leaving.  The restaurant itself is quite small, so please be sure to explore the courtyard area for more seating that is particularly nice on Spring and Summer mornings.

Thank you Donut Bar team for the tasty experience today. I know you were closing, but you still had a box of donuts to sell me and a free coffee. My son and I loved the donuts and that you let us hang out on the back patio even though you were trying to clean up and close for the day. Thank you for your hospitality. Vegas, support this business!!

Donuts after drinking in Vegas? Yes. 

I came here the morning after a night of drinking and what a good idea that was. My comrade and I picked up three donuts to sop up what was left of our Fat Tuesday drinks marinating in our digestive tracts. 

We picked up two giant donuts (one birthday cake and the other nutella) and one regular sized (strawberry shortcake). For me, the star was the strawberry shortcake. It's like one of those ice cream bars you'd eat as a kid (who am I kidding? I eat them as an adult too) but in donut form.  It's the cake donut type but it's all pinkish due to the strawberries in the donut. Yes. PLEASE. 

The larger donuts we got were the yeast type donuts. Both tasted the same except for the toppings. One was topped with frosting and sprinkles (that tastes like the canned frosting, yum) and the other nutella. Both delicious and easy to share between three people. 

I'm already yearning for these when I come back.

Award winning, nationally-known spot for donuts. This is a must-stop for donut lovers living in or visiting Vegas. But get there fast, because they usually sell out by 11 am. The store itself is very charming and they have a cool patio out back.

Came here for the first time and I must say, this place is pretty amazing. From unique donuts to classic donuts they all tasted great. I'd say its pretty pricey for some donuts but it's so worth it. They even ask for your name to put on the box so that makes me felt a little special. 

The staff is friendly and energized which is great for the downtown area. The drinks look amazing but I decided to get a simple strawberry milk and chocolate milk, which complemented the donuts even more. I'll definitely be coming back here. 

Some tips I'd recommend 
- Get there early preferably in the morning because they do sell till they run out of donuts.
- If its a nice day I'd recommend eating outside in the back because it has a nice feel to it. 
- Always get a drink even if its just milk!

We came here around 12:30pm before closing. I didn't expect to buy leftover donuts but they were a great deal at the moment so we decided to fill the box up with $10. Half of the box were all creme brûlée, the rest were weird unwanted assorted donuts. The donuts were cold, chewy and unappetizing. Maybe it was because we came late... I wasn't very happy but for the price, it was $1 per donut approximately. None of the donuts were that good, just taste like a regular mom and pop kind of place. 

I also got a Nitro infused coffee because the guy recommended me as something new to try. Pricey and wasn't worth it. The coffee was SOUR! I'm not sure if it's supposed to taste that way... I mean if you really put your mind to it, you might find it drinkable. I'm a huge coffee lover and it hardly got me to finish half after an hour of walking around downtown. 

BUT we will be back, earlier for fresher, warm, assorted donuts instead of leftovers! This place got potential and I will update the review with my next visit.

I really hate rating this place 3/5 but it's my duty to be honest.  I have been looking forward to trying this place since it's opening and two times made the journey downtown from the west side of town to see a sold out sign.  This third time we came on a Monday a little past 10am and it was open.  First off location for me is not convenient so I really was expecting something mind blowing. Bummer that it wasn't the case.  I did appreciate the different variety of choices.  I went for Reese's peanut butter cup since chocolate cake donuts are my favorite and the pop tart donut.  The topping on the Reese's donut was great but the cake donut itself was blah.  This opinion from the girl who thinks pink box chocolate cake donut with chocolate frosting and coco Krispy on top is crack!  The donut didn't have much flavor   Kinda felt like is was just eating a Reese's peanut butter cup. The pop tart donut gave me a little more satisfying feeling but the inconsistency between the edges and the middle was a let down.  Wish the jelly filling was spread more evenly throughout rather than a bit splatter in the middle. In the end I'm very sorry to say I threw them away after a few bites each.  Anyone who knows how much I love donuts know that's shocking!  If I'm in the neighborhood I would give it one more try and try a few different types but definitely will not go out of my way again when pink box, Dunkin' Donuts and Winchells are within 2 miles from me.

A little off the beaten path but well with the trip! We got the crème brûlée, blueberry Meyer lemon, vanilla bean, s'mores, Nutella overload, and Nutella glazed. They were all amazing! Hoping we have time to head back before we leave. The staff was helpful and friendly! Would defiantly recommend!
A diabetic's nightmare but for the love of all donuts...a true gem of a place. Drip coffee in all sorts of flavor but the latte is the one to get for sipping. Maple glazed bacon on a donut...o.m.g!

I got the strawberry split, omg so yummy! Only problem was I ordered a mocha and it taste like coffee beans no flavor at all! Sad face, but definitely will be back and will recommend to others, donut was so light, so delicious so fresh! I don't any other donut place has these many options when it comes to donuts. It was so many to choose from, I wanted them all, but definitely will be back since it's right up the street from work

People seemed to go crazy for the creme brulee donut but it's alright tbh. I was also excited for the flavors I was hoping would be good like red velvet and strawberry cream cheese and it was also just alright. However, the oh my birthday cake oreo donut was delicious! That one by far is my favorite. I would probably only come back just for that.
Fun donut shop with really interesting flavors. Try the Big Poppa Tart or Creme Brûlée!

Amazing little hole in the wall of of near Freemont. Staff is really quick and efficient at their job as well as just being plain nice.
The donut though...they are just decadence in glaze. These things are huge and tasty as all he'll.
The bigger ones are bigger than my hand and the smaller ones about the size of a donut from a franchise chain.
I'll be coming back in the future when visiting  Vegas.

Easiest 5 stars EVER. 

First of all it's donuts so thats an easy 4 stars just for existing. The location is a bit tucked away which adds to the mystique of this dynamic donut experience. If you're staying in the downtown area and you have a free morning forget cheap steak and eggs. Bloody Mary's can wait... and a breakfast buffet is usually disgusting. These gourmet donuts will change the way you look at this breakfast novelty forever.

Anything with bacon comes with REAL bacon. Not those stingy little crumbles at other places. This bacon was thick cut, maple cured, and had a crunch that sticks to your jaws. EVERY SINGLE FLAVOR POPPED! The glazes are delicious and leave you with an angel like after taste. 

I suggest looking at the pictures. Try not to drop your phone with amazement. Yes the presentation is an important part of a business like this. The passerbys or window shoppers will NEVER be disappointed walking into this business. These oversized breakfast treats are worth every penny. 

Here's a few suggestions
- Creme Brulee ( it cracks when you bite into it)
- Brad Fritter ( its an apple fritter covered in caramel drizzle and a mountain of THICK cut bacon)
- The Homer ( its a giant donut just like the one from the Simpson's)
- Chai Latte ( it was like sipping on a cloud)

5th star factor for me was easily the mountain of bacon I received on top of my donut. It was definitely more then the 2 strips of loneliness you get at a Denny's or any other morning diner. The service was excellent, but damnit the bacon was over the top.
Great service, beautiful donuts! Yummy, fun donuts! This menu is long and creative! Cake batter donut, Homer Simpson donut....

We came here after having a late brunch at eat across the street. They were about to close and had a $10 for box of donuts deal !!! SCORE. I've been to the donut bar in SD on a weekday morning when they had more selection, but this time i still got to try some donuts I wanted to try. 

We ended up with about 15 donuts, including the lemon blueberry (delicious ), a massive strawberry sugar whipped cream, strawberry pop tart donut, creme Brulee, chocolate buttermilk bar, and chocolate bacon. 

Check in gets you a free drip coffee or espresso !! 

The staff here is super friendly and welcoming, and I would definitely come again because they have lots of different flavors to try and it never gets boring.
Exploring Fremont Street in Las Vegas and came across this fabulous don't shop! Over sized yummy donuts. If you are in the area be sure to stop by. You won't be disappointed!
Amazing!!! Love local places that treat people like people. They are amazing and their donuts are even better!!!!

I was SO excited to try Donut Bar. I got there around 11:30 and ordered 5 donuts. Guess what? Every single one was stale. 

So disappointed.

We got here at noon also, and also found there to be no line.  We were excited to try it, and pleasantly surprised that they had several vegan donut choices.  And it was buy one get one free, so we were out of there for under $4.

The donuts were very very sweet.  I know donuts are supposed to be sugary but this took it to a new level.  My teeth hurt a little, so I picked the fruit off of the top and threw the rest away.  My husband said that he had to do the same with his. 

That said, we did arrive late so we had slim pickings.  Perhaps if we got there earlier, we would have had more choices?

I don't come to Vegas without stopping here first! After eating here I never eat donuts anywhere else. Great service, charming location (their back patio is lovely), and THE DONUTS ARE SIMPLY AMAZING! They live up to the hype! Creme brûlée and peanut butter cup are probably my two favorites but any donut they have is soooo worth the calories! Also, if they still have donuts left later in the day sometimes you can get a box for $10 but those are rare occasions!

If there was a great kaiju battle between Voodoo Doughnuts and The Doughnut Bar, the entire west coast would be deliciously destroyed. Thankfully these two places are far enough apart that we are safe (for now).  These doughnuts ARE art. They look as delicious as they taste. The signature creme brûlée is truly a marvel and the maple bacon is poetry. When one dreams of doughnuts one dreams of The Doughnut Bar. Is this too over the top a review? I can't tell when I am under the influence of maple an and bacon.
Soooooo sooooo good! Really happy I can still find yummy vegan donuts in this town. Only down side: music is so loud you have to yell sometimes to place your order.

Love this place. Super cute. Friendly staff. The lady took the time to explain all their flavors, what they recommend, etc. 

Small seating area inside but there's a back courtyard that has more seating.

Donuts were good. Fresh and soft. My fav was the Nutella donut and salted caramel.

I was disappointed that they didn't have some of their other flavors available like the caramel latte but apparently they rotate the flavors.

I'll definitely be back. This place was great.

This place is a must!! It's on a side street but def the visit... the donuts are fresh & I am embarrassed to say I ate the damn apple fritter three days latter & it was SLAMMING  absolutely delicious. Purchased a box of goodies for $10 oh yeah  anything toy can fit in the box for $10.. amazingly yummy

Big. Ass. Chewy. Lemon. Pistachio. Donut. Drool.

Also they close when they sell out.  We were very sad yesterday.

Can you come back to California with me?

Love this place!! I've been here twice and both visits proved that quality is consistent. I went with the peanut butter donut and the maple bacon one and although more cake like than donut, both were delicious and worth the visit. I came late in the day on the second visit as I was with my brothers, so the selection was still good, but not everything was available. My brother loved the Nutella donut and the cream pie eclair was a hit with both of them. Coffee was strong and will definitely wake you up!

Check out the new fish tank they installed in October 2016 and this is no ordinary tank. It's filled with donut shaped ornaments that almost look like the real thing. How clever! 

We'll definitely be back and maybe even try the french toast donut next time. This place is a hit  as far as I'm concerned. Parking is on the street and is metered, but I can't see anyone staying more than an hour in this place. They are open until 1 pm or until they sell out of donuts, so for the best selection, get there early. Mmmm....can't wait to go back!!

The donuts and coffee were ok but my wife really liked the French toast donut.
