More tables outside in the back but inside is limited in space. -1 Star: During our visit there was guy that appeared to know an employee or maybe the owner and he was blocking the counter like he owned the place. Maybe he was the owner but it was still annoying.

Omg!!!! Best DONUTS  ever!!!!
Super friendly service. If your a fan of donuts don't miss out on this place you won't be disappointed.
Love the fun donuts and great service! The line can get a bit log, but they move so fast it's not an issue. The outside seating makes this a fun breakfast stop!
The biggest donuts in town friendly service music coffee drinks easy parking did I say donuts? Offering custom French Toast on Sundays. I recommend you treat yourself here often
Great place, nice people, they sell out quick so come early. They have coffee self serve. Come for the donuts not the coffee really cute place.

So I've been here three times now and like a fine wine, it just keeps getting better with every passing day.

The Donut Bar has been killing it since day one here in Vegas, by staying true to classic fried delights of my childhood, but also upgrading a few of the sprinkled covered favorites. I've tried good portion of the offerings here, but the real standouts for me are the coconut covered donut, The Old fashioned, the peanut butter chocolate, the Pop-Tart donut, and a classic pink frosted donut simply dubbed, "The Homer".

Every bite is soft; flavor packed and melts in your mouth. The icing on all of these gorgeous bakery beauties is made in house along all the donut fillings, no store bought stuff here. This process of making in everything in-house really helps to keep the quality on point; three visits later and the donuts have the same mouthwatering consistency. I will keep traveling here for these amazing donuts all the way from Henderson which wasn't the case for O' Face, R.I.P. Sorry, but a dry donut that's lavender and lemon flavored just wasn't for me, especially when they cost close $6 a piece. 

If you simply can't decide on what calorie bombs to order, just have the people behind the counter put together a half  for you, trust me it will be amazing. Don't forget the coffee, they have Stumptown Nitro Brew on tap along with chocolate and strawberry milk being tapped daily as well. That's enough right there to visit this place. 

Donuts. Just do it!

Beetus Heaven!!! This place was so legit. I was intimidated because there's just columns and rows of sinful pleasures!  We stopped in around 10am and the sweet counter girl said they sold out of a lot of flavors, honestly, you wouldn't even have noticed bc it was still jam packed with Doughnuts.  I decided with the Nutella Doughnut and lemme say this.. every pastry I've had for the last 30 years on this green Earth tasted like trash compared to this.   It just melted in your mouth and the fricken thing was huge for only $3. Definitely a highlight on our trip.
Friendly staff and a clean establishment. Wide variety of different flavors of donuts.
No words for this deliciousness. At least four types of vegan donuts every day - not sure which is my fav because they're all so incredibly good. It is an honor to pay $3 each for these donuts :-)

The donuts here are to die for!! Wow!  I couldn't believe how amazing and different they were. And the coffee...wow!!!  Do yourself a favor and head down here! You won't regret it. the staff is super sweet, helpful and full of spirit!!! Best donut shop in Vegas!

I've been to Vegas quite a few times, but never have I searched out for a breakfast or donut place. For some reason I did this time and it was probably the best decision of my life!!! Quite possibly the best donuts (gourmet) that I have ever had. Located downtown, near Fremont Street (sp).

By the time we got there on a Saturday morning, maybe 9am, I guess their signature strawberry shortcake or whatever was sold out :( but we were able to try some amazing other donuts.

1. Crème brulee - they try and immolate the real dessert, and it doesn't disappoint. I normally don't like cream filling donuts, but this was light and sweet all that the same time.

2. Oreo / Bday cake - tasted just like it sounds

3. Some sort of strawberry filled donut

All three were amazing, coming from a chocolate and glazed kind of guy. The even more amazing thing is that they only cost around $2-3, so hopefully they don't raise their prices, bc that is an insane deal! There are some higher end donuts near where I live and they definitely don't hold a candle to Donut Bar!!

It will probably now become one of my Vegas staples!!
Omg wow yummy delish love love love their donuts,  we go to the one in Las Vegas and everything is so good so everytime we go we get one of each

I met a friend here to play catch up and try their vegan doughnuts. It's located on 6th and Carson and parking is plentiful... bring change or a credit card. All parking is metered. 

I walked in and was greeted by a super friendly staff. Everyone was so nice and welcoming. My friend was there waiting with a vegan green matcha tea doughnut, a creme brûlée, and a apple fritter. We headed outside to the court yard and went to town. 

The apple fritter was the best donut I've ever eaten. It was crispy on the outside and soft and warm on the inside. There was real apples scattered throughout the donut. The green matcha tea was a delicious cake donut that wasn't overly sweet and had orange zest. It was delicious. The creme brûlée was soft and oozed out a delicious and thick creme. I was thoroughly impressed... in fact... it was happy hour when we were done so I got an entire variety box for 5 dollars and gave them to my family and friends. 

This is definitely my new favorite donut place. I can't wait to come back and try more of their vegan options!

I've been reading all the rave reviews about this place. Went there around 10am.  Our donuts were awful.  The glaze/frosting on the tops were so dried out. It seemed like the donuts had been out since the day before.  My husband ordered the maple bacon. The bacon in top wasn't even cooked all the way! The fat wasn't even rendered out of it!  The maple was so dry it was cracked and caked off!  Disappointing after reading how amazing it was.

Great choices!
Great atmosphere and easy ordering system.
Our choices weren't overly sweet which was good because the doughnuts were huge!
Vanilla latte was made perfectly with timed espresso. Yum

They ran out of a lot of donuts by the time I got there so I ordered what was left. So I got the PB&J and thought it was just okay. The donuts were $1.50-$3 each but they are huge so that justifies the cost. I might come back at and earlier time to try freshly made donuts. The donuts texture is somewhere between a Krispy Kreme and Dunkin Donut texture.
Really good donuts. They have a nice selection as well. Never thought pop tarts in donuts would be so good. Only knock is the location and the price is a bit high.
"Best donuts in the world!" They truly exceed the expectations of this line! I had the cinnamon roll with maple bacon... And the creme brûlée donut and these two are my favorites! Highly recommended

First time coming here, it was really warm and welcoming. They have some absurdly delicious doughnuts and really friendly service. Hidden gem.. ? go sneak through the back door and enjoy your confections in the lovely secret courtyard! thank me later. ;)

This place runs out of donuts pretty quick. We went in around maybe 11 AM and most of the donuts or kind of gone they only had a few flavors. I took some of the last ones of certain flavors. There was this really good looking doughnut and Lady right in front of me ordered it. After I placed my order a tour guide brought a whole bunch of people. 

I love the donut but I got it was this huge donut I don't remember the name of it but it was like caramel with chocolate. I didn't get any of their drinks just donuts. Next time I'm in Vegas I will make sure to wake up early and come.

Oh and I also got the crème brûlée donut that everyone is always raving about. I personally didn't really like it because of the hardshell. I like my donuts to be soft and it was pretty cool to crack it and the cream tasted super good but it's just not for me.

This placee is awesome! They made me some custom Chicago Cubs donuts and made me look so good at work this morning!  Thank you for making those for me they looked so good and we're delicious! The look on everyones face at work was priceless! You guys aren't only making donuts but your creating memories too! Sweet! Congratulations to the Chicago Cubs! 2016 World Champs!
This place is legit.....such good quality, big tasty donuts that are unique and addictive!!!   Shout out to Joe/Jeff for their great service.

My friend showed me a video on Facebook about the Donut Bar and the creme brulee looked amazing so I knew we had to stop by when we were in Vegas. My friend actually went to the Donut Bar by Fremont Street and got us donuts while we stayed back at our hotel with our babies. The creme brulee were to die for, the donuts with the poptart in the middle were huge, almost the size of my 2 month old, and they were so rich and fulfilling. See my video...

Once upon a time I would say that waking up early and heading to the local donut shoppe prior to opening, waiting outside discussing what indulgences we will enjoy as we waft in the delicious aroma sounded like a scene from some cute 80's or 90's romantic comedy. Well in a world where life inmates art, that is exactly the concept behind the now nationally recognized Donut Bar. 

I work in a hotel in Downtown San Diego, and people from around the country ask for this place, by name! With a line out the door all the time, arrive early and expect to wait, but don't worry, you will not me disappointed. Its like willy wonka drank a bunch of local craft beer and conceptualized some of these out of this world breakfast desserts. 

My suggestion is to buy at least 3: 1 to eat immediately. 1 to sit down upstairs and enjoy with some coffee. and 1 to give to someone else.

Suggested to us by a security guard, a couple blocks of The Fremont Street Experience. You see the picture, delectable. A little pricey, but it is Vegas.... Well worth every penny. Don't often crave a donut, bit glad I did today. Walking distance, close to hotel, perfect. Well worth your text and Penny's, priceless!!!!

Visited from out of town and a friend recommended this spot! We got the Mexican Hot Chocolate, Creme Brûlée, Homer and Cake Batter doughnuts. All were good. Creme Brûlée was liiiiittle dry, but still delicious. Will be back!!

I was checking in on Facebook at "A cut above the rest" when "donut bar" popped up. I decided to Google Map where this "Donut Bar" is and I was a block away. It was almost closing time so only a limited donuts were available. They were so excited and welcoming from the minute I walked in that I wanted to buy a shirt from them. They invited me to look them on social medias and return the next morning for a better selection. It's not too far from Fremont Experience. The whole staff is very humble and knowledgeable. Don't wait till last minute to "stop by".
Amazing. Incredible. Best donuts ever. Pink box, move down because you have been unseated as best donut in town. It's not even close.

The donuts are not worth $4! Dunkin' and Krispy Cream are much better in my opinion, and worth a whole lot more. Thats the last $12 bucks of mine you'll see!! 
You got me with the "Sold Out" signs, NEVER AGAIN!
Cute shop. Donuts are AMAZING. So soft  if you went for the grand opening you'd get a free donut..

Had a creme brulee and a caramel latte. The donuts were great. The creme brulee is a bit overrated. It's essentially a custard donut with a hard caramel coating. Good, but I was expecting something a little more eggy and dense in terms of the filling. The donuts are huge btw. not a bad thing but makes sampling difficult and pricey. Good for sharing. It's a little tight inside but there's plenty of patio seating in the back.
Amazing donuts and fun staff! Come hungry and with a sweet tooth. Their donuts as so delicious!
The store closed at one, we come in late, get three of the last donuts, but they are unbelievably delicious. They are not too sweet, soft and tasty.

A good place to go to at least once. Depending on the time of day and weekend, the line will be out the door. They have a variety of different fancy donuts. It is a small little place with not much seating. There is a back patio area if you don't mind sitting in the heat. Staff were very friendly! Make sure not to miss the fish tank inside.

This is an amazing hidden gem serving up some amazing donuts. The variety and uniqueness is mouthwatering. The chocolate empire, homer and cream brûlée were all delightful. The staff is very friendly. Pricing is very good.

When you walk into Donut Bar you are a little overwhelmed with all the different donut choices. It's super hard to pick just 1 or 2. I tried a few different donuts and I have to admit I was a little disappointed with the taste. I think the presentation of the donut out weighs the taste. I expected more flavor. For example one of the donuts I tried was the snickers donut. Now that sounds like it should be wonderful however I didn't taste any hint of snickers flavor, it just tasted like a chocolate donut and a little dry too. 
The staff was super friendly and helpful explaining the different flavors. But honestly if I lived in Vegas I don't know if I'd stop here again.

Wow! Super cute and tastier than I expected! I don't usually like donuts. I'm from Alabama, where donuts are deep fried and glazed, and usually I'm not interested in a cake donut. These were spectacular! They look amazing and crazy and delicious and they are ALL of those things. I had the apple crumble. It was fluffy, moist, flavorful and not overwhelmingly sweet. It went perfectly with the coffee. Next time, gonna take a few people and tackle the Brad Fritter or one of those massive poppa dough beauties!

After getting to experience Donut Bar in San Diego, I was stoked to find out they were coming to Vegas!  We popped in today during their soft opening and not only did they have plenty of donuts and no line but we met the man behind the donuts.  

Friendly staff, we were greeted with smiles and offer suggestions on what to order.  I chose a plain old fashioned donut, the Homer, a caramel latte and last but certainly not least....the Poptart!!!!  Which I topped off with a cold brew Stumptown coffee.

In the words of Ice Cube "today was a good day"!

We got the closing special so we tried a lot of donuts. Honestly I think they're okay. I've had specialty donuts and these were cool but I wouldn't come back. I didn't particularly care for any of them, I didn't like the donut batter itself. The crème brulee wasn't sweet enough and I don't normally like super sweet things but something was just off. These aren't bad but aren't the best specialty donuts I've had. 

The search continues!

There is a reason why Donut Bar was voted best donut in Las Vegas let alone in the country by numerous sites.  Donut Bar has a wide variety of donuts that can meet everyone's needs.  All of their donuts are made to perfection.  They are light, fluffy, gooey, and any other adjective you can think of.  The french toast donut is the go to donut.  Just imagine a massive circular french toast covered in powered sugar and then the drizzle of the warm maple syrup.  Other donuts to consider would be the Big Pappa Donut which has a whole pop tart inside the donut!  This thing weights 1lb!  Next you have to get the creme brulee donut which is a soft yeast round filled with creme brulee and topped with caramelized sugar!  The next must have would be the Oh My Birthday Cake Oreo which is Birthday Cake Oreo stuffed donut topped with cake batter glaze, pastel sequins, and cookie crumbs.  This place is also very welcoming.  The staff is super friendly and the head Chef Jeff is one of the nicest people you will ever meet!  So, if you are in Vegas and you are craving Donuts and coffee (They Serve Nitro Cold Brew Too) stop by Donut Bar!  Donut miss out!

BrandonFitFoodie

Today was the first time my family and I have been to this great place. And we loved it!!! The kids for the free donuts which were Inside Out themed, I had the Butter Beer donut, and my other half had the French Toast Donut (made to order). To drink we had 2 small drips (self service), and the kids had strawberry milk. The staff was super helpful and friendly, Chef Jeff gave the kiddos balloons and interacted with them. We will definitely be coming back!!

I wish I loved you. I wish we would have worked out. Maybe I'll give you another go when I'm in the area. The workers there were friendly so I gave two stars.

WHY I DIDN'T LIKE IT: 
-Donuts dry. I tried several too. The creme brulee which I thought I would love but the sugary top made it hard for me to eat. The birthday cake one with the oreo in it was super dry. The blueberry donut was the saving grace out of the donuts. Pretty moist and flavorful but not enough for me to want to go back there. 

WHY I NEED TO GO BACK:
-I came late, maybe that's why the donuts were dry? I don't know. 
-I want that strawberry whipped cream one. It looks good, so Ill go early to try it.
-Everyone needs a second chance.
Great! Huge, delicious donuts and super strong cold brew coffee. They are only open for a few hours a day so be sure to get there early before they run out!

Best donut shop in Vegas. The pop tart donut is a must try!

Also my son had strawberry milk that comes out of a tap! It was mad good!

For real delicious!

XOXOX
Chris from BUNNYFiSH!

We bought a dozen of there donuts and then had a sampling. There was lot of hype that built this place up. First off they don't open until 8 am on the weekends, for someone like me 8 am might as well be noon on the weekends. 
The glaze and toppings they put on their donuts is really good, the dough though is too much. It's too "bready".  To me it doesn't taste like a cake donut, it taste like 4 slices of white Weber's bread (sans the crust of course) with topping on it.To me a donuts dough should be on the light side of sweet and cakey.. maybe they bake them here, I can't say for sure. I can be a bit snobbish about my donuts, but everyone in our group agreed on that one point, I listed above.

This place was amazing! I stared at the pictures at work drooling all day on Friday lol and we went Saturday morning, the pictures don't even do this place justice! The kids LOVED the donuts and the milk on tap! I had a hazelnut ice coffee, I saw someone on here with one.. it was delicious I wish I could go here everyday! It was PACKED that's how you know its about to be good! And we loved the little patio area in the back it was so cute and everyone was very friendly! We will def be going back!

Wowza! We heard about Donut Bar and last week I was fortunate to have a weekday off for a change. We found Donut Bar, just off the Strip's northern end, and parked in front at the pay to park. The display is varied and colorful, while not overwhelming and the shop itself is warm and cozy. Staff are very helpful as we had lots of questions. We had already drooled over their photo of blueberry with Meyer lemon topping: amazing. So I, like a socially isolated cave hermit, right away asked "do you still ave the blueberry" while my poor husband was trying to speak. The creme brulee was the next choice, followed by Mexican Hot Chocolate and Oreo. We took some old fashioneds to go. Well, now. I post healthy foods and recipes online, but donuts are an exclusion and we do indulge! All of these donuts were superb!! We sat in the small indoor bench area next to the Donut fish tank. The coffee was wonderful- a good alternative to your run of the mill donut shop. The quality and inventiveness add up to a big 5 BFFDS for me. If you must ask, that's "best friendly fantastic donut supplier".
Vegan options are here too, evidently.
Check it out: DB Las Vegas is a winner!!

Donuts are yummy ! My fav is the creme brûlée donut :) they always have a long line and run out of donuts ! I heard they usually run out of donuts around noon time . So if you are planning on trying them out make sure to come well ahead of this to ensure yourself a wide selection. 

One bad thing however is that they make their donuts a night ahead of time when then are all sold out.

Holy Moly great selection of donuts some Giant! I mean would feed 3 people but anyways peanut butter with jelly filled good, Strawberry cream cake good and Maple Bacon really good. Stumptown Coffee which was a nice treat definitely must try this place!

I want to start off by saying I've never actually gone inside the establishment, but I follow them on Instagram and all the fitness models post epic cheat meals with these donuts. So~ when my friend went to Vegas, I made him bring home a dozen for me. Little did I know, a dozen would actually be 2 big boxes! It was totally worth making him lug it around though. Because these donuts were so bomb! We do not have anything like these in Philly. I mean a donut with a poptart in it?! 

Anyways, after cutting a piece of each flavor to taste them, I ended up freezing them because I couldn't possibly eat them all in one sitting, well I could, but I decided I shouldn't. Well let me tell you, have any of you guys tried frozen donuts before? It was probably even better than when I tried it fresh! How could that be possible?! Well some of the donuts were too sweet when I had it fresh (the poptart one especially) and when it was frozen it was the perfect amount of sweetness. 

I still dream of eating these donuts. I need to make a trip to Vegas.

I would leave 5 stars if I could, but since my friend pre-ordered two dozen and picked up for me I cannot comment on the physical location or the staff. I can say that my friend had no issues placing his the order or picking it up in the morning.

Forgive me for not knowing exact amounts but there were a lot of the matcha green tea cake donuts, several blueberry lemon cake donuts, and some raspberry pistachio yeast donuts. I was most excited for the matcha donuts because I'm obsessed with matcha. This donut was an absolute success, it made the perfect cake donut. It was sweet but not overly so and the matcha flavor was prominent without being overbearing. I loved the texture of it as a cake donut, definitely could have eaten twenty more of these.

I then tried the raspberry pistachio yeast donut which was as big as my face. Seriously, the thing was HUGE! I'm generally not a fan of yeast donuts because they lack flavor, this yeast donut however had the perfect fluffy texture and was buttery. the raspberry pistachio icing was incredible as well, slightly tart but mostly sweet with subtle hints of pistachio. It melted in my mouth with each bite, I was sad but very full when it was all over.

I really want to go back to try their creme brûlée donut, as well as any others they're offering. I'm reading reviews about their donuts being dry but I didn't have that experience at all. I think Donut Bar's donuts are way better than the donuts O-Face used to sell. I'm hoping when I can check out the physical location I can update my review to 5 stars.

Super cute, super friendly staff. Unique looking and large in size donuts, do you get your monies worth. However, some were lacking in flavor. For example, the Nutella was basically just like a chocolate glazed. It was good though. We also felt rushed and pushed down the line. I felt like i didn't even get to look at all the choices because of that. If you want to sit and eat there, they do have seating outside. I loved the outside sitting area. Very cute and peaceful.

Wow and WOW!!! I have been anticipating trying these heavenly breaths of life for months (when I frequented SD often, but could NEVER get up early enough to experience one). Well this morning, I was determined to make it happen. Since its recent opening downtown, I had no excuses to push this aside; Get out of bed and get those darn donuts before they sell out...AGAIN!

Me + 2, 8am, slightly raining and a line out the door, I seriously couldn't have been more excited. The line of people were also in a good mood which made the wait pleasant. Standing in the rain, 1/2 awake, and before coffee!?? I could've cared less, especially because my experience was great.

Once in the door, the menu was pleasingly overwhelming, incredibly creative options, and Vegan options as well. We got the crème brûlée, Strawberry Split, French Toast, and the Maple Bacon Cinnamon Rolls.

To the staff: You are epic!! The upbeat attitude, smiles all around, and patience during your power hours are much appreciated. It felt like we were being hosted in your home AND that we were the only customers there during our order. You unexpectedly exceeded my expectations with your service and good vibes

Simply delicious. Always fresh and consistent. We love the customer service and the smile on everybody's face. We are visiting the location almost every Saturday with the kids and we never had a bad experience. Thank you Donut Bar for sweetening our family weekend. 

I highly recommend this place to anybody that wants to try next level donuts.

This place isn't open for long hours so you better get there early. Friendly staff and huge selection of donuts to choose from. And these are gourmet donuts not some cheap stuff. I highly suggest going there as early as you can. Keep up the great work. Btw choc milk goes great with their donuts :) creme brûlée is my fave ;)
Literally one of the best donuts I've ever had. I had a Red Velvet donut. Highly recommend this place

I've been here about ten times. 6 for just a cup of coffee, 4 for the donuts. I don't get it. I try and try and try and I can't bring myself to get excited over them. We came here when they first opened and I thought "They don't have their temperatures/ measurements converted to the altitude of Vegas" as they're a shop based out of San Diego if
I'm remembering correctly. 

If you order a plain donut that's not filled or stuffed with a cookie, they're all dry :(. The worst part is that they're so expensive. A single plain donut is $2. Anywhere else a single glazed donut is .99 cents or less. They only get more expensive the more "creative" they get. The French toast donut is really good but doesn't need the syrup or extra blueberry topping since the donut is already covered in powdered sugar AND glaze. When you're feeling extra gluttonous I think it hits the spot. The only other saving grace is their hazelnut Kona coffee which I think I found the same one online so I can save myself the trip, parking meter fee, and disappointment of dry donuts.

How did I forget to write a review here!?!? What's not to love about this super awesome donut place? My favorite here is the Pop-tart Donut. It's literally a WHOLE pop tart INSIDE a donut with a sugar glaze on top and sprinkles. It's Huuuge!!! Top that with a cup of Stumptown (my favorite!) Coffee and I'm gold! 

**A super plus is that on Saturday's, kids get a free donut! 

I don't have any pictures to post but as you can see, The Donut Bar has lots of pictures already posted. :)

LITERALLY SO AMAZING! I love this place. If I am feeling like treating myself i will get a donut but usually just a coffee. Let me tell you when I say the coffee is seriously some of the best I have ever had, like EVER. I HIGHLY recommend stopping by this cute local place, the earlier you go the better because once they sell out they are done for the day! The earlier you go the better flavors they have-just saying.

4.8 stars. What's not to love?! Giant, fresh donuts, lots of choices, free donut for the kids, free water, clean bathrooms, seating outdoors and at a counter... 

Yup, lived up to the hype. $1.50-$6, but the donuts are supersized. Quality. 

My favorite was the maple glazed bacon donut. Light, not was sweet as the others... Crispy, salty bacon. 

Old town/downtown Vegas, a few miles North of the strip.

Donuts are amazing!! They have a different menu everyday, had to wake up early but was worth waiting outside for a good 30 minutes. Glad nothing was sold out when we were inside. Looks dull outside but inside is very cute.

We visited the Donut Bar on a Monday in late April. It wasn't busy. Great selection of donuts. The coffee was pretty awesome. We loved all the donuts, my favorite was the Strawberry Shortcake. Going into this visit I was expecting overwhelming sweetness. It was not the case. All donuts were well balanced!

I am so glad that they brought what San Diego has been raving about to my town, Las Vegas. --now downtown just got better, just got sweeter! I am a fan of the frenchtoast donut with the Nitro Coffee, that's all you need! :) And, beware of their drip coffee--particularly the portland roast, --coz DAMN, it's good!

My gf brought me home a box of donuts while she was working. They looked very appealing, looks can be deceiving. They honestly were probably some of the worst donuts I've ever had. They were very dry and super doughy. The donuts at Smiths are wayyyy better than this place. I will deft not be returning.

Neat little place north of the strip. However donuts sub par. The Homer was a unique big donut. But that's about it. It's dry and topped with sugary frosting. The creme brûlée was hard to bite into. If you want good donuts - try Voodoo donuts in Oregon or Denver, CO.

Of course I'm sure the "regular" donuts tasted far better.. but we arrived at 10am and found there to be only 3 vegan options. The apple fritter was so burnt it was black on top. I got it anyways hoping that inside would be a delicious fritter experience... nope. Dry and tasted burnt. Tossed  in the trash.  The creme brûlée was alright. I have had better.  The last was a cake donut. Can't even remember the flavor. It was good. But not good enough to spend the amount of money I did.  
I would much rather got to Voodoo Donuts where they have atleast 10 different AMAZING vegan donuts at one time.

Can not for the life of me figure out what the hype is all about! Disgusting abominations of sugar on top of sugar, dense bready thick, dry, stupidly huge, so called donuts. 
 Husband went downtown early sat to get some to try since we heard about the place being so great and that they "sell out". Yeah ok. All first timers or tourists and not repeat customers I'd be sure! 
2 days later and they are still sitting on my counter, most untouched, after we "tried" a tasting of a few of them..... And I have a house full of kids, one of which is a teenage boy,  if that tells you anything! If they won't eat it you KNOW it's bad! Lol! 
The cream brûlée (best seller!?! Ugh!) was disgusting. Tasteless hard coating of topping that sticks in your teeth on top of basically bread with literally a teaspoon amount of supposed Bavarian creme (also not made fresh, definitely out of a can). Ick! Every one we tried had the exact same tasteless dense dense dense bread like dough. I would compare it very much like the French bread loaves you get at Walmart for $1 topped or filled with multiple variations of whatever disgusting sugar concoction you can think of. Frosting (any of them) is nothing special and entirely pointlessly overdone, tastes like store bought in the cake isle. Apple tart topped with bacon one was dry (as were all of them due to the "bread" dough they use). I'm not sure how in the world you can make an apple filling tasteless but they did it! Dumped straight out of a can. Super disappointed since that one looked the most promising. The pop tart one... Well that is one that is still sitting untouched on the counter. Just grossly huge, pop tart wrapped in bread, filled with some sort of sickly sweet jelly, and topped with more sugar type topping. Oh! And sprinkles! Puke! My kids wouldn't even touch it. 
There is also a sponge bob one so decorated with the gross frosting that my 7 yr old didn't event attempt it. 
Basically it is clear that the object of this place is to make things "look" interesting enough to buy but absolutely no attention to actual taste, quality or ingredients. Nothing even remotely tastes like it was hand made fresh. Everything is ingredients you can buy in the cake isle (and bread isle) at the grocery store and make yourself. Blagh! 
Hey #donutbar...You can stop saying #bestdonutsintheworld now please! 
My recommendation and by far superior quality, taste, freshness, service, and overall care of product is #deesdonuts on centennial and Durango! Go check them out and see the difference!

Huge gourmet donut selections. Plenty of coffee flavors and creams to add if you like.  Very nice staff and great management. 
I had never heard of the plane as I never go downtown. When we got a sweet craving while there Yelp helped us find this gem. 
I lived it and told my friends and family. It will be fun to try another monster sized sweet treat

Yes the vegan donuts are more expensive but vegan food is ALWAYS more expensive its just reality..lol PLUS we're in Vegas. I do love how their close enough to walk to. I don't care for the vegan creme brulee donut I think it's just a waste of money in my opinion, but I do love the vegan strawberry donut it is A-MA-ZING. I take it home & add maple syrup and - OMG. The staff is also very nice but the one complaint we had is the INSANELY LOUD music they play. Its just obnoxious. Ok ok I get that its called donut BAR so maybe that's why their playing loud music - but you can't even HEAR each other when placing an order or have a conversation while enjoying your donut! Lol I just don't care to yell my orders to the cashier that's all. And from the name, we thought they would actually have a bar where you could sit or at least be open past 1pm, BUT  its definitely worth it when we have those cheat days!

Very fulfilling! Great variety of donuts. I had the strawberries and cream and it was delicious!!! Couldn't finish it in one sitting so I saved the other half for later, surprisingly it was still soft and tasted just as good, did not get stale or hard...

Fast service. Clean, unique spot. But can we talk about these donuts already? Like for real!!!!! The creme brûlée is everything you could imagine. For once, believe the hype!!! The filling is flavorful and luxurious. Pink box aint got nuthin on this place. Shared some others with my fam. Nutella, some giant strawberry pop tart one and a blueberry lemon. All were fabulous! Coffee was also really good. This is a cute place for a breakfast date. P.s.- theres outside seating in the back.

This review is for the Creme brûlée donut. Texture was great---crisp caramelized sugar glaze with a creamy center. However, the taste was very lacking. The caramelized sugar tasted burnt and had a slight bitterness to it. The donut itself and the creme barely had any taste. It wasn't too sweet (which is a bonus for me) but it wasn't too ANYTHING. Im kind of disappointed and I've definitely had better donuts for cheaper prices. On a positive note, very cute inside and service was great! Parking can be a bit tricky--the parallel parking available near the store is all pay-to-park

So me and my mother came down because we heard about these doughnuts and unfortunately i wasn't super impressed. They were good just not for the price we had gotten the strawberry splits and the doughnut was a little hard on top and cream was a little stiff. We also had the creme brulee which was the more expensive doughnut and wasn't worth the price.

Tried Donut Bar yesterday based on the reviews and really disappointed. Paid $26.50 for a dozen donuts and only nearby parking available was pay to park. There was a few spots in front of the store and on the side that had no fee, but no available spots. A few of the donuts we purchased tasted good but most of them were greasy and tasted like they were made the day before. We did purchase a couple of the big donuts, but really not worth the price. Should have a price for a dozen with specialty add ons. Probably won't visit again, not so much the cost but the quality.

How do you give this place a 3  1/2 star?

Anyway, this place isn't bad.  To me, and this is just my own opinion and taste, this place is like any ordinary donut shop but with certain perks making this donut shop a tad bit different from other places.

1)      A few of their donuts are "Vegan"
2)      They have clever names that complement the donut
3)      They have treats for your furry friends

My first time going, I went right before they opened.  I was the first in line and lines form fast right before opening.  I ordered, which was the day after the news of music icon Prince passing, the Price Donut, Crème Brule, Banana Caramel and the Boston Cream.  The Prince donut was well decorated with his symbol and filled with raspberry.  I liked it.  It was okay for me.  I did notice that the donuts I ordered, weren't as sweet as some other donut shops (not including frostings).  This was a plus for me, the amount of sweetness to the donuts were good for my liking.  The Crème Brule (Vegan), I wasn't a big fan of the "caramel drizzle" over the donut.  Some will like it, but it wasn't my cup of tea.  Everything under that topping was okay as well.  I love bananas so I tried the Banana Caramel (Vegan), and that was okay too.  At first bite, banana runts came to mind.  Last, Boston Cream.  I love donuts filled with custard, so I couldn't leave a donut shop without getting one.  This too was okay.  The breading wasn't too sweet, but the sweetness of the frosting complemented this donut well.

I really wanted the cinnamon roll with the bacon, but that wasn't ready when I got there.  There was a 15 minute wait :(

I'm still coming back to try that cinnamon roll with bacon and the french toast donut. :)

With that being said, Happy Eatings!!

I visited this location because of all the hype surrounding Donut Bar and because I love Donuts. This location is in Down Town Vegas so it can be a little difficult to find if you've never been to DT. There is a parking lot across from it as well as meters near so that was a plus. As soon as you walk in you are face to face with all kinds of huge and pretty donuts! I came in specifically for the Big Poppa Tart. Which is a strawberry pop tart stuffed inside of a donut. It ended up being very overwhelmingly sweet but a fun donut idea overall. We bought an assortment of yeast raised donuts and cake ones to get an overall Donut Bar experience. The staff were very genuine and helpful.

Love love love this place. The Creme Brûlée had a hard sugar top just like the real stuff. The Mud pie was the perfect amount of Peanut butter. Not supper sweet and well balanced. We got a box full for $10.00 around 1pm.

Got there before it even opened because I was scared of there being a long line, luckily it was only about 10 people in line. The staff were SO quick and ready to take orders, you got through the line fast. Loved every donut we had, but especially the Butter Beer and French Toast donut. It's not in the strip but it is definitely worth going out of your way for!

We came here because we loved the original spot in downtown San Diego and enjoy a good donut. My wife enjoyed some donuts and I sadly didn't have any because they do not offer a gluten free donut. I think their concept of making donuts and trying to sell out everyday is silly. They could be busy all day with fresh donuts if they had different model where they baked them fresh. But the wife was happy regardless so we will be back.

I called on Thursday 4/14/2016 business was closed for day. But, manager Joe answer phone called. I was excited was able to speak to someone.. I placed a order for a birthday party of 23rd of April. I was told I would get a call back to confirm. .Well I've been calling  them myself  for 4 days straight. Seeing if order was place and will be ready for pick up on 23rd.. sent business emails.. all i have to say is Don't bother with this place!! Not reliable. . Rather take business else where..

Are you kidding me??! 

I got the chocolate bacon donut bar and the "Nutella Overload." It's too bad I didn't eat them right when I bought them, so as to have identified the MAJOR problem early on and confronted the shop about it, but I saved the donuts for a late afternoon treat-yo-self after some hours of blackjack. This is how it went down:

I take a few bites of the chocolate bacon...it's aight, your typical donut, definitely has its work cut out for itself to catch up to the maple bacon bar of Voodoo Donuts in Portland, OR. 

Next up, I take a big bite of the Nutella Overload, expecting a blobby, sludgy Nutella infusion. Ummm, NO. It's a plain dry donut. Baffled, I take another large bite. NOTHING. I frantically rip apart this stupid donut and THERE IS NO NUTELLA WHATSOEVER IN THE DONUT, let alone an "OVERLOAD." 

There is not even a swipe, dab, drop, lick, or smidgeon to be seen of the signature brown chocolate hazelnut heaven paste anywhere inside of the donut. Nada, nien, niet, RIEN! 

If the Nutella Overload cost $1, then I'd shrug it off. But $4 paired with deceptive advertising of "overload" is appalling. 

Also, their hours are arbitrary and thus, suck. Just make more donuts. You're a self-proclaimed donut "bar." Lastly, it's tiny on the inside and located on a nondescript street. Hardly a place that meets the expectations created by way of their larger-than-life website. 

Go to Voodoo Donuts in Portland, OR or Psycho Donuts in San Jose, CA.
i'm not a huge fan of donuts but these donuts are sent from heaven and i coild eat them everyday i love this place
We tried 6 donuts and they were all amazing!  My wife ate 4 of them. Make sure you try the one with the Oreo cookie in the middle!

My boyfriend & I tried the famous Donut Bar on Saturday. It was great! Donuts were very sweet but good & moist! We tried the girl scout cookie, vanilla bean, red velvet & the cone. Location isn't convenient for me so I wanted to try/take multiple ones while I was there. Staff was super friendly & helpful.

Parking isn't the best but that's just how it is downtown. 

Restaurant itself is small but super cute! There's also an outdoor area in the back to sit& eat.

I'll be back if in the area!

This little donut shop is so cute. I love their pink decor and awesome donut themed aquarium. They have a wide variety of donuts to choose from in all sorts of unique flavors and themes. Then why am I lukewarm about it?

Part of the problem is that they are all looks and less about substance. The donuts are okay, just okay. The yeast donuts are big and fluffy, but they lack flavor. For instance their birthday cake donut looks pretty but it just tastes like a donut - there's nothing to suggest it tastes like birthday cake. No icing, no batter, none of that 'eggy' flavor. All the other yeast donuts were similar. The cake donuts are a better bet, but I only had one of those, so maybe I bet on the wrong horse so to speak.

It's worth a try, but it's not the best donuts you'll ever have. I would suggest sticking to cake donuts if you do come here.

This place is very cute! I stopped by to buy a few donuts and I was not disappointed some were sold out already but I still had a good selection to pick from. Customer service was excellent and the prices are very reasonable if you're near by stop by :)

Fantastic!!! Went in on a Weekend and it was busy but the line went really quick! We ordered the French toast donut, cremebrulee, strawberries and cream, and blueberry lemon meyer, all were delicious!!! I cant wait to go back and try them all!! They even have a little courtyard we sat in and were able to bring our dogs to sit with us while we enjoyed breakfast!!

So excited to finally check this place out and it didn't disappoint. Between four of us we shared several donuts and highly recommend doing that so you can try a little, or in the case of the Big Poppa Tart, a lot, of each. We also had the Creme Brulee which was excellent and the crunch of the sugar topping added a unique texture to the cream filled donut. A must try when visiting. Other donuts we had were the Apple Crumb Cake, Strawberry Shortcake, Boston Cream, and the Nutella overload. Every donut was made really well and unlike some donut shops we've been to, these weren't overly sweet or too rich. They were a perfect balance with the dough itself being fluffy and light. As far as decor there is a nice and quite fitting tribute to Homer Simpson around and if he were to try Donut Bar he'd definitely approve! I would say the one downside of this location is just the location itself and size. It's towards downtown so you need to take lyft/uber/taxi if visiting from out of town and staying on the strip. The shop itself has an incredible display for all their donuts but since it's a small building only has bar stool seating for about 8-10 people. We lucked out and had enough seating but I imagine due to the popularity of these donuts there may be times where they don't have enough space for groups to sit together. A great donut shop overall and when in Sin City worth making the trip out to downtown for.

Donut Kill My Vibe!! This is a cute, small and fun donut bar! It's been in my bookmarked list for the next time I came to Vegas, and I finally got to try them. When you walk in the aroma of fresh donuts hits you in the face. It's also super cute and colorful. I love that you could see all the donuts on display as well as the colors of the place. It's very warm and welcoming. The staff is also extremely nice and patient. I say patient because I was so eager to get inside and take pictures and create a video. Haha. However as far as taste, their donuts are pretty average. 

They have tons of donuts to choose from but we ended up getting the Big Poppa Tart Donut, Strawberry Filled Donut, and they gave us a free candy cane donut because we had our 14 month old daughter with us. How cool is that?! Very nice and thoughtful. I have never had a donut place offer a free kids donut. However, I will say their donuts are a little more on the expensive side, but most are bigger than your average donut so it balances out. 

The Big Poppa Tart was definitely big and enough to share. I got the Strawberry one. It's made to look like an oversized Pop-tart. The cool thing is, there is an entire pop tart on the inside of the Big Poppa Tart. The donut itself was very good and tender. It also tasted amazing with the strawberry jam on top. Now I will be honest and say I didn't care much for the Pop-tart on the inside. It was chewy and a little stale tasting as far as texture. It didn't taste like a regular Pop-Tart. I guess something changes as the donut is heated and fried. Overall, the Big Poppa Tart is pretty and the edges taste really good. My husband ate my entire half of my Big Poppa and he never said a thing about the Pop-Tart so I guess it didn't bother him. He just said he couldn't taste it. *Shrugs* I guess it's more of a personal preference.

The Strawberry Filled tasted pretty good. I didn't get to taste it because my husband killed it but overall it was good he said. He said it honestly didn't taste like anything special or different than any other Strawberry Filled Donut he has had. I will say this is one of their smaller donuts. If you order a circular shaped donut then these are the bigger ones.

I also didn't taste my daughter's donut but my husband did. He said it tasted like a regular donut. I guess she liked it because she ate it all. It was just a donut in the shape of a candy cane with white and red glaze on top. 

Overall, Donut Bar was cute and fun! As far as taste, I don't think they were anything special. They were pretty average. I will say their creativity of their donuts and some of the flavors is unique but other than that they taste just like any other donut shop.

While I was trying to decide which of the many donuts I would order, some girl was on the phone saying "they aren't regular donuts, they are fancy ones'.  That pretty much sums it up.  The donuts are legit creations and not just glazed with fruit loops sprinkled on top.  Some of the donuts are pretty large and pretty filling.  They don't call it the Big Poppa Tart for no reason.

First timers for the Donut Bar tried the creme brulee for the first time it was really good I have to say is one of the best nights I've had in a long time I recommend the place highly little busy but it's really good.

I have a love/hate relationship with Donut Bar. Unquestionably, the donuts are good. Are they worth $5 a piece? Definitely not. 

Donut Bar has an excellent variety and without a doubt grade A marketing. I'll literally be scrolling through Instagram, see a photo of their donuts, and instantly begin prioritizing my need to drive all the way downtown to pick up a French Toast donut. 

In comparison to other donut shops throughout the valley, Donut Bar offers a variety of vegan donuts, made to order options, and some very "creative" choices- such as the "Big Poppa tart", a donut literally stuffed with a pop tart. As for the quality- arguable. Yes, they open super early and obviously if you get there later in the day they won't be as "fresh"- but hey, if I'm getting a "stale" donut it seems obscure to pay $4 or $5 for it. Definitely think they need a price adjustment. 

Flavor is a 10/10. In all the times I've been to donut bar I can honestly say I've never not loved the taste of any of their donuts. My most favorite would have to be the strawberry shortcake and the Oreo birthday cake- both absolutely delicious! 

The employees are also very kind and are very quick to give recommendations. I've been here super early at opening to when they were just about sold out and have always experienced exceptional service. 

Overall, Donut Bar is great- I'd just recommend an early arrival and preparation to pay upwards of $30 for a half dozen donuts.

The donuts I just purchased are "The Best Door Opener" to a business referral source.

I'm bringing family here as well!  It's the "Disneyland" of donuts!!

I could not believe the size of some of these Donuts as soon as we walked in. It is exactly what you were expecting if not more. We were only supposed to get one donut but ended up with 4 the birthday cake donut with super super sugary very delicious but not for the faint of heart. The crème brûlée doughnut was unbelievably good the center was so creamy and not too sweet almost looks like a vanilla bean creme custards something. Death goodness! But let me tell you something... Their regular Donuts are so good and so fluffy I've never had a fluffier donut.....and on the weekends they have free donuts for kids and they also make French toast donuts made to order... What.
Im about to walk my happy arse doen there now to get the french donuts!
When I ordered from here there was very miminal options, and the donuts weren't even that good.

I have to admit I was a little hesitant going to the donut bar. 
After all, imho it had a large shoes to fill because of the prior tenant O Face Donuts.
Sure, O face is now gone and one should not compare a defunct business to the next. But I cannot help it and I feel if you take the time to read what I mean, you may just end up agreeing.
There is only one single difference between the two shops yet the difference is such a critical element. Creative originality.
The Donut bar attempts to dazzle you with concoctions that are really just kids play.
The creme brulee is creative in thought yet executed with no afterthought.
Yea, the sugar is cool however only after one bite. 
Attempting to get through the constant crunch soon became annoying. 
I found myself trying to taste the center cream however once the sugar coating finally dissolved and my taste buds came to I found it to be just commercial custard filling.
Very disappointing.
The maple...
O face had was one step ahead of everyone on this. 
When you go to a donut shop,no matter what part of the U.S. you go, you know what a maple bar taste like. It doesn't change and when you have one, you have had them all.
O face however took the time to develop their own maple glaze which complemented the bacon. Donut bar..the same usual maple.
The oreo cookie
Jeez...how much sugar can you give?
People, this is a regular glazed stuffed with an oreo cookie. 
mmmm Lard

O face made donuts that were not only creative but containing other unique flavors.
Mexican chocolate with horchata creme...yea, their own homemade horchata,not a tub filled with flavored gelatin goo 

Apple fritter.
Dark. Happen to notice this to as the tray containing the fritters all looked the same,over done.
To their credit, the inside was not overdone and actually the best of the group of donuts I had.


In a nutshell, this is no O Face and probably never will be. I suppose this means I need to find something more on the level of my expectations. Which leads me to a final thought.
Donuts that cost 2-4$ per should be on the level of artisanal. Otherwise, what am I paying for that I couldn't already get at Von's?

Having jury duty earlier this month allowed me to drop by Donut Bar for two days straight.

First visit-11:30am...choosing from what was left, I tried a Strawberry Cheesecake and a Boston Creme.
Both tasted okay, but the chocolate glaze on the boston creme wasn't only excessively sweet but looked dull, not shiny like other donut shops, and the dough part itself was a little more dense for my liking. 
Gave Donut Bar the benefit of the doubt and decided to catch them earlier the next day.

Second visit-7:30am...arriving with a full display, I perused the list and ordered three types of cake donuts: Matcha, Blueberry Meyer Lemon, and The Samoa. I also ordered a Creme Brulee Donut and their special donut of the day, Strawberries and Cream. Best of the batch was the Creme Brulee Donut and the Strawberries and Cream not far behind. The yeast raised donut items here aren't as light and fluffy, but more dense and are alot darker than other shops around town. The cake donuts sound better than they actually tasted and I just took one bite of each and couldn't get passed how DRY each of them were. Couldn't taste matcha or meyer lemon, but sugary sweet(and I got there half an hour after they opened)

Service was okay,  and price point is kinda iffy with the fact that there are other shops in town that charge less for a better tasting product that won't leave you with buyers remorse. Like that song goes, "I'm a classic man"...I like classic style donuts that light and fluffy,  and  aren't hidden by thick glazes and don't need  the addition of an oreo or pop tart. To me, less is more, and maybe third time's the charm, but for now,  I'm in no hurry to rush back.  ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu. 2.5

My friends and I walked here for breakfast one morning and we were impressed.  The donuts were good and the selection was awesome.  A little overpriced but the donut bar is a great idea.  People were friendly although I will say by 9am they are out of most of the selections.  We will be back!

I don't like donuts. 
But l love these donuts. Dunkin, Krispy Kreme, and Winchells never really impressed me. My issues with donuts is they always smell better than they taste. But at the donut bar, they taste  just as good if not better than you imagined. I can tell that the donut bar uses fresh ingredients and takes pride in their craft. I wish it were a bit bigger but that's only because I'd like to sit and eat all the different donuts they offer. Definitely going back. Again and again.

A nice, small, quiet place not far from the craziness of Fremont Street.  I like they way they do business: open at 7 am (8 on the weekends) and close when they sell out--which seems to happen before noon.  That way the doughnuts are assuredly fresh.  The service was genuinely friendly.  The doughnuts were very good, but nothing too exciting.

The whipped creme donut with strawberries is VEGAN! They have a lot of vegan options and they're all amazing! The coffee is delicious too. The pricing is fair due to the quality of the donuts.

My complaint: The donuts are first come first serve and they seem to run out pretty quickly. I wish they would stay open longer and make more donuts.
I'm enjoying some really great donuts right now! You gotta check this place out. You will love them!

I get donuts for my brother here. He loves them! The variety is huge and the staff is very friendly. We especially like the "Elvis" donut we saw today! I wish they would have gluten free donuts! I haven't had one in 10 years!

The coffee is quite delicious. I had an iced latte and enjoyed the flavor quite a bit!
The lines are long but it's 100% worth waiting for this chicken I promise! Hands down the best chicken you will taste!

Passed by here after we got brunch since they had French toast donuts on Sundays and boy, did we get lucky! We got the last french toast donut and it was AHHHHMAZING! Not too sweet and very fluffy! We also got the pineapple, creams brûlée, red velvet and birthday cake Oreo donuts and cafe lattes for the road. They were all superb! Really loved the donuts, cozy spot and the people working there. The donut chef was even working the register and chatted with us since we were visiting from LA. Super nice & yummy donuts!! We ate our donuts in the back where they had tables and murals, great bonding spot! Will be back again to try the rest!

I can't eat gluten but the coffee here is amazing. The customer service is impeccable and they remember you each time you go. I always bring in people from out of town and local groups. They are fantastic two children and go above and beyond to help you find the donut that you want. If it's available the French toast donut is a must-try. If you get there at the end of the day they will give you a deal on Donuts which is great because you never get yesterday's Donuts.

I love the crueller donuts so good. Small little niche in the Carson building. Yet they create some of the most artful donuts you can imagine. Friendly and awesome staff. Offer stump town coffee. Can't get enough of the changing menu so each day you'll get something different.
Donuts mmmm. So freaking good. French toast donut and mud pie wonderful. I've brew coffee was great.
Cool spot. We tried an apple crumble and a crème brûlée. Would highly recommend. Make sure you get there early. Once they sell out, you've gotta wait until the next day.
Got the red velvet, Nutella overload, and the triple chocolate! Definitely recommend going early because donuts sell out fast!

Bring my lady a donut and I get a get out of jail card...  Yes I make mistakes and discovered a donut from this shop is better than flowers...

Seriously great coffee and donuts...  

Wish they had a bicycle rack, almost lost a bicycle one morning getting coffee and a donut...

I was really excited to finally try this place, but left disappointed. The doughnuts were all so DRY! Maybe it's because we didn't get there until 10 and they had been sitting out? We tried several - the DB Nutella, Homer, Vanilla Bean, Chai...dry, dry, dry. We also tried the creme brûlée, the filling saved it from being dry but it wasn't sweet enough - very bland. Bummer!

I had a creme brule donut from here and hands down THE BEST iced chai tea latte. Both were amazing!!! I also bought a few donuts to go and brought them to my mom in Boston. I wish i lived closer ( but that probably wouldn't be good for my waist line) so maybe this is for the best.

A friend of mine was nice enough to pick some up for me. The donuts were cute to look at, but I felt like they were a bit dry. I'll have to give this place another try once I return to Vegas to give it a better assessment when I can eat them fresh.

I did like the gingerbread donut. It was pretty much a gingerbread cake.

894 / 894
Sinfully Delicious! Perfect customer service with CHEF Jeff. Came here to try the creme brûlée donut and ended up with a half dozen of deliciousness!!

Love this downtown hot spot! 
My kids like getting these as a treat and we've had them at parties and work gathering.
Staff is always super nice and friendly. 
Easy location to walk to from Fremont st and container park. 
Close to life is beautiful and year round street art.

This place has been hyped up because of it's delicious well presented donuts. I Took my boys there to try out some of their creations. My one son decided on the donut "cone" with vanilla Ice cream, I decided on the apple fritter and my younger son got the birthday cake donut. 
Here's where the review goes south: 
My son tried and ate the cone with ice cream and  said that the cone tasted like pre made pilsbury pastry dough, the apple fritter I was expecting to taste full of apple and moist was VERY DRY, over cooked and had not much Apple to find in it and as for my younger sons birthday cake donut it too was very dry and made Dunkin look like the king of the cake donuts. The 3 donuts total were $11.00, yes that was for 3 donuts. 
So for them to claim they are #bestdonutsintheworld not in the eyes of this consumer. Pink box donuts can easily out do donut bar on quality, taste and price.
Shop faces Carson not 6th.  We walked from Fremont took a few extra steps, but well worth it.

This downtown shop has some great donuts but you really need to get there early before they sell out.  Pros are the donuts were good and unique and there is seating in the back outside.  Cons were the music was kind of loud and it is a bit small inside.
Incredible service, coffee right on point, blueberry donuts, strawberry donuts with cream are Fantastic. Owner came out and greet.

Things go fast, so make sure you arrive early to ensure you get the best selection, because once they're out, they're out.

On our first visit, we got here around 8am and there was a good amount of people in line to get donuts. They had everything from creative choices like their version of a Pop-Tart, a variety of sugary cartoon characters, jelly donuts and their take on the classic cake creations. The problem with going first thing in the morning is that your eyes are bigger than your stomach, and you end up ordering a ton. Totally worth it. Nothing beats remembering you have a box of these treats in your hotel room after a day of drinking, or whatever it is you do in Vegas.

If you come around 11am, which has been the case on most of our visits, they box up the remaining donuts from the morning and sell them for $10 a pop. You don't get to choose, but it's still a steal if you don't care which ones you get.

They also have variations of Stumptown Coffee if you need a caffeine boost. It's offered in hot and cold forms, but the cold brew is my favorite between the two, especially if you're going during the warmer months.

Plenty of metered parking on the street and behind the building in a shared lot. If you want to sit and eat, they have some counter space inside, and a shared outdoor area with some tables and chairs too.

Totally recommend if you haven't had a chance to check them out in San Diego. They're awesome!
We are locals and love the donut bar.  Staff is always amazing.  The donuts are so good you can't go wrong with whatever you choose.

If you're going to Vegas you've got to make time for a stop here!! It's not too far off of the main strip but make sure you get here when they first open because the good doughnuts sell out FAST!!! My favorite was the one that had an entire pop tart inside!!! A very neat & yummy experience! There's also a beautiful patio to eat and relax at in the back.
Took a bunch of teenage kids and they were blown away at how great the donuts looked.  Had a great time seeing all the massive donuts.  Must see Las Vegas destination.
The Donut House in downtown Las Vegas is a MUST! Their unique creations are fabulous. Their Creme brûlée RULES!
Cute shop with amazing donuts! Great tasting Mochas and friendly staff. We'll be back again when we visit Las Vegas.

Donuts are probable awesome, but i have never been able to try them. I have been in here a few times and they never have donuts. They are always sold out. So just be aware that there is a relatively good chance that this donut shop will not have donuts. I am sure when they have them they are good.

 Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. Fool me a third time, now i am just a moron who is not coming back. But what do i know i am just guy that wants my donut shop to have donuts.

After all the Hype we had to check this place out... I'm a total donut lover, and this place unfortunately was totally underwhelming. I was disappointed in the flavors of the donuts (from their simple cake donuts, to their Nutella speciality donut) the coffee wasn't great either. 3 donuts 2 cappuccinos and $14 later, we were thinking that Dunkin Donuts would have been a better option... at least their coffee is good!

OMD - Oh My Donut! When in Sin City, one must succumb to all of their vices. So when I discovered this sweet, sweet little gem of a donut shop in old downtown Las Vegas, I knew this was one vice I could not resist. But be warned, if you do not come to the Donut Bar before noon, chances are they will be sold out for the day. And trust me, they sell out fast. This place was so good, I had to come twice in two days to try more flavors of their donuts.

On my first visit, I ordered the strawberry cream cheese donut and a blueberry donut with Meyer lemon frosting. The donuts were dense but not overwhelmingly so. The strawberry cream cheese was a little too sweet for my liking but had good strawberry flavor throughout the frosting and the donut. The blueberry donut with Meyer lemon frosting was delicious. The flavors were simple but spot on.

On my second visit, I opted for the salted caramel donut and the Apple crumb donut. The salted caramel was by far my favorite (that I've tried so far). The Apple crumb was tasty with good apple flavor throughout but a little too heavy for my liking. 

They have so many flavors to choose from and their flavors appear to rotate almost daily. But like the saying goes, "the early bird gets the worm". Don't be the bird that misses out on these amazing donuts.

Day after doughnuts from here are not good. They do not hold up.
Pinkbox is forever my favorite!
Very good fluffy donuts. I will be back. Beware they close when they sell out though!

I know donuts, by god if there's one thing I've accomplished in this world it's a palette for donuts... VooDoo, Dynamo, Bob's (SF) Blue Star & Donut Friend, I've conquered them all & I have to say this place is comfortably in the same stratosphere of its brethren. I hate the word Artisanal especially when it comes to donuts, but this place is pretty fancy as it comes to ingredients and style of donuts. Stump town coffee & yummy selections such as Nuttella donut with chopped hazelnuts on top. Maple bacon bar, the Homer for those of you that remember the Michael Jackson Simpsons episode! We paid $27 for 2 coffees, 1 bottle water & 7 fancy kine doughnuts! Yes, winchells or Krispy Kreme is like $6-8 for a dozen, but why do you hate yourself? Pay up and treat yourself!

I love you guys! Wow all I can say is wow! I have been to your San Diego location and I come to Vegas every other week. My girlfriend and I are HUGE fans of the Big Poppa Tart & the creme brûlée :-) 

The place looks really cool and has a great vibe to it. It's in a old historic building that has been remodeled. The backyard patio is perfect for coffee & donuts in downtown Vegas! 

We also saw Chef Santiago & he took the time to say hello and welcome us to his new shop! We can't wait for Ice Cream Cones from Donut Bar!!

I don't like donuts but stopped here on my Uber drivers recommendation ...the creme brûlée donut here blew my mind!!!!!! I went back for another the following day only to find SOLD OUT scrolled across the window...i was heartbroken  
Go early, buy lots, be happy!!!!

Popped in to try a vegan doughnut and tried the creme brulee. I'm sure it's more traditional creme brulee so the topping was crisp and hard.  Not my cup of tea BUT someone else may love it. The vegan selection was smaller than I thought because there were only 2 options at the time I went in but it's nice they have some. The filling was good and the people nice. Again the review is based on my taste and preferring a glaze versus the crust of the creme brulee. So don't hesitate to try it.
This place is so good, we went here two days in a row. The donuts are delicious and the service is great! The strawberry split was my favorite.
I was super excited about this new donut shop opening, but the donuts were just not good. They were super overdone and the icing was also dry. Maybe I came on a bad day?

A cute little donut shop! The creme brûlée was delightful with its hard sugar shell top and yummy custard filling. The lemon pistachio donut was also surprisingly light with a great lemon flavor. 
They close when they run out, so get there early!

I always make it a must do every time I come to Vegas to stop by here. There's so many different things on the menu I want to try. Creme brule donut is a must! I decided this time I would try the French toast to share with my husband. SO MUCH REGRET....agreeing to share with him... one bite and I wanted it all to myself ! LOLOLOLOL.

Thanks to Danny N. of West Covina, CA for giving me the 411 on this Hot and New business in Downtown Las Vegas!  We don't have these fancy 6 inch donuts in Hawaii, so it was a fun discovery for me!

We arrived at about 9am and the line was out the door, but it moved quickly since the workers are efficient, skilled, and friendly!  We easily found metered street parking right in the front of the shop on Carson Avenue.  I ran right in and was done before the meter maid caught me!  Oh yeah for "free parking"!

Donut Bar is a cozy place where the width of the shop showcases their eye-popping product.  There's a row of stools along the counter on the far wall if you want to dine there.  

The colors, designs, and names of the donuts really intrigued me. It was so difficult to make a decision, but I finally settled on the Caramelized pineapple and the Coconut Dream. ..

I'm from the Aloha State and I haven't seen a pineapple donut before.  Mmm mmm... it was a delight!  The Coconut Dream was even better because it reminded me of a Mounds candy with a thin layer of chocolate between the donut and the coconut layer.  Yummy! Both donuts were $3 each. They did leave an oily spot on the wax paper that lined the box... and a bit of an oily feel in the mouth.  The donut itself seemed a bit denser and less cakey in texture.  

I want to go back for the Mexican Hot Chocolate, creme brulee, chocolate bacon, and the Strawberry Split. .. (note: vegan options are available!)   I heard that there is a Donut Bar in San Diego. .. oh oh...here we come!

What can I say but the Donuts are always fresh and awesome! That's not the only reason I'm giving them 5 stars .... it's the customer service , always on point. Today especially I came in with my dog and as I was going out to the patio I spilled my cold brew on the floor. Immediately the staff came over and replaced my coffee, and were super nice after the mess my dog and I made. It's these things that are the signs of a well run business. 5 stars All the Way. Thanks Donut Bar.

Love this place! Donut heaven!!

This place never disappoints!  There were so much to choose from....ya just can't have one!  So it took us a few turns here and there...but then.....(Angels singing) ahhhhhhh!

Let the gluttony begin.

This place is a must go to if you a donut lover and in Las Vegas. Plentiful parking in the area makes it easy to pop in and pickup these treats. The building itself is a cool little place. Upon walking in you are immediately greeted and welcomed. The person helping me was able to explain each and every donut and asked me what preferences I had and suggested items to try. The selection was great on the morning that I arrived. I chose the Creme Brûlée donut and a lemon cheesecake donut with a milk to go. The donuts are pricey, until you bite into them and realize the quality ingredients that they are made with. I was a few miles away before I tried my selections and immediately wished that I had purchased more. Great selection, priced right for the quality, and a friendly helpful staff. Do yourself a favor and check this place out, you'll be glad you did.
Delicious donuts. Customer service was great. Very clean. Lots of choices. Nice seating, indoor and outdoor. Who doesn't love strawberry milk on tap?  Glad I came.

I go for the vegan options (of which there were four this morning). We picked up an apple fritter, a creme brûlée and a spiced chai - delicious! I think there were at least 20 total donut varieties so a good time can be had by all (unless gluten is not your jam).

Everyone jumped on the hype train when this place first opened and took over the old O Face Doughnuts location. My first run-in with Donut Bar was when I lived in San Diego in 2013. They were one of the first West Coast shops to try to emulate the cronut, which at the time, had just been invented by Dominique Ansel and was an overnight sensation. Donut Bar's Gaslamp location was very much like this one. There were huge lines that stretched out the door in the morning and they were often sold out by midday. In fact, I never did get to try one of their cronuts or "cro-bars," rather. 

Flash forward three years and once again Donut Bar is the darling of the donut world and selling out on a daily basis by 1 pm. I've visited this location twice now (but really once because one time it was sold out), and I'm still unconvinced that the majority of these doughnuts are that spectacular. For the most part, the novelty is the large size, especially the Big Poppa Tart, but I felt sick trying to finish an entire one myself. This fact holds true for most of the other large, yeast doughnuts as well, all priced $3-4.

However, the one doughnut that I felt was unique enough to return here for was the crème brûlée. The caramelized sugar topping has that deeply satisfying crack when broken in half and the filling flavor is completely on par with that of a vanilla crème brûlée. It's advertised as vegan and also only $2. 

Overall, I wasn't impressed by the size or price. The yeast donuts turned dense if you didn't get them fresh. But highlights include the can't miss crème brûlée donuts and Stumptown coffee (which just so happens to be my favorite coffee).

MIND BLOWN!

I am so impressed with how delicious, fluffy, and chewy their donut are. I bought the cake batter, blueberry cheesecake, Nutella, samoa, Homer's donut, and the red velvet donuts. 

I came in around 11 AM during their soft opening and there were quite a few good choices left. Unfortunately the strawberry split & Oreo one was sold out  but that's okay because what I got was tasty! 

Donut Bar compared to other donut shops around town is their HUGE donuts ($4 each), and unique ones like the Oreo inside the donut, the pop tart inside the donut, and hopefully the donut cones soon (well that's what they advertised on their Instagram). The dough is exceptionally chewy, moist, the toppings are even & proportionate, and most importantly the frosting isn't overly sweet. 

I definitely recommend this place, just come early so you have more options!

Donut Bar is a solid donut place that is doing some fun and inventive things with their flavors. I've tried the Big Poppa (a donut with a pop-tart baked inside? done. i need it.), Butterbeer, vegan birthday cake, blueberry meyer lemon, creme brulee, apple fritter... They were all delicious. The Big Poppa and the Creme Brulee were my absolute favorite, I would highly recommend them. Their nitro brew coffee is also very good!

The shop is small and can get kind of busy, but the employees do a good job being friendly while keeping everyone moving. I think that the prices are pretty good for the product that you get. They also do free kids donuts on Saturday mornings. We've recommended this place to so many friends and have yet to have someone tell us they didn't love it!

We purchased a small box of doughnuts

Strawberries and Cream - HUGE but looks delicious
Maple Bacon Cinnamon Roll - BEST Donut we have ever tasted, soft, luscious, not too sweet, real bacon... even my girlfriend who eats as healthily as possible, Raw fitness in the morning and spin at night took a few bites and didn't regret it for a second. 
Vegan Creme Brulee- coworker liked it but said the top was too burnt... that's how I prefer my creme brulee so I would'v loved it
Birthday Cake - Free for their one year birthday today- Husband requested I bring it home to him so I have no review of this one
Red Velvet - My husband requested I bring this home too 
2X Old Fashioned Plain cake donuts- My girlfriend who again is into fitness, told me this reminded her of her childhood. That made me feel so special, a taste that triggers a memory is worth WELL OVER THE 2$

I have a friend who lives in las Vegas and has been talking about how great this place is. I've never been a big fan of donuts but I wanted to try it while I was here for the weekend. OMG! This place is awesome, I've never seen so many kinds of donuts, they have a huge variety and I've been told they always change the flavors!!! My favorite ones were French toast and creme brulee. But I recommend trying all of them! You won't get tired, they are not "too" sweet. The place is clean, very organized, service is great. Even though there are a lot of people, you won't be waiting in line for too long, they are fast! If you want to eat there and you don't find a place inside the restaurant, they have a great patio with chairs and tables outside. 
You have to try these donuts! You won't regret it, they have great coffee too!
Love this place!  Huge to regular size donuts fresh and delicious!

Busy place both times I visited but lline moved quickly. Wanted to buy a butter beer but they were out so that is a little disappointing but nice to have so many flavor varieties. Got a bostom cream...it was perfect, not too sweet. Customer service was good, prices fair.

Very disappointing!! The quality has gone down hill ever since they got popular. Almost every donut in the box this time was dry and stale. The famous creme brûlée donut barely had any cream. It's especially disappointing since this place is supposed to be top rated. I think they need to focus on their product and not their trendy appearance.

Plus:  kids got a free 'spongebob' donut, close to my house, very trendy.   Great if you need a sweet fix.  
Downside:  overpriced ($29 later for 2 bacon maple bars, 1 caramel latte, 1 mud pie, 2 plain buttermilk, 1 chocolate glazed cake, 1 vanilla bean and 1 pink sprinkle...maybe the spongebob weren't free?);  very heavy and bready and super sweet.  
When I left, I just kept thinking 'wow, I just spent $30 on donuts...'
Donuts are very large and very sweet.   They don't even make a simple plain glazed.  
Not sure if they are going for locals or more tourists, but for locals, I think a much more simpler donut would be nice...along with a lower price.

These donuts are dynamite! If you come near closing (in my case ten minutes before closing) you can get a box of donuts for $10 and this box is like the size of a pizza box. As tempting as that was, I opted for their other end of day special - 2 donuts for $5.
