The pop tart donut was really like a pop tart...donut. it was so good! That fruity jelly on the inside. Frosting on top. I had no regrets eating this. Well, it was way too big so I only ate a quarter of it. Share. 

The Apple donut was good even though I ate it the next day! Mind blown. That means they fried it well because usually poorly fried donuts are soggy the next day. 

I love this place so much I even bought their shirt...Donut kill my vibe!

Amazing donuts for affordable prices. I went in around noon, and they had a special of buy 1 get 1 free OR buy a box for $10. I'm not a huge donut fan because bread + lots of sugar makes me feel sick so I only got 2!

(They close until all the donuts are all sold)

FOOD 5/5:
-Creme Brulee ($2): This is what their famous for because INSIDER FOOD showcased this particular donut online and it became a hit! I LOVED it, I'm a fan of regular creme brulee, and they did an amazing job of filling the cream inside the donut & having a sweet/crunch on the top.
-Old Fashion Glazed (Free): This was fantastic! If your not into all the sweetness and bread, I strongly recommend this donut. Simple but very good.

SERVICE 5/5:
-Right when you get in your greeted by smiles and whoever is working is more than happy to recommend what they're most famous for & what flavors you like!

This place is a donut lovers paradise. The donuts here are delicious and super fluffy. There were so many great looking donuts that it took me forever to pick out the ones I wanted. The size of some of the donut choices are huge and could feed a small family. I ate my first round of donuts there at the shop and of course had to go for round two but got those to go. The service there is fantastic and the employees there are all very friendly. They treated the tourist folks with the same amount of respect as they did to the local regulars that came in. Will definetly be returning when I'm back in Vegas.

Love the strawberry split and creme brulee. I will surely come back here. Love all the murals at the back definitely a good photo op site. Come here at around 8-9am because the store and not yet so busy so you can still have enough place to sit and enjoy the donuts and coffee

So after the amazing opportunity to eat these donuts at an elite event, I wanted to come by and see the selection in person.  Early on a weekday, I stopped off and picked up 6 donuts for the secretary and I to share.  

This donut shop is gourmet and heightened flavors.  When I brought home the extra donuts for the hubby and kids, they generally ignored them.  I was disappointed, but the hubby said that the flavors were outside of the kids wheelhouse.  

I know that the place has kid friendly options on the weekend and the chocolate milk on draft will draw my little one in.  So, maybe, I need to bring them in and let them pick their own flavor options.

Here's what we tried.  The dipped old fashion was eh.  The Pop Tart was amaze-balls.  Coworker and I took turns with the plastic knife as we cut off sections.  The jelly inside is tasty.  The frosting is perfect and not too much.  The bacon on top of the Brad fritter should just be served by itself.  I wanted to eat it all.  Coworker told me to, as she like the fritter, but the bacon was a bit off putting for her.  She had the blueberry cheesecake; didn't share.  Split the creme brulee.  The cracked sugar top is interesting.  The star of the show, in my opinion, is the creme filling.

Looking for a weekend to go back.  I hear the trick is to get there early, as they sell out of flavors.
Update: I've recently tried the creme brulee donut again. And there is definitely a LOT more filling. It's easily one of my favorite donuts now.

HOLY VEGAN MOLY, YOU GUYS! 

FOOD: It's donuts, how special are donuts, right? WRONG. These guys do it big and I mean, BIG. The flavors are unique and tasty and each donut is easily the size of two. Did I mention they have a bunch of vegan donuts too (not just the plain, boring flavors)? Couldn't even tell the difference (being vegan, doesn't make me biased, I swear!). 

SERVICE: Best service. Everyone was nice and was happy to chat us up. I was with my sister and it turns out two brothers were working there together. NEAT! Also, my sister didn't like the coffee drink she got so a nice woman came over to make it different so my sister could enjoy it. No extra charge and she was totally understanding. 

PRICE: Who cares? Worth every penny!

OVERALL: Like I said to VegeNation a couple blocks over: I love you guys, come to LA?

Was here a month back in the morning, and had breakfast before heading to LA.  Had a crème brulee and it was so good that I ordered two more right after the first bite. The donuts were fresh and soft.  Coffee was good.  Friendly staffs. There's a backyard patio with a few tables.
Their donuts really are the best. I had the creme brûlée and blood orange. It's a nice place to stop for a treat I would highly recommend it.

I was beyond excited to finally try this place, because of all the hype about it being the best! We pretty much grabbed each flavor so I had a pretty good taste of most of them. Most of them tasted the same and not really their actual flavor, but they were soft and fresh so that was good. The one I enjoyed the most had to be the Creme brûlée. The donuts are decorated amazing which is probably why they are so hyped, but overall they tasted just like average donuts. The price is pretty expensive compared to other donut joints. The service was very nice and sweet, they explained to us all their flavors and their number one sellers which was great. I'm glad I finally tried it and got to see what the hype was all about.

Yep !!!!!! Phenomenal!!!!!!! Maple glazed!!!! Creme brulee !!!!!!! 8$ for 2 amazing donuts !!!!!!!!!!!!!!


Will definitely be back. All the way from California. 

Thanks guys!!!!
This place rocked my world. I planned another trip to Vegas just for this place. I tried the French toast donut and I'm honestly still dreaming about it.

My family went to the Donut Bar this past weekend and on weekends they give out a free donut for children. That is a very kind gesture that is becoming more rare. Our donuts, coffee and chocolate milk were all great. I was very impressed with their HUGE selection of donuts. I had a difficult time just picking half a dozen. 

You have to checkout their fish tank that they had made by the guys from Tanked  It looks awesome and the donuts look so real you could almost eat them. 

***** They offer a military discount ***** 
I believe it was 10% it might have been more but whatever the amount it is great when business offer something to say thank you.
We got there late and didn't have a lot of selection, but the donut cone was so fun and the ice cream was super yummy! Wish I had gotten there earlier!

An absolute gem of downtown vegas! You have to get there in the morning because once all the doughnuts are gone, they close. It's located on Carson. The doughnuts they offer are HUGE! There's such a big selection of doughnuts with so many flavors, you'll be happy with anything. They're known for their special Churro cone with ice cream.. and it's SOO good. These are popular so they go much quicker! The service is quick.. it's a small shop so you go in and out even if there's a long wait. I also saw that they cater.

Very touristy, been on insider for some of their famous donuts. If you're into some of these creative and sweet donuts than this is the place. Perfect place for a sweet tooth

Only issue is that it's a pretty penny for a donut itself. And in the heart of the old Las Vegas strip. Can grab some breakfast and head down there for some sigh seeing.
Donuts were great, I suggest the French Toast Donut.. Honestly it's the best of both worlds.. Won't find anything else like it.. definitely a must have if you're near Fremont Street.

Decided to stop here and bring breakfast to my friend, since she loves all things Donut Bar. The store was not that busy this morning which was awesome for me since I was running a little late. The cashier was whom greeted me and took my donut order. I was extremely happy with the service of her. I was in and out with my donut treats in less than five minutes what stellar service.

For this sugary breakfast I ordered a red velvet donut, which was awesome. Their balance of sugar to the cream is so satisfying. They had they huge glazed donuts sandwich style with whip cream and strawberries decorated with frosted sugar. Wow, this donut treat blew my mind. The strawberries were fresh and the cream they were in was so delicate and had the perfect balance. So for all those donut needs come get your fix here, it's so worth it.

I don't know why I always go back to donut bar. I don't know why people like donut bar so much. I don't get the hype! But I love hype! 

My favorite thing about donut bar is their creme brûlée donut with the crunchy sugar coating and the creamy custard filling. Why are they putting less coating and less filling?! 

Donut bar has the most bready donuts. They are seriously just slightly sweet bread that are oversized or overly decorated. I have probably tried all of their donuts and they are just not good in my opinion.

Their donut cone with soft serve is good and their creme brûlée donut used to be good.

I have probably been here six times because their instagram is popping but I have to say their donuts are just not good.

Very cute little donut bar downtown Las Vegas! 

The donuts were big & flavorful. I got the 'Cake Batter donut' & my sister got the 'Homer'! They only frost the top then it's a plain donut under which is great for balancing out the sweetness of the frosting. 

I feel like the price was fair for the size donut you get. All specialty donuts as well. A lot of flavors to choose from!

The staff was nice & welcoming even told us where more seating was located. They made suggestions on which donuts were most popular & gave us adequate time to make a decision. 

The overall environment was clean, cute & artsy. This location was quiet & away from the crowd which was nice. 

They had outdoor seating in a little shaded courtyard which was great. 

If I'm ever in the area again, I'd check them out.

Really good customer service! Everything is made fresh and is realllllly yummy. The only complaint is that these donuts won't last more than a day. After the first day the donut bread gets hard and stale, and for the price they charge i feel like they should last longer. Still really worth it if you're gonna get one or two and eat them the same day.

I love The Donut Bar. The staff is really lax and the donuts are amazing. It just sucks that they close early but they usually sell out before then. I love their churro cones with ice cream on the top. Please open more locations!

Maybe it's because we came later in the day (around 11:30 am) that I wasn't really as impressed as I thought I would be because I had a limited selection. 

The staff was super nice! She immediately welcomed us as soon as we walked in. We were staring at the menu for quite some time and she remained super helpful, offering descriptions and suggestions. 
 
JUST AN FYI, just like most donut shops, they will run out of certain donuts so definitely show up early if you want a certain type that may be popular on their menu aka the creme brûlée donut. But I don't regret what I got! I went with the red velvet donut and the db Nutella! The red velvet was not bad! It wasn't too sweet so it's not too overwhelming to be considered a meal on its own. The only thing was with the latter was that I felt as though there was too much bread with the donut to Nutella ratio but maybe because the donut itself was HUGE. 

I've heard plenty of amazing things about the Donut Bar. Prior to their opening, they already had so much hype, so much talk of people lining up at their door. But personally, I thought they were OOOOKAY. Probably will give them another try when I'm in the area.

Donut purists may not love this spot, but for those of you looking for super creative donuts, rush over to Donut Bar. 

I was one of the lucky few that got to attend the Homer's Wet Dream event where I was able to sample many of the donuts sold by Donut Bar, so when making plans to dine at nearby Carson Kitchen one Sunday I decided to stop into Donut Bar first to sample more of their offerings. 

I already knew that the Bigga Poppa, with a entire poptart inside, is the bomb. At $4 it's on the pricey side, but 2-3 people could share one of these, it's THAT big. The Crème Brûlée is another donut I like, it is priced at $2 and is more of a standard sized donut.  

For me.... it is all about the French Toast donut, cooked to order. If I had to choose one kind of donut to have for the rest of my life, it would be this one. Paired with a Stumptown Cold Brew, and you have one deliciously sweet breakfast.

Even if the over-the-top, stuffed donuts don't do anything for you, Donut Bar is worth a visit just to try the delicious French Toast Donut. (Sold weekends only)

Short Review:  
Donut Bar originated in San Diego and places an emphasis on fresh, tasty, picture worthy, and creative donuts.  If a caked donut full of sugar is your thing, then give Donut Bar a try.  Donut Bar is considered one the best and their customer service is excellent.  Just be early because these donuts sell out fast. 

Longer Review:  
I remember the excitement when Donut Bar opened in Las Vegas.  I'm not going to lie.  I wasn't that excited when I heard the news. I didn't bookmark this place and had the opinion that Donut Bar was just hype. I'm originally from the 619 and remember when the first Donut Bar opened their doors in Daygo. I was one of those people that waited in line. The owner of that location was pretty cool and would walk by the line with full sized donut samples to patrons waiting to get in. Originally, I wasn't a fan.  I had a few failed visits because their donuts were either out or I got something that was too sweet.  I always picked a donut that just didn't "wow" me. I am also not into a cake donut with a bunch of sugar on it. I'm really boring when it comes to my donuts. I prefer a chocolate glazed raised donut, maple bar, cruller, or an apple fritter.  That's all I really need or want when I'm in a donut shop.  But when the girlfriend loves donuts, then you support her by eating donuts.  I have been here a couple of times since grand opening week.  I've tried the Samoa, The French Toast, Cake Batter, Caramel Latte, the Big Poppa Tart, Crème Brulee, Matcha Cake, PB&J, and of course, the Homer. Their originality, freshness, and consistency stands out.  I haven't had anything here that was too oily and greasy.  Again, these donuts really do not appeal to me and in my opinion, just too sweet. But then I had their Caramel Latte.  This donut is perfectly glazed with their latte flavor.  Then a little whipped cream and caramel is added. Because this donut is large, the glaze and toppings do not give it that overly sweet taste.  The texture is also perfect and not dry at all. This donut with a cup of their hot coffee equals perfection.  I will cheat on my chocolate raised donut any day for their Caramel Latte.  This donut alone made me a fan. 

2017 Yelp Review #77

Finally got to try this place. Yummy describes this sinful obsession of imaginative donut flavor combinations. I regret that I didn't check out the online menu to see what types they had before going there. So it was a bit over-whelming trying to view/choose what to order because the line moved too quickly. I tried the lemon cake donut drizzled with a cream cheese frosting glaze & took back a huge blueberry glazed donut (I forget what there  actual names are). If that wasn't enough, I was fortunate enough to try the Homer Simpson pink donut w/ sprinkles (they always sell out, so go early). Well...they were all wonderfully delicious. But, I'm glad they are not located close to where I reside otherwise, I would be there at least once a week & that wouldn't be good for my waist line (yikes). Yet, I do think about & crave those fried
desserts since I've tasted them!!

Who doesn't love a fun donut, well Donut bar has them! Wonder women, fidget spinner donut, homer donuts they got it! Now their Texas size donuts. 

Not bad. I got the green tea. The green tea donut batch was a bit over cooked & lacked some flavor. Maybe I should have gotten something else. 

Their not bad donuts, jus iG worthy and hipster donut vibe. 

Friend got the wonder women huge donut. 

2-3$ donuts. 

Cool fast service. 

Coffee. Nitro. Milk. Parking on St. located right off the strip.

I'm coming from being a fan of Doughnut Plant in NYC. Not sure if we had stale ones because I ordered from Uber Eats or for their price you're paying for a batter that is not up to standard.

Creme Brulee was the best. Strawberry cheesecake. Nah. Lemon Blueberry, the flavour was there but still not that great. 

I will be open-minded, maybe better when you get it fresh. Would want to go back to try French Toast Donut.

SHORTEST DONUT BAR LINE EVER
(3.7 stars)

It was shocking to see a 4 person line because the one in San Diego runs out the door and down the street. 

so
many
selections.... can i order them all ;P

When you can't decide ALWAYS STICK TO THE ONE THAT CAUGHT YOUR EYE FIRST. And that delicious fattening fried batter goes to....

OHH MY BIRTHDAY CAKE OREO 

It was a very good donut but... I like my donuts with a little more fluff, a lot less sugar, and a custard texture in the middle. This was different. This was a donut with a reconstructed Oreo in the middle, with cake icing on the top with crumbles of Oreo and cake confetti. Sugar sugar and more sugar. If you strip all that and taste the donut, it's actually nothing special without that extra flavoring. The donut itself was dry. Again, good donut... I just have had a really good donut elsewhere that I hold high standards too. 

I'll be real honest though... donut bar seems to only be good because of the flavoring that covers the donut. Strip all that way and you have a boring stale and dry donut. 

Until the next review...
Go early for the best selection. Once they run out, they close. We tried the maple iced, sea salt caramel, Bavarian creme and the Big Elvis which was banana cream with peanut butter frosting!

This place has the best donuts I've ever had in my life! I got the birthday cake and lemon donuts, which were the biggest donuts I have seen! They normally come out with donut cones at 12 p.m so I was ablw to wait for them and they came straight right out the oven which was nice.

Wow! This is no ordinary donut shop, omg! I walked in and I could not decide what to get, I want them all.  I had the vanilla bean donut which by the way are gigantic and the creme brûlée donut, ohhh so yummy, a must try!
Super friendly and helpful staff. Typical gigantic donuts. The Poptart filled donut is actually delicious.

Adorable place, with fantastic donuts.  The creative donuts here are the reasons why I wanted to give this place a try.  It's like a new wave going on with donut chains popping up in cities.  I feel a little bad for the mom and pop shops, they're going to have to step up their game.  It's one thing to have cute and creative donuts but the most important part is that it has to taste good as well.  

I wanted to try the pretzel shape donut, but I didn't see it when I got there, so the the worker told me about a french toast donut that was made fresh.  It took about several minutes to make, and it tasted just like what it was called a, "French Toast Donut".  It was literally a french toast donut.  I also ordered the bitrhday donut with oreo inside and a glazed buttermilk for my boyfriend. All the donuts we ordered exceeded or expectations.  I can't wait to come back next time, and hopefully get my hands on the pretzel donut.

*When you're there don't forget to check out their incredible aquarium created by the guys from TANKED.

Definitely was excited to try Donut Bar out after all the hype and rave reviews I was hearing about it.  Came here on a random Wednesday morning around 8:30 am and parked on the street for $2 (didn't see any other parking).  I had heard that this place could have a line out the door with people waiting to order...I was a little worried that there might be a line to get donuts and at this point I was getting a little hangry.  Fortunately for us there were only about 4-5 other patrons inside and we didn't have to wait at all!  We were instantly greeted by the peppy workers with warm smiles and hellos, the place itself is pretty small with seating for only about 5-6 people inside.  They did say they had seating outside, but we didn't check it out because we were able to snag seats inside. 

My friend and I really didn't know what to order so they gave us a couple of recommendations.  I also was super excited because they serve Stumptown Coffee from Portland here!  We ended up getting 4 donuts, 1 chocolate milk, and 1 Stumptown Coffee cold brew for the both of us all for about $20-$25.  A little on the pricier side, but just remember people these are specialty donuts not your run-of-the-mil grocery store ones.  I don't remember the specific names of the donuts so sorry in advance!
-Donut with Strawberry Pop Tart In It -   Delicious, but wow this is super sweet!  My friend and I felt like we had to make an appt with our dentist after eating this one
-Crème Brule Donut - This was the best one in my opinion, the outside had a nice crispy glaze covering it and when I say crispy I mean crispy, it had a tasty cream inside that wasn't overly sweet either
-Lemon Cream Donut - My second favorite out of the bunch, the lemon whipped cream inside was amazing and they put a ton of the whipped cream inside too!
-Boston Cream Donut Bar - This was probably the most basic donut out of the bunch, it was your standard boston cream donut bar...why my friend decided to get a basic donut at a specialty donut shop I will never know, but I digress...it was still decent! 
-Cold Brew - not as good when I had it in Portland, it tasted a little bit on the bitter side but still delicious nonetheless

I for sure see myself coming back here whenever I want a tasty specialty donut, probably on a weekday morning though because nobody wants to wait in a ridiculously long line (sorry to all you normal 9-5 workers out there, I'll think about you the next time I eat here).

This place was walking distance from my hotel so had to stop and check it out. Definitely would recommend to anyone visiting the area! Picked up 6 different kinds of donuts but the creme brulee one was my favorite! The butterbeer one was adorable! Would love to stop by again next time I'm in Vegas!
Run. Don't walk. Everything we had was so so so good. I took a bunch back home to So Cal with me. We ate them all and enjoyed every bite. I can't wait to go back.

Came to visit! 
They close super early but we came here around noon for our donuts. First time here and they offered us a $10/ box donut. We filled the entire box up with whatever donuts we wanted, and it was amazing that they still had the poppa tart donut which I wanted to try. I took a giant bite out of it, and it was so yummy! It would've been better if I heated it and the glaze was melty and warm. I recommend heating it up though. Overall, I loved the strawberry pop tart donut even though it was so big I couldn't finish it and only ate a quarter and saved the rest for later! It was delicious and I would definitely eat it again.
Vegan strawberry split tastes excellent even by non vegan standards. Also tried the Elvis, banana goodness . thank you thank you very much Donut Bar staff you guys are so friendly ;)
Great donuts, kids loved it will be back. Check out the bathroom if you're a Simpson's fan.

Definitely fills Vegas' missing gourmet donut niche, an it's certainly very pretty and lively and incredibly friendly inside. But is it worth lengthy lines and the hefty price tag? Unfortunately, I don't believe so.

Some donuts tasted quite old. What a sad state of affairs to reach DB on a lovely Saturday morning to have stale donuts already in the case. Bro and I were excited to try the salted caramel raised, but... it was kinda tough. How heartbreaking!

Creme brulee donuts are delicious, but so small. This may be the one force in the universe that can actually make me enjoy cake donuts. Here I actually preferred them! Red velvet, Butterfinger and blueberry Meyer lemon were divine!

Coffee is on point, and music selection selection is pretty sweet at that! Despite so many upticks, in a neighborhood that sure could use upticks and has been gradually, proudly, bringing them in/keeping them here, the stars of the show -- the donuts -- were just meh. An overall A-OK experience.

Bookmarked The Donut Bar for our Vegas trip, best decision we could have made.  We arrived at 8:20 am and there was a short line. We bought so many types of donuts. They all sounded DELICIOUS!!!! We tried the Big Poppa Tart, the cinnamon roll bacon, blueberry Meyer lemon, banana Carmel, creme Brûlée , chocolate euphoria, maple bacon and the pumpkin French toast donut.  Oh, and the Strawberry Split Donut too.

Now you are probably wondering if I ate them all, and the answer is yes, or at least a sampling of them. We brought the goods back to the hotel. We used Uber to get there from The Ventician, and it. The cost of Uber was around 12 dollars roundtrip.

Let's just say there was not one donut in the three boxes we got that wasn't super yummy!!! My favorite was the cinnamon roll and bacon. So much bacon on it and in it too. I found a couple of strips of bacon ribboned through the roll. Best part is that i checked in on Yelp and got a great cup of coffee to with my donuts.

Also, note the owner will be on Tanked on November 18th too. If you ever make it to Vegas checkout The Donut Bar you won't be sorry!!!

We got the bacon cinnamon roll, caramel latte donut and the creme brulee donut.  The creme brulee donut was normal sized, the cinnamon roll was just a little bigger than average, but thr caramel latte donut was huge.  Even splitting them, we could not finish it all.  To top it off, they came around and offered samples of the french toast donut.  That sample made me wish we had gotten one of those for sure.
Such a fun place! Great selection. The pride in their product shows through. Enjoyed a single BIG POPPA and some great fresh brewed coffee. Worth the drive from Henderson.

First time here. Straight from the airport. Saw the hype on yelp and facebook.  No line and plenty of parking.  Close to downtown. 

Only got a few..  their creek brûlée is a signature item. Hard crispy sugar shell. Yeast insides with custard filling. Looked good. 

I had the strawberry pop tart which has an actual pop tart inside. Yeast around the pop tart. It was good but not the best ever. A bit dry. This put them on the map. 

Had the Meyer lemon blueberry cake donut. Wow!  It was delicious. I could've eaten maybe 5. Crispy edges. Moist and soft inside. Bursting with blueberry flavor in the cake. Nice lemon flavor icing.    Not too sweet. I would get again if in walking distance. 

It's a bit overwhelming as there are so many options and I wanted to try so many. 

Also got a Hawaiian coffee and it was very tasty. Staff was very friendly. 

Recommend if you are a donut fan.

Outta sight!! Finally was able to try this place, and at First Fridays no less, but I was amazed by the kitschy donut I bought. POP-TART DONUT is exactly what you think: tastes like a Pop-tart, looks like a Pop-tart, has a Pop-tart in it!! At $4, this is a massive donut and well worth the price. I recommend sharing, even though I didn't because I have a problem with not sharing donuts, but you certainly can share this and be satisfied. It's a strawberry-flavored tart inside and includes extra homemade strawberry jelly along with the hidden Pop-tart inside!! White frosting, colorful crumb topping, and strawberry drizzle included! Can't wait to try more of their donuts!

This place is fantastic! Not your ordinary donut store by any means. They make gourmet donuts that will satisfy your taste buds and wow your belly. I absolutely loved their cake donuts as the freshness was apparent and not to mention the flavor of the peanut butter cup one was outstanding. Definitely a must visit when I'm back in downtown Vegas.  Very friendly staff to top it all off! Nice job Donut Bar!

Donut Bar is located a block from Fremont Street Experience and their donuts are simply amazing. 

I've tried to come mid morning but every time they were sold out. I suggest you come as soon as they open to get exactly what you want because they do sell fast.

I tried the sprinkled Oreo stuffed donut and my oh my was it good. They have a ton of selections and I highly recommend them.

I defiantly see why they were voted the best donuts in Vegas.

Found this place through Insider Eats. I was drawn to the Creme Burlee dounut. They have a Homer Simpson donut. I not big into flavored donuts, but I liked the Vanilla Bean and Cake Batter donuts. They have your typical Bacon Maple and Bacon Chocolate donut. There are fun flavors like PB&J, Red Velvet, Mud Pie. All the donuts are made fresh. Some people may feel it's overrated, but it's an overall good find.

After a long night of drinking, you are grateful for your friends who decided to call it an early night and NOT go out.  One of my friends, did just that.  So he woke up early and took the rental car exploring.  He came back with 5 boxes of donuts for our group to sample.  My favorites were the creme brulee.  But every single donut was heaven!

Come here early for a wider selection because once they sell out, they sell out! However, some donuts like their grilled cheese and french toast are made to order. Note that they may not offer the grilled cheese and french toast donuts every day though. 

Having been to the Donut Bar in San Diego, I can say the Las Vegas location is definitely bigger and less crowded (at least on a Saturday morning, though I guess it's off season for Vegas right now). 

I'd say it's most worth to come here if you're excited to try their unique flavors. Blood orange, birthday cake oreo, and the blueberry cheesecake are delicious and not too sweet actually! Also, if you buy a dozen, you get one donut free. We ended up spending $29 (including tax) for three big donuts and 10 small ones, which runs a bit pricey but I'd argue it's worth it especially if you're splitting donuts. The big donuts are gigantic anyways and are (more than) worth the $3. 

Service is friendly and location is hard to miss (with a big donut painted on the outside of the building).
Donut Bar Vegas was just as good as the one in San Diego and the one that was in Costa Mesa that changed hands! Great donuts
SINfully delicious!! Amazing flavor combinations that you would not expect in a donut, but they work!
Just came here again. Love this place. The owner and his staff are awesome!! Love the creme brûlée. I wish I could try all the different donuts. They are all amazing!
Great Place to buy delicious donuts. They're so big and pretty to look at. You don't want to eat them. Will spread the word about this great place!

If you're looking for special donuts that taste as good as they look then you've arrived at the right place. The store variety: smores, Oreo birthday cake, crime brûlée, and etc. The donut price ranges from $2-$5 but the $4-$5 donuts are huge! 

You have to get to the store before 10 am, preferably 8-9:20 am or else most of the popular donuts will be sold out. You can preorder online and pick it up from 8-10 am but the minimum is 12 donuts. 

Easily my favorite donut store when I'm in Las Vegas or San Diego.

Honestly love this place! I'm not a donut person and don't have a sweet tooth at all, but I'd have a donut from here everyday if life allowed it. Donuts are a bit pricier than your regular donut place but completely worth every cent.
Pretty awesome, every donut I had was great!   "The nitro coffee was killer,"says my wife.  Try it you will love it.

Family friendly! The staff was super friendly, and we didn't feel rushed to make the big decision of what amazing donut we wanted. Did you know they give free donuts and balloons to kids on Saturday mornings?! So cool. The donuts were delicious, but my 2.5 year old enjoyed the fish tank of donuts most of all! They also let someone bring their dog in which he loved too.

My husband and I made sure to stop in at least three of the five days we were in town.  Make sure you go early because once they are gone, your out of luck! My favorite hands down had to be the maple bacon but there are no wrong choices to be made here. Definitely a place not to be missed if you're down in old Vegas!
Not really a sweets person. The variety was great. Service was great. Our donut was great!

Are you kidding me??? Buy 6, take a dozen. Ok, done!!!! Every single option of doughnut was to good to be true. From the PB & J to that apple fritter. These people got it going on. Hats off to the pastry chef. The downfall is you have to get there early or you won't get very many options to choose from.
ABSOLUTELY THE BEST DONUTS IN THE WORLD!!!  Get there early because once they are gone, they are closed for the day.

Came here because I really wanted to try their  donuts. It's in downtown and parking wasn't that convenient but thanks for the meters I got in and out. It's a cute donut shop. It's small inside and you go in and get in line to order. I got 2 creme brûlée donuts and I also got the Nutella donut. The Nutella donut was $4 and the creme brûlée was $2. Definitely reasonable prices. I would have to say I love love love the creme brûlée donut. It's my favorite and I loved the Nutella one too but creme brûlée definitely has my heart. I will definitely come back here for sure.

The first time ever going there it was pretty awesome. It's a pretty cool

They had a lot of donuts to pick from. The donut I got was called "The Homer", yes like Homer Simpson. Classic donut, pink frosting, and sprinkles. That donut was literally bigger than my face, it was very sweet, and delicious. Totally grab a coffee or milk to go with it!

Donut Bar is pretty popular. So the biggest downside is that there's not that many seats inside, they do have a few seat outside in the shade. It's Las Vegas, even in the shade it's like 102° outside. 

I would totally recommend someone to go to the Donut Bar in Downtown Las Vegas!

The donuts selection is amazing and everything looks divine! Everything is to DIE FOR! It's that good!

I love the "Brad."

Meh...
Nothing special.  Expensive donut.  
Not worth driving 20 min to try them out.

I am big fan of Donuts and believe me I have been to palaces where they have amazing donuts.  This is by far one of the best donuts place I have been too.  It is like hidden gem in downtown.  Place opens (on Sundays) at 8am (pst).  You will find line forming from 7:30am.  8am store opens and some one comes out from store and counts how many kids they have in line with their family at that time...Chef and his assistance comes out with plate of freshly made donuts for kids and gives them each.  Assistance hand over balloon to kids.  Then they start serving you.  

You get in the shop and welcomed with smile and amazing smell of fresh donuts, cream and coffee.  They take time to serve you, answer your questions and get your order ready.  By the time you get to cashier, your order is ready! 

Place is clean, great happy environment, awesome service and amazing donuts.  MUST VISIT THIS PLACE AND HAVE DONUTS....

Great donuts and great service- a definite win in my book!

I read an article that this spot would be opening in the same location as a former donut shop. On Sunday I was finally downtown doing one of my make my own food crawls and knew I needed to stop in.

We were warmly greeted right away by the employees and the delicious looking donuts. :) Since we were doing a food crawl we narrowed to two donuts, but we were offered some free donuts and who can pass on free donuts? I'm glad that I was able to try several flavors and get a good idea of what they offer. 

The apple donut was my favorite. It had a nice spice cake flavor with small chunks of apple in the cake and a nice glaze on top. The chai donut was unique and also hit the spot. The birthday cake donut had Oreo in the center and was tasty as well. The vanilla was my friend's favorite and while simple, I loved this one as well. The chocolate fritter was less moist than the other donuts and had a nice flavor, but wasn't my favorite of the bunch. Overall, nice texture and awesome flavor for the donuts.

We also enjoyed some of the delicious Stumptown coffee. Stumptown is always delicious and quality coffee is always good with a donut. I also tried the Nitro brew which was bold and perfect with the sweet donuts.

The employees were very friendly and generous in making sure we were able to try as much as possible during our visit. I love visiting a local business where I can feel the pride in the business. It's cool to have another business join what is becoming a pretty cool downtown Las Vegas.
My favorite place to go for donuts!  They have a great variety.  Donut Bar would be great for office visit gift.

I'm not a donut fan at all but this place I absolutely love! They have the best donuts. Everything I've tried has been delicious. My favorites are blueberry cheesecake and the French toast donut! I go every chance I get.

Great selection of donuts. Get there before 10am for best selection. You can also pre-order the day before for next-day pick-up.  
Donuts I've had:
Creme Brulee - It's vegan, but I'm not, and it was good.
Mexican Hot Chocolate - has a cayenne spice in it's chocolate; different and good.
Snickers - say no more
Strawberry Cheescake - great take on traditional jelly donut

Ahh freaking mazing! Walked in greeted right away. The staff made recommendations for which donuts to try. They had so many options! They also had drip coffee or made to order coffee drinks. The prices were reasonable and well worth it. I wish I lived close to this but I'm also happy I don't. ;)

The dopest donut spot in las vegas, the donuts are huge and tasty they have chocolate milk and strawberry milk on tap along with cold brew coffee on tap. Jeff the owner is amazing along with the entire staff. I love the creme brule donut and the Twix so bomb. I will frequent this place from here on out. Go try them out, you won't be sorry!!

Stopped in while staying in Vegas on a vacation and got the DB's Nutella with the nuts and it was delicious! I will say they're kind of bread-like and not what I'm used to but chocolate milk helped with that. Very tasty and a great way to start the day off!

Donut bar was a fun and good experience. The wife and I and friends tried a handful of different types of donuts that you can only get there. If you're looking for your regular typical donut this probably is not a spot for you. I really like normal donuts but I was in town and had to try them. We ordered the big vanilla donut and a apple cake donut or apple crumb donuts sorry and another cake batter doughnut. They all had phenomenal flavor and we're not your normal donut. If you're looking for a new spot then you should make sure to try this one.

Apparently there is a grilled cheese donut you can try, I think if I knew that I would try it again.

This is now one of my favorite donut shops. When I came in, I was excited to see a lot of fun options ranging from pistachio to strawberry cheese cake to the classic and delicious maple bacon. Most of the donuts were huge and still very well priced ($2-$4)! On top of it all, the staff was sooo friendly and that made my experience even better!

3 stars...
This place was recommended by local friends so we were sure not to miss it. There was a short line to get into the joint so we had high expectations.
I got the Nutella and my wife got the salted caramel. Both were good and were large donuts.
Ambiance is stripmall cafe, service was friendly, and prices are slightly above expectation.
Not sure we picked the best of show, so at first glance this joint does not make the list, but we will definitely give them another shot next time we visit! We will be back!!

Seen a video about this donut shop on YouTube and was intrigued to try it out. Got there a little late and yes they sell out fast. Was able to get a blue berry big daddy and a jelly filled donut. Pop tart donut was definitely a must try. Its taste was as unique as its look. The other donut was ok. Nothing cray to jump about. However I will definitely come back but allot earlier in the morning.

I was really excited to try this place. Coming from Henderson, and I would say it isn't worth the drive. The donut and cappuccino was mediocre. The interior is super cute and the staff was kind. At 10:30 more than half the counter was sold out. We thought there would be a lot more options. Not sure if I'll be back.

I had to see what all the hype was about. I am NOT a morning person, but I dragged my ass out of bed and headed downtown for a donut. I was there around 7:45a and there were still about 20 people in line ahead of me. Get there early because they close once they sell out.

They post their menu for the following day on Instagram. I decided before I got there that I was going  to get the Crème Bruleé donut. I promised myself I was only getting 1. I lied. I left with 6.

I did get my Crème Bruleé, but I also got a Vanilla Bean Glazed, Strawberry Poppa Tart, Twix, a Maple Bar, & Cake Batter. It was around $20. I seriously ate nothing but Donuts all day. And, they were huge, fresh, & delicious. Completely worth getting up early, driving across town, and paying too much for!

I already have my next must try flavors picked out. Caramelized Pineapple, S'mores Poppa Tart, Banana Caramel, Samoa, Apple Fritter, & Blood Orange.

Best Donuts in Las Vegas!! A MUST TRY!!
Absolutely amazing! They had so many delicious donuts, we had bought several different kinds because we couldn't decide and had to try them all.

I've been trying to make it here for years and today it finally happened! We arrived at 10 a.m and they still had plenty of delicious choices to choose from. We chose the famous Creme Brûlée donut and a Harry Potter ButterBeer donut. Both were great, the ButterBeer donut was HUGE, I had to share it with my husband. Customer service was friendly and answered all our questions. Can't wait to come back next time we are in Las Vegas

Tons of flavors to choose from! My favorites were probably the creme brûlée! The outer crust of the donut was nice and hard just like the top of creme brûlée! Some other good ones we had were Boston cream, very chocolate, and the apple bacon fritter. They had a steady flow of traffic coming through the doors. The staff was super friendly, patient, and helpful. They also serve coffee. I had an Americano. It was light years ahead of anything I've had from Starbucks. Overall wonderful and pleasant experience.

I heard about this place and the amazing donuts they have. You need to be early to get all their amazing donuts because they sell out fast! Definitely try their daily specials and be prepared to want everything on display.
Best ramen I have ever had in my life. Deep flavor, always piping hot. I get the spick chicken ramen extra hot. I promise, you cant go wrong. #noramenolife
WOW!!! Vegan donuts are heaven and they make them so perfectly. There was a little line but it moved fast. Coffee was yummy and service was great. I'll be back here for sure.

After a big lunch at Lotus of Siam, my wife found this place, so we went... I'm not a donuts fan. Even though I've been forced to go to few donuts shops recently. This place was one of the upscales donut places. Since we went there after lunch they were about to close, we only got a maple bacon donut bar. And it was satisfying. The maple glaze actually has the taste of some bacon flavor, it banded with the bacon pieces perfectly. I'm actually looking forward to come back to this place to try other flavors.
I love the selection Donut Bar have to offer.  It's great for all occasion and especially gifting it.  Well, the truth is, they're delicious and sometime just to beautiful to eat.

My first experience with Donut Bar was at at Yelp event where I tried their pumpkin filled yeast donut and it was pretty disappointing. The dough wasn't as perfectly light as I like. And I really prefer for the entire donut to have a thick layer of glaze - this did not. Also, the filling was barely sweetened and basically tasted like butter. 

However, after brunch at eat. I figured I might as well stop by and give it another chance. This time I knew not to get a yeast donut and to try the cake instead. I went with one Strawberry Cream Cheese and one Apple Crumble. The latter was nice, but the Strawberry was even better because it was super sweet and flavorful. (In case you couldn't tell, I expect as much sugar as possible.) But both were moist on the inside (the Strawberry even had little juicy specks of red) and the outside had a nice thick glaze. 

I went on a Saturday and there was a line to the door that moved at a pretty decent speed. There was a big family behind me and I believe I heard someone behind the counter say that kids get a free donut on Saturdays. Pretty cool! Does my three month old count? Haha!

First time here. They told me the creme brûlée donut was vegan so how could I say no? The caramelized sugar on top was ridiculously good. 

I also got an almond milk latte. It was pretty good too.

Very yummy and I like that they have several tasty vegan options. Def check them out.

This place by far is my most favorite place to go to when I am downtown!  They alway have the best selections especially for the sweet tooth cravings I alway have! 

There location isn't too far from downtown Fremont and the Container Park, So this is alway a good option to come to first thing in the morning.  That's probably the best time to come in is early, they alway sell out fast and all the good options are gone if you decided to come in later in the day. 

I have been lucky so far to alway grab my favorites before they sale out. My go-to's are alway the birthday Cake, the Homer, and a Nutella one. I even love the Churro Cone with Ice Cream. 
My favorite time to come here is on the weekend. It should I say my little ones favorite time to come here is on Saturday or Sunday, they alway give out free donuts to kids. They make them a featured character and have it all decorated out.  Last time we came here and got our free donut they were handing out Ninjago Donuts, my son was super excited and absolutely went crazy with pure happiness. He has now made it a point to request we go there everyday, but unfortunately my metabolism won't be able to keep up with that request, so we opt for the weekends only lol.  
If your lucky enough to come on happy hour you can grab a box full for $10, the only sad part is you don't know when they will have it or if they will. It's usually before they close and depending on how much they have left. So it's alway a win win when you come in, you can grab a speciality donut, or a free kids character donut, or a happy hour box.  
Either way you will definitely not be displeased with the quality of the donuts, and you can always walk off the calories at Fremont or Container Park.

This is an amazing spot.  East Fremont is already an incredible alternative to the over-priced sheen of the strip dining options.  Add in the warm service and awesome, reasonably-priced delicacies at the Donut Bar and it's almost heaven.

I tried the signature Creme Brûlée donut and loved it. The donut itself was not too sweet and the creme in the middle was delicious. The hardened glaze on top cracked in a fun way as I bit in.

They had dozens of other delicious looking donuts, ranging in sizes, which I liked too.  If you're just there for a quick bite, grab a small donut.  If you're in the mood to indulge, they have enormous donuts in all sorts of unusual flavors and with great decorations.  I was especially intrigued by the grilled cheese donut but will have to check that out next time I'm in town.

We got iced americanos two days we were there.  So refreshing.

Love this place! Always a line, always worth it. The owners are very friendly and seem like they care about their customers, not just making money. Donuts are delicious. Clean place. Small, but has a great back patio area to enjoy your treats! Highly recommend to anyone that comes to visit!
Superb. Fun. New design. Urban atmosphere close to everything. Before j never walked downtown. But it's becoming a good walking city. A+

I was very disappointed with this place. I was happy to find out that they had vegan donuts, but the quality of the donuts were sub par at best. I got there around 2:30pm just as they were closing, so they were selling the donuts for $10 per box. I thought it was a good deal until I actually tried the donuts. They were awful. I tried all of the vegan donuts that they had left. Apple fritter, salted caramel, Creme brûlée, and peanut butter and jelly. They were all hard and stale. The apple fritter was burnt on the bottom.  The top of the Creme brûlée was like a hard piece of plastic. I was shocked at how bad the product was, especially since they are surrounded by so many great eateries in the area. They should be embarrassed selling that kind of garbage, even if it is closing time.

I definitely do not recommend this place.

This place is my go to breakfast in Downtown Las Vegas. The donuts are made fresh everyday and of course my favorite is the Creme Brulee donut. The outside is that caramelized sugar and the inside is a fluffy donut with vanilla creme. It's something that will be on your mind until you go back. Other than the donut, my favorite part was the vanilla custard/ ice cream in a cinnamon sugar donut cone. Yup, you heard me right. And it was drizzled in caramel sauce. Let's just say it got a little messy, but was so worth it. I came back every other day for a week for it. 

*Key advice: They usually sell out everyday by 1 pm and close the shop when they sell out. And make sure to check in for a cup of free espresso or drip when you buy a dozen!

Had to stop by donut bar and grab to some treats for a date night with the lady. Donut bar is very creative with their menu, everything we had tasted great my only gripe was some of the donuts tasted stale, I think this has more to do with the way they are being displayed and stored which ends up drying them out faster, because the make all their stuff fresh everyday and when they run out they are out. This brings me to my second point, the earlier you go the better these donuts taste, and the more variety you get. Overall I would say try it for yourself  not sure what it's called (apple fritter maybe) was amazing. Definitely going back and recommending to friends.

Great place for a sugar rush and stomachache! 

Jokes aside, these donuts are something else. I would HIGHLY recommend you share a donut with a friend (or two) and not take one on yourself like I did.

Go early as they do sell out throughout the day. My first time here, I was browsing the huge selection but what caught my eye was PISTACHIO. All time favorite, had to try it - even if it was pistachio lemon. Boy was I impressed. The lemon flavor punches you in the face, but the pistachio caresses you and makes it all better. The balance of flavor they manage to pack into the donut is spectacular. The size is on the outrageous side, but it definitely makes it worth the price. Their coffee is also top notch and pairs well with any donut you decide to devour.

I would take visitors to town here, but I would hesitate on coming regularly. Although it's a damn good donut, my stomach would hate me.

Donuts bring families together! This place is heaven. My family and I had just finished a 4 day vegas trip, and to say we were all sick of each other was an under statement. As we were leaving los vegas i decided to take my family here unannounced. They were not thrilled, donuts? Is what I heard from them.we had not had breakfast yet but we were in downtown and I decided to treat my self.  Pleasing my family is never easy, but the Donut bar delivered. My sister is a vegan and a food snob, (guess what they make amazing vegan donuts,  so amazing they don't even want to tell you so that you don't try them!) 
My parents are very set in their ways and we're not thrilled by  donuts for breakfast......it's so good once it hits your lips!!!!!!!! My family were taken back by the creme Brule donuts, than the strawberry cream, and the lemon pistachio.  But when I got the maple bacon donut (I've had dreams about this thing ) they looked at me like I was crazy. It was amazing!  I had to force them to try it but they ended up loving it. Thank Donut Bar because of your donuts our family tension  was gone we were able to bond and have a good drive home. Your donuts saved the day!

we visited from CA and stopped in after seeing this place on yelp. you are greeted by nice people as soon as you walk in. we went in during happy hour. it was buy one get one free. we got 2 pop tart strawberry donuts that are huge and wont disappoint you. we only paid $4. it was interesting that there is actually a pop tart inside. one is enough to share because of the size and sweetness. we also got 2 iced coffees. if you like strong coffee this is the brew for you. it was too strong for me. they have a good selection and its a hidden gem. I really enjoyed this place and the service.

I heard about this place on Facebook, and wanted to check out the hype. I went here around 12:00 PM, and surprisingly, there was no line. The service was really good! Our cashier was very nice! He was very patient with me since this had been my first time. 

The restroom and the restaurant layout is very nice! The restroom doesn't have a mirror just an FYI. The interior design around the restaurants suits it well.

The donuts weren't as good as I expected. I got the Creme Brûlée donut which wasn't very good. It tasted cold because it had been left out throughout the morning. I thought it would be warm and fluffy, but it was cold and tasteless. I really did try to like it because I heard so many great things about this place! Maybe I went during the wrong time, but I am willing to give this place another chance (donut wise)!

Best place for donuts... ever! Birthday Donut is a MUST. Oreo in the middle brings it all together to please your tastebuds. Be sure to get there bright and early for the best choices, very popular so they sell out by noon sometimes. Also, be there on weekends for the French toast donut!!! You will not be disappointed! The jam served along with it is the absolute best!
Not only are the donuts a work of art....but they taste amazing also.  Had the Strawberry Split and 2 of us couldn't finish it,  bit we sure tried.

Love the selection and the donuts are huge for the most part. Had the Elvis and hubs had the birthday cake. We devoured them both and we're not usually big donut eaters. Won't go to downtown Vegas without them again

I stayed down the street for one night since I came in super late!  In the morning I was in search of an espresso that was going to be better than the free hotel coffee and a yelp search sent me here.

I walked in and the staff was super friendly and let me look in the cases and take it all in while not pressuring me to make a decision.  The strawberry short cake doughnuts looked amazing as did the one's with the pop tarts inside but, I chose a strawberry cheese cake doughnut, creme brulee doughnut and long doughnut filled with German cream.  Extremely creative doughnut flavors and combinations without being over the top and not well executed.

I headed back to the hotel and let me tell you the strawberry cheesecake doughnut only lasted for 4 bites.  My friend ate the other two and they lasted about the same and he kept saying how amazing they were.  I agreed because I had to stop myself from going back to get more for myself.  The espresso was the strongest and best that I have had in quite a few years!

I will definitely be back when I am here again in June!

Warning: you will be overwhelmed by the choices, eat more donuts than you planned, and end up with a oh-so-worth-it bellyache. I can't wait to come back here. I've already started making a list of friends and family that are coming to town so that I can bring them here too (and hopefully have a little more control and spread out the donuts that I want to try). 

This place is super clean, cute, and we saw both of the owners in on a Saturday morning making the french toast donuts and handing out drinks at the counter. That is one of the greatest things to me to see because it shows me that they're really here and really passionate about their business and I am so excited to go back and support them again and again. 

Parking is very available near here, with both street parking and a pay-to-park lot directly across the street. When you enter, you are immediately greeted by so many donut options that you will feel a little overwhelmed (so many choices) but don't worry, your donut guide will be with you shortly and will help you pick a great one. 

I chose the big poppa tart, a donut the size of 2 long johns, filled with a pop tart and jam, and topped with pop tart crumbles and frosting. It was awesome. The donut was super puffy and flakey and even before getting to the pop tart middle, tasted exactly like a pop tart. Next time I really want to try the strawberry split or the french toast donut (which is made to order and served warm). 

I honestly can't wait to go back. This is a great little local place that is fun for both locals and tourists alike. Just make sure you get up early; when they sell out for the day, they close!

I realize this is an outlier of a review, but I did reach out to Donut Bar via their website with no response. Overall, these are some good donuts. I had the maple bacon cinnamon roll before we headed off to Death Valley and Northern California. The first few bites were pretty amazing, but things turned when I got closer to the center, which by this time we were in Indian Springs. The girlfriend thought it was a molten center, but it just turned out that the center was COMPLETELY RAW!  I'm not saying this was the contributing factor to some stomach problems I had for the following few days, but exactly rule it out either. 

The other thing is the kids donuts they have on Saturday. And while they are cool, they are really no different than those over-iced heavily food colored donuts you can get at a supermarket.

If I could give this place more stars, I would. It's been hyped as The Best Donuts In The World and they live up to the name. We stayed in downtown Vegas for 5 days and we had breakfast 3 of the days here at DonutBar. Everything we bought and ate was delicious. 

Some of the donuts are oversized and I expected them to be hard but they were soft and fluffy. Great flavors in each one we tried. 

If you live here or visit here, you HAVE to come to DonutBar. And not just once, come a few times to try them all.
Amazing! I tried a cremè brûlée donut and the strawberry cheesecake, washed down with a nitrogen infused cold brew coffee. Boom! I was buzzing for hours... (In a good way)

The staff were so nice & helpful! And the donuts were yummy (they're just really really sweet) that's why I gave them 4 stars for all the ups. 

The only downfall? The prices. It's really pricey. But they only sell til they run out so get there quick.

woke up to the screeching sound of my alarm.. sun was already out to greet me as I remembered why I had chosen to wake up at such an ungodly hour.. 

D O N U T B A R

.. It was my first time & I heard this place was the place to be for donut lovers, which I am. Drove over to a still sleepy yet incredibly sunny downtown LV where I parked in an empty parking lot.. The heat was already starting to sear the air in my car..

I had gotten there a bit early to my surprise so it was about 11 minutes before I made my way to the entrance. I walked and turned the corner as the low murmur of the crowd awaiting reached my ears. There must have been about 7-9 people in front of me.. And by the time Donut Bar opened their door- I was no longer last, but found the line had started to wrap around the corner I had turned on earlier.. People made their way in and I trailed behind. As I stepped in, I relished in the coolness that hit me (thanks A/C). Then I saw the sight before.. Donuts, all shapes and sizes.. All different from each other and so many to choose from. But the one that caught my eye was the classic strawberry donut, you kno with the whip cream and blueberries and the stuff sits in between two halves of a donut. Oh yeah, that's the one. 

I got my goods and saw that the line had only grown even longer.. And I was immediately thankful for the rude yet early awakening. I sat outside in the little courtyard and ate the delicious thing. I could NOT even finish it- it was so giant and so good.. It was quite overwhelming ! But it was so worth. I left feeling stuffed but so happy. 

If you're ever around, pay this place a visit and set your alarms because you will want to come here to try their vast array of donuts. Service is speedy, efficient & awesome. Prices are more than reasonable. And donuts are FANTASTIC.

By far the best donuts I have ever seen or eaten In my life. I loved in San Diego for 7 years and was a regular at that location and when one arrived in las vegas I had to make a trip to see if it was just as good, and it was! If you're in las vegas I highly recommend making a trip here and you just have to get there early. They tend to sell out around 11am. 

My favorites on the menu would have to be the caramelized pineapple, creme Brule and the big poppa tart. Though your safe with picking any flavor because they are all incredibly delicious.
Great donuts off the beaten path a bit but worth the walk or drive. Huge donuts and very reasonably priced. We had the Nutella and mud pie donuts both were great

This place was suggested by our teenage niece, it has a social media presence. It's location is close to a seedy area with some homeless sleeping in the alley way on the way to parking, the parking is 15 minute only,so we made the order to go. We tried the red velvet,blueberry,mudpie, creme brulee, nutella overload, chocolate and strawberry shortcake. They give you 1 free donut per dozen, or a coffee of you check in Yelp,we also ordered capuccinos. Ok out of all those I would suggest the nutella overload and the mudpie, the others are just ok. Would I go here again as a matter of craving, not really. But worth it at least to try and for the experience of artisanal donuts and social media posting if you are into that

This place is great! The donuts are perfectly crafted and put together with amazing detail and deliciousness. The prices definitely reflect it, but hey, it's worth it! You can't get donuts like this just anywhere! Plus, they have strawberry milk on tap... Who does that?!?! Thank you donut bar, for doing that!
Customer service was worth the trip! Four to Five stars for service. Product quality was merely so-so to lacking.
First of all, the donuts are out of this world!!! Secondly, the staff are so happy to be there. Walking in their store is like a breath of fresh air. Lovely experience overall.
Amazing giant donuts, excellent value and many interesting flavors to choose from. Friendly service.  The nitro cold brew coffee was spot on. Highly recommend this place

Donuts were pretty average, despite their promising appearance. Old fashioned glaze was the best one. I'm a cake donut kind of girl ?We ordered lemon blueberry, old fashioned chocolate glaze, old fashioned vanilla glaze, Nutella, Boston cream, and yeast chocolate glaze. Most of the cake donuts were dry on the inside and oily on the outside. The chocolate glaze was not sweet enough, even paired with sweetness of donut, and was akin to eating an unsweetened chocolate bar. Not my style. ? I would say go here if you're from a place with no fancy donuts. They are better than Dunkin donuts, but that standard isn't very high.

I was so excited to take my son here and experience the amazing donuts that I had seen. I was disappointed. The donuts tasted like they had been sitting for awhile and for the price that we paid I would expect more. We got a dozen donuts before even tasting them to take some home to everyone and to be honest besides the size of them, we didn't notice anything special. I hope it was just a down day, but as busy as they were I don't see how it would be. I can say that the coffee I got was great.

I am a big fan of the Donut Bar in San Diego so on our Las Vegas visit this weekend, we decided to stop and pick up some donuts. 

The donuts are very yummy. But I feel like the location is kind of out of the way and the shop is VERY small. Basically five star donuts but three star location and shop size.
We keep trying this place since they opened but on all 3 visits the donuts were dry and stale and we've gotten really sick every single time. Gross.

My wife and I had been to the San Diego location so when we're heard that Las Vegas would be getting one we had to make a trip while we were in town. The location wasn't up and running yet but we were still invited in, I believe his name was Dan and Amy. They were both so friendly! Showed us around even gave us a box of delicious donuts to take with us! Mmmmmm maple bacon! If you're looking for a great place run by friendly people this is it!

Don't get me wrong, the donuts WERE GOOD... but they weren't exceptional or phenomenal (to me). 

If you enjoy cake-batter like heavy donuts, then these will be right up your alley. But if you're more into fluffy doughy donuts, then these are not for you. 

My boyfriend and I landed in Vegas on a Saturday morning and headed straight to Donut Bar at 8am hoping for some fresh donuts. We got there around 830AM & there was no line when we walked in. The second we entered, the room filled with sweet smelling goodness.

All the donuts LOOKED AMAZING. We bought 2 dozen for our entire group of friends. So we basically tried every single Donut they had to offer. And I mean I actually tried a bite of every single one.. and I wasn't too amazed. Maybe I was just overhyped? 

The price was pretty high too. The doughnuts are HUGE.. But bigger is not always better. They ranged from $2-5 depending on which flavor. We ended up spending about $75 for 2 dozen.

Most likely I would not come back here again, but it doesn't hurt to try if you're a first timer! I would definitely recommend heading to the east coast if you're on the hunt for real delicious donuts!

Really Awesome donuts, I love their fresh variety and such a great atmosphere. Our kiddos get a free donut from chef on the weekends which is so sweet, it's the little details that makes this place extra special. 
Love love love a must try

Hubby and I had the poptart donuts
 The donuts are beautiful and presentation is amazing. It was a lot of cake.
Fantastic donuts! Even the most basic "models" are special and delicious. Friendly staff, super clean. Our new "must stop"  the next time we pass thru Vegas.

So this is what you call sweet and savory heaven. I am visiting a friend in town and he introduced me to the "next level" of donuts and a trip to the gym following it. I was extremely pleased by the array of options and flavors. The donuts are huge. Well worth the extra run afterwards. And this bar had the nerve to have a grilled cheese donut! I went two times. It would have been three times in 4 days, but I drove by around noon one day and they were already sold out! What a bummer. But I learned quickly, if I'm craving a donut, I need to get to Donut Bar ASAP!

HIDDEN GEM

I was in the area for work and stumbled across this place.  My co-workers had mentioned it a few times so I decided to head in and see what it was all about.  I couldn't believe the amount of people in the store.  The atmosphere was rustic which was nice.  The employees were fantastic and very friendly.  They could tell it was my first time in as I just stared at the donut display case.  They had a special for the day which was a french toast donut.  The thing was the size of a salad plate!!  It came in a huge box on a plate and was sprinkled in powdered sugar.  They give you 3 toppings - maple, blueberry and butter.  This donut was literally a full on breakfast.  The donut itself had a little crunch to the outside but was soft and fluffy on the inside.  I can see now why this place is such a hit.

Tip:  Get there as close to opening as you can because they sell out quickly.  Once their stock is gone they will close the doors for the day.  Definitely worth the morning drive!

I get to Vegas about once each year and we always stay downtown.  I had seen Donut Bar on Instagram one day when I was getting excited about my trip.  I decided to follow them for a while, and after dreaming about their donuts for months, we mad it in.  This place does not disappoint!  The service was helpful and friendly.  Come hungry.  The donuts are massive!  My hubby got the Crème brûlée, a yeast donut and I had a cake donut called, a buttermilk it was covered with some type of chocolate ganache.  My husband decided to order. Nitro cold brew coffee.  Everything was delicious!  It's not cheap food at all but, everything was so well made and delicious it's worth the expense.  My donut was crispy on the outside, light and cakey on the inside and the chocolate was the exact right amount of sweet.  My husband's was just like Crème brûlée.  It had s nice crack on the outside and delicious vanilla custard inside.  You could even see the Vanilla bean speckles.  There is a small sitting area outside with adirondack chairs.  This is a must visit and lives up to the Instagram photos. Totally worth the check in.

AMAZING! AWESOME! A whole new level in donuts... Very friendly, customer oriented staff, easy street parking but I live close and walk... Get in early because the line begins at 7am. Definitely a pilgrimage for donut connoisseurs!

When you walk up to Donut Bar, the window proclaims they are the best donuts in the world. Well, I have to say they just might be right. As this was my first visit, I wanted to get a variety of treats to sample. I ordered the French toast doughnut. I don't often use the word heavenly, however that description applies to the French toast doughnut. It was exquisite and large enough for both my wife and I to split. We also ordered the strawberry shortcake doughnut. That was tasty as well. The bacon maple longjohn and the bacon cinnamon roll were both awesome treats combining the salty of bacon and the sweet of the doughnut. 
The staff including Chef Jeff were all nice and very friendly in a genuine way. 
I will definitely be back on my next trip to Vegas.

I would go to Donut Bar in San Diego so I was thrilled when I heard it was coming to Las Vegas. You can pre-order online to avoid the line if you're ordering at least a dozen.

They do have a wide selection of specialty donuts & some are huge! However, this location isn't as up to par as their flagship location. I'm also never downtown in the morning so it's a hassle to even go there. It's good, but it's not as good, especially when there's other donut places that are easier to go to.

I've been wanting to try the french toast donuts & ice cream cone, but they're only available on the weekends.

I have never been to Donut Bar until today. As soon as I walked in I was greeted by a friendly employee Jeff. I preordered donuts the previous day and they were ready when I got there right at the hour. The cleanliness of the Donut Bar is amazing. You can see all the donuts they have to offer in a great glass case. They make them fresh everyday and the employee said they rarely have any waste at the end of the day. I would highly recommend you stopping by and supporting this local business. although the donuts are around $2-$3 you get what you pay for- gourmet donuts. 
Thanks Donut Bar!

Ridiculous!

We tried the Lemon donut, Mud Pie, chocolate bacon bar and the maple bacon cinnamon roll.... YUM.

The mocha is the best I've ever had. Great coffee!!! Coming back!

I went to the donut bar based on the yelp reviews

Sorry 18.00 gets you stale creme brulee donuts
Stale coconut chocolate donut, stale maple bar. The two stars go to the bourbon caramel donut. The only fresh one in the bunch. Oh and the creme brulee is NOT creme brulee, its a cheap vanilla pudding and not even tasty vanilla pudding.

Not returning to spend that kind of money on garbage 

I decided to drive out of the Las Vegas strip after reading the reviews. God was i wrong to trust. Either people were drunk when they came here or i arrived on an off day.

I have a love for cakes, cookies, pastries and most of all, donuts.  Especially on vacation.  Because when you are on vacation, everyone knows that all the rules of physics go out the door and any calories you consume are offset by all the walking you do.  #truth

My first order of business in Las Vegas was to find some delicious donuts other than the Krispy Kreme and Dunkin Donuts variety.  Located in downtown Vegas, I found Donut Bar!  At the time, I didn't know Donut Bar (original shop in San Diego) was listed as the Number 1 Donut Shop on lists from USA Today, Thrillist.com, MSN and more.  But as soon as I walked in, I knew I had found a gem.  

The donuts they offer are huge, over the top, and look downright amazing!  Their most popular is their Big Poppa Tart Donut which is made with a full pop tart and weighs one entire pound!  I wanted to try everything, but I decided on three:  crème brulee, blueberry with meyer lemon, and maple bacon.  The crème brulee is a yeast donut filled with crème topped with a hard candy shell.  For those with a sweet tooth, you will love biting into it.  For those that like their donuts a little less sweet, the blueberry with meyer lemon is  perfect.  The cake donut is topped with a perfectly lemony frosting.  My favorite was the maple bacon bar.  The yeast donut is so soft and topped generously with thick and chewy bacon pieces that paired with the sweet maple frosting like a dream.  Mmmmmm....

It's a bit of a gamble as they close when they sell out, but if you visit Donut Bar after 10am, they serve donut ice cream cones!!!  I will get one of those one day!

I love donuts & I love donut bar. My favorite is with out a doubt the bacon cinnamon roll. (It's not a donut, I know. BUT BACON) I went for their grand opening, and really enjoyed it. Even got to taste their chi tea latte which was pretty good! And fret not, if you're like me, they offer dairy alternatives, like soy!  they have an incredible selection of crazy awesome donuts and your basics that you love. And they also offer VEGAN & gluten free options which, while I am not vegan, think It's awesome that they offer a sweet selection for everyone!

Meh. We were there at 11 am on a Saturday morning after we'd gone to Donutmania and found a poor selection. Donut bar had even fewer...maybe 20 but not a great variety. We got a maple bacon apple fritter--the last one. It was the only one left that wasn't just a "regular" donut. After all, we went there to try a fun, different type of donut, not just an old fashioned or a glazed donut. So, the "bacon" is just bacon bits that you buy in a jar--not real, fresh bacon crumbles like I expected. The fritter was dry and didn't have nearly enough apple in it nor glaze on it.  Had it been real bacon, and more apple, maybe it would have been worth the $4. Otherwise, I'd just stick to a national donut chain who knows what they're doing.

Lost count how many times we've been here.
Never disappoint.
French toast donut lifer.
Too bad this one doesn't have beer like the other.

Was in Vegas and stumbled across this place when looking for a breakfast joint to go to near downtown on Yelp. There was such a variety of uncommon donut flavors (Nutella, mud pie, strawberry cheesecake, Homer Simpson) and the donuts were huge! I asked the guy at the counter for a recommendation, since there were so many choices, and he said to try the French toast donut. So I ordered and when it came out, it was a huge donut with butter, syrup, and blueberry compote on the side. I took the first bite with butter and dipped in syrup and I think the sky parted and  I heard angels singing!!! The lightest French toast ever!!! What a combo! My girlfriend had the strawberry cheesecake and said it was amazing! We will be back here the next time we are in Vegas. They only served this donut Sat and Sun, from what the guy said, so if you have a cheat meal and in Vegas for a weekend, this is the meal to have.   It's right down the street from the Mob Museum, which was also a great place to visit after having a foodgasm.

Wasn't a big fan of the creme brûlée donut as the sugar on top was very thick and hard and the donut was very dense and doughy. Also tried the cinnamon sugar donut cone with the vanilla ice cream in the middle and was also disappointed. The vanilla ice cream was nice and creamy but the cinnamon sugar cone was also hard to bite into and little dry. Bookmarked this place for months and was very disappointed

Maple bacon bar was pretty good, nutella didnt really taste nutella-y but the donut meat was delicious and puffy, hubby thought his bacon apple fritter was over cooked, but flavor good. Next time i am gonna get the Homer.

My first time here since they took over from the old O face. I have to say I am very impressed!! When first walking in the environment is hip. The smell is so amazing and could be smelled from a block away!! 

We decided to order a dozen to make sure we all got try everything we wanted. We ordered almost every kind or at least the kinds that we wanted to. 

My favorite is the French toast, so amazing and super fresh!! They make it right when you order it!! That could be breakfast alone. 

Price point was not bad for the size of the donuts you get! The staff was friendly and the chefs talked to us as we checked out. 

Check in on Yelp for your free expresso!! What a wake up call. 

We will be back soon enough!!
I wish you guys were closer. I miss your blood orange doughnut.
Great selection of donuts, if you can think it they got it. You have get there early tho, some donuts tend to run out in the first hour or so! Yeah there are that good!!

Yum!! So many good donuts to choose from you will need to visit multiple times. The last time I went I tried to donut with the fried Oreo in the middle. Must try!

Past times I have been able to try their specialty, the Pop Tart doughnut. This thing is 1lb! So tasty and big enough to share (if you're feeling generous!) 

The staff is very friendly as well. Good addition to the downtown area! I will be back :) 

Tip**Get there early or go on weekdays to have a choice of full selection-they run out early because they are so popular and tasty!

3.5* doughnuts. 

I just ordered these on Uber eats. First impression was that the doughnuts are really big! Then I took a bite and was a bit disappointed.  Not the "best doughnuts in the world" like their box claims. I've had far better, fresher and softer dough at Donut Mania or Glaze. Just ok!
