Everything about this place is fun and fattening.  Yes, they actually do have a grilled cheese donut for your dining pleasure.   Lots of specialty donuts.  Too bad they aren't open later in the day.  Get there early!
Place was AMAZING!!! The variety of donuts they have are so tasty & the place itself attracts you to sit & enjoy! Definitely a must go to!

This place had an assortment of different kinds of cool donuts. The interesting thing is that their hours say an opening time, but instead of a closing time it says they close whenever they sell out of product for the day. That ensures they are fresh everyday and don't sell day old donuts. It's a small shop, and can get pretty hectic when it's breakfast or lunch time, so prepare to wait in line. Donuts were very moist and full of flavor.

I like donuts and am always willing to try out different donut shops/bars, especially ones out of state. Las Vegas' Donut Bar is located in downtown, which is a bit out of the way if you stayed along The Strip. We ended up getting a Lyft there one morning for a quick bite to eat.

If you follow them on Instagram, they post their menu daily. I was really looking forward to getting the strawberry split donut, however when we arrived - they were all out. Go early so you won't be disappointed like me. We ended up getting:

Ohh My Birthday Cake Oreo ($2)
Creme Brulee ($2)
Caramel Latte ($3)
Maple Bourbon ($3)

Caramel Latte tasted a lot like coffee and we had a hard time finishing it. Same with the Maple Bourbon. Amongst the 3 of us, we demolished the smaller ones (Creme Brulee & Birthday Cake) but had to take the other two larger donuts (Caramel Latte & Maple Bourbon) back to the hotel. Their donuts are HUGE. It's kind of hard to try all the donuts unless you're with a group. I didn't really care for the Birthday Cake one. It tasted like a funfetti cake that had an oreo inside. At least it was small so we were able to finish. By the time I tried Maple Bourbon, I was already too full and on a sugar high. That was enough donuts for me.

My favorites were the Creme Brulee and Caramel Latte, mainly because I love those flavors in general. Mmmmm the Creme Brulee was delicious with its crisp outer caramelized crust and custard filling on the inside. If I had known any better, I would have ordered a dozen of these and called it a day. Next time I'm in Vegas I already know what to get & hopefully they will have my strawberry split then....
tried the one in San Diego last month, just tried this one yesterday.......soooooooooooooooooo good!!! Not as big of a menu as the one in San Diego but still super good with our fav's!!!!!

So first of I am hesitant about giving this 3 stars because it should be a 4 or 5 star with their amazing donuts. However, they are striking out with the brand of coffee they use. My double shot espresso tasted burnt and after tasting another friends coffee it is definitely the coffee bean. For me coffee is a big deal and if this place got a better coffee bean mixed with their amazing donuts this place would AMAZING!!

Overall, a decent donut shop with a friendly staff. 
Below is a breakdown of all the donuts I tried...

Strawberry Split: vegan! The fresh strawberries are a great contrast to the cream & fried donut. I wish the cream wasn't made from soy but I guess you can't be worried about GMOs at a donut shop lol

Blueberry with Meyer lemon icing: reminds me of a blueberry muffin topped with lemon frosting. Not as good as the blueberry donuts from M&M Donuts in Orange County but still good. 

Red velvet: I would have personally liked it a little softer, but overall, I can't complain. Not bad, but not anything that I'd rave about. 

Salted caramel: just really HUGE, but average tasting

Oreo birthday cake:  For your sweet tooth, this donut tastes just like the name. More like dessert than a breakfast food, but I guess that's true of most of these donuts. Props on creativity!

Crème brûlée: delicious & vegan! I just wish the hard caramel on top was a little thinner because it can overpower the yummy donut with creme filling a bit. 

Strawberry big poppa tart: A pop tart inside a donut made to look like a huge pop tart. Probably the most unique donut here. I'm not a huge fan of pop tarts but this pop tart hits the spot!

If you want to be able to choose from all of their options, I suggest coming before 10am. I came at 10:30am & they had already run out of a couple things. If you come when they are almost done, like 12:30pm, you'll only have maple bars & salted caramel donuts to choose from; however, you can buy a box full of these donuts for $10 at that time.

Do I TRULY need words when  you have PHOTOS you can see... This place is so freaking good it should not be legal.. I am not even a hug Donut fan girl but OMFG its not only delicious but they gave my children FREE Finding Nemo donuts... The ladies that helped us made sure I knew they were making made to order french toast which is warm and delicious and will be something on my top 20 for awhile... I gotta admit I was not huge into the Creme Brulee cause its crunchy and I am a fluffy soft type but the Strawberry one..SO SO SO good either way everything was delicious... service was amazing considering how busy it was on a Saturday morning... Parking is down in Fremont area so its pay to park if you wanna sit and eat but there is 15min parking you can check out if you swing around the side so look for it.. IF YOU ARE STAYING here on vacation and within a decent distant. .TRUST ME ITS WORTH IT..get there early though cause its only open till it sells out...

I woke a little early to make sure I didn't miss the infamous French toast donut and it did not disappoint.

Dropped in this morning around 9 am and ordered a variety of donuts and of course the French toast "only sold on weekends" and it was absolutely yummy!!! 

Highly recommend if you in the mood and in the area!

Good donuts, damn good donuts.  What else is there to know?  Ah... if you insist...

So I guess this place is famous.  I didn't know, I just came downtown to pay a ticket and saw a neat little sign for a donut shop.  Inside I go and I'm just blown away by the different types of donuts on display!  Homer's donut?  Matcha donut?  Nutella donut?  What!?  Which should I try?  The answer is ALL OF THEM!  Haha okay not really, but I did buy a dozen.

The french toast donut was my favorite.  I believe they make it on request because mine came out hot, and I did have to wait additional time for it.  It comes with syrup on the side as well.  My only regret is not buying two!  It was that good.  I loved Homer's donut as well.  I believe that was strawberry flavored icing on top?  It was simple, but great.  The strawberry split was SO good!  My partner loved how it wasn't too sweet, and loved having creme and strawberries in the donut.  

I didn't order the creme brulee donut this time, but I hear it's their signature donut.  Heck, they all look and taste like signature donuts!  Instead of cooking breakfast I think I'll just order a french toast donut from here instead.  It was bigger than all the donuts and very filling.  

They close when they're out of donuts and trust me, they will run out.  I recommend arriving early as there's usually no line.  Definitely a must try when you're in Las Vegas!

PROTIP:  Their menu changes DAILY!  You can also order in advance on their website only during THE DAY BEFORE!  And it has to be a dozen donuts, minimum.  I believe the deadline is 6pm, but I could be mistaken.  This saves a lot of time during busy weeks if there's a festival going on in the city.
Ok,little too much hype! I waited for a ver long time only to have a selection of two choices! Donought was good but not what I would have selected.

Best donuts in the world these are not. (Depite Donut Bar's claim). 

Saw this place in the evening after it had closed while walking near the Fremont district and made it a point to return on Saturday morning based on the excellent reviews. Ultimately was disappointed.

There were some highlights: fast service and an efficient setup to get customers in and out quickly. I always appreciate that. They also have some interesting flavors and combos. 

Lowlights: All our donuts were dry. Not being dry is the number one requirement for a good donut, and Donut bar basically failed on that one, precluding it from anything more than three stars. I also think the bacon on pastries thing has passed its prime.

Ultimately Donut Bar has decent donuts, but they were dry and I wouldn't again venture out of my way to return.

I work nearby Donut Bar & stop in to grab coffee every morning! The staff is super friendly & the donuts are AMAZING!! My favorite donut is the creme brûlée cause it's unique and I love how the shell cracks just like the desert!! Last but not least the energy & vibe is very welcoming & fun to be around! They play 80's pop radio

By far the best donuts I have ever had, I always get excited when I make the trip, the French toast donut is amazing! Do yourself a favor and just grab half a dozen atleast! I will be regular for sure

I don't get the hype over these donuts. I was so excited to try them after following them on Instagram for some many months. I went on a weekday so the French toast donut was not available. I got a dozen to try almost every flavor. I was disappointed in their popular creme Brulee donut. There was barely any filling in them. I ordered 3. Aside from the large size, there is nothing unique or worth coming back for. Although, I did enjoy the salted caramel and apple fritter.

If you're thinking of getting donuts at Krispy Kreme, don't bother, it will never be able to compete with the donuts here at donut bar. The creme brûlée is a hit that's for sure, but the Oreo birthday cake, maple bacon, and red velvet donuts are also bangin. Get there before 10am and you'll have more options as they do sell out as the day rolls by.

First time here, and it was awesome! 
I came a couple minutes after they opened and it seems they were hard at work setting everything up, the display was jaw dropping. 
I was given a first timers huge hello from the lady in front and she was super friendly
I tried the creme brûlée (was smaller than expected, but good!)
Nutella overload (somewhat dry, but just the right amount of Nutella to keep me going)
And what I thought was the best out of what I tried
Blueberry cheesecake (not expected to be my favorite) 
I'll come back and try the rest!

These donuts are literally the best in the world (or at least the best I have ever tasted by far). Specifically the creme brûlée, strawberry split, French toast and monte cristo are INSANE. I waited about an hour on a Saturday morning at 9am but it was totally worth it. They had plenty of stock on hand at 10am, not a single donut was sold out. The free angry bird donuts for the kids was a nice treat for them. 
There are so many more I want to try and I will be back soon to try more, specifically the cinnamon roll!!
We loved it here!  We had a hard time deciding on which donut we wanted.....so we had to buy a dozen variety.

What a perfect way to begin a morning, with Donuts from the Donut Bar!!  The staff is always friendly, donuts are amazingly delicious, fresh and I love the creativity in trying new combinations.  The Blue Moon is my personal favorite so far, I find myself checking Donut Bar Las Vegas on Facebook to see what tomorrows menu will be since it is always different.  Once they are gone they are gone for the day so I recommend getting here early especially on weekend's for best selection and street parking is free before 8am.  

Enjoy and Happy Yelping!
Had a great time this morning!!  The staff was really friendly and patiently waited while my wife made her selections.  Can't wait to go again!!  Made to order French toast is a must try.

Uh, since doughnuts are making a come back .. at least supersize homemade ones, reinventing the wheel on new ideas is always fun to watch. This place has huge doughnuts and lots of options to choose from.  Today's complimentary sponge bob idonut for the little ones is why I love this place and come back for more.
Very good. Didn't knock my socks off or anything, but it was good and I'd recommend it.
Long lines... it's not even a pleasant experience... get in and get out...! For a donut...??? No thanks..!

Overall: great variety, fluffy donuts, great atmosphere

This place is right by the smoothie place we went to for breakfast, so we decided to stop here for a treat after. They have a great variety of donuts and unique flavors like creme brulee. We got the blueberry lemon cake donut and the creme brulee donut. The creme brulee donut had a bruleed sugar top and a vanilla pastry cream filling. It was amazing! The donut was a perfect fluffy texture, and the filing was very creamy, and the bruleed sugar had a nice crunch. The blueberry lemon donut was great as well. I find that sometimes cake donuts can be dense, but this one was perfectly fluffy and had the perfect amount of icing on the top, so it was not overly sweet and sugary. To top it off, their bathroom has the cutest murals of Homer Simpson and his pink sprinkle donut!

Waited for 3 trips to LV till open. Had tried donuts from SD location.  
Ordered several.  Big Poppa my favorite.  French toast was surprisingly light. Great service.  Get there early.  Looked like possible to order o line and pickup better than wait.

The creme brûlée donut is pretty delicious but other than that, average donuts for outrageous prices. Definitely not the "best donuts in the world". 

Our Seattle Top Pot and Portland Voodoo Donuts cannot be beat.
Great unique donuts. Highly recommend the bagel doughnut, it was REALLY good with a cup of coffee

Place is amazing.  Let me say that donuts are my weakness!!!! So many people would be surprised to pay 3-6 bucks for a donut, but I honestly say... worth it!

I had the French toast donut!  Amazing.  Served with butter and syrup, also with a side of blue berry jelly.  I destroyed it.  I've also tried the pop tart donut, the birthday cake, Creame Brûlée, samoa, oreo, and red velvet.  All ok.  

I would say try the pop tart one, but it's share it.  It's super rich and filling.
I don't usually give 5 stars but WHAT a donut place! Great BIG donuts and nice place! Good people I give them a great chance to succeed! Eat your heart out IVY!
Absolutely perfect donuts. Owner was so kind and staff was so helpful. We went everyday we were in Vegas. Very cool establishment!!!!!!!!!!! :)

My Fiancé and I have been trying to get to this place for a while now, and today we got the chance to experience what we now think are the best donuts we have ever had. We are donut people and this place did not disappoint. We got there early, probably 5 minutes after they opened and they already had about 10 people ahead of us. The staff moved quick and were very friendly. The donuts were all fresh, and we were surprised at how big they all were. You certainly get your money's worth. I tried the French toast donut which is made to order, as well as the cake batter donut and they both were amazing! I think they both still would've been amazing even if I weren't 7 months pregnant lol. My fiancé tried the "big poppa tart" and the lemon cheesecake. He was surely satisfied! We will definitely be back!

Was here for their 'soft' opening. The staff were really friendly, however when I arrived at 10 they already ran out of all (but 1!) of their vegan donuts! I ended up getting the Spiced Chai (which I was highly skeptical about)... But it was AMAZING. I hate chai tea and cake donuts... But the vegan Spiced Chai cake donut was yummy! I spoke with the manager and they didn't realize the demand for vegan donuts out here, and will be adding more once they open. Overall, very good but you do have to get there early for the best selection. Looking forward to trying more donuts from here... And I think this will be a very good replacement (possibly better) than O Face. I miss O Face donuts, so I'm hoping to get a chance to try the rest of their vegan donut flavors in the future.

2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge - 39/100

I've been drooling over their Instagram photos for the past couple months and I finally got to try them! 

As soon as I got there, I was in donut heaven. The smells... the gigantic size donuts... my donut fantasies wanted to try them all. Especially what I saw towards the back counter, a creative concoction with bacon on it. Next time, for sure. 

I was too full from breakfast, but my main goal was to try the donut ice cream cone! It's a fantastic concept. A cone made of donut with soft serve vanilla ice cream and a choice of chocolate or caramel drizzle. Yummmm..... the only thing I would change was the amount of sugar on the outside of the cone. It was too much sugar even for me. 

I also tried a bite of their chocolate donut with chocolate frosting & sprinkles. The dough wasn't bad, I just prefer mines a little crispier? idk if that makes sense. 

Looking forward to trying the other chocolate donuts... I hope they have something that can fill the void of my favorite Mayan donut from OFace (rich chocolate donut with ganache filling :-)) 

TIPS: 
- Check their IG or FB pages for daily menu! 
- Some days it's 2 for 1 after a certain time (check IG).
- Go there early for best selection! The golden rule for all donut shops. Or place order online. 
     (I got there around 8ish on a Friday, at that time they had a good selection)
- Try the donut ice cream cone!

Came from Cali to celebrate my husband birthday and all he kept talking about was going to the donut bar. Well when get there they have a board on the wall with all the donuts for the day.(they all sound amazing) but when it was time to order my husband wanted the Homer donut and big poppa tart and our friends wanted a couple of other donuts that was on this " list " and the lady behind the counter said their all sold out and aren't making any more and it was only a hour after they opened so we found that very strange and upsetting.. they only had 7 donuts out of a whole damn list!! My husband was very disappointed. It seems like the only way you can get a donut on this so called list is being there when the works clock in for their shift in the early a.m.

Downtown Vegas. I love you and I hate you. Easy to get around for pedestrians but it's sort of like walking thru a zombie minefield of people asking for money, people talking to themselves or wondering if you're going to get mugged right around the corner. Yeah, not pretty. Perseverance is the key.

My main tip for you is Donut Bar's storefront is actually on Carson Avenue & not on 6th Street.

I planned on getting 2 donuts but everything looked so alluring I settled for 3 & dealt with the consequences later. This was my breakfast & snack for later.

Hmm. Taste was okay. For me it was very sweet but the aim to a donut's success is the texture of the dough & unfortunately all 3 of my choices were on the dry side. Maybe it was an off day? Because look at all the 4-5 Star reviews here. I am like, huh? I dunno.

Creme Brûlée Donut - Their specialty. The hard, crunchy brûlée'd exterior sticks to your teeth. The creme inside was good. 

Blueberry Cheesecake Donut-Yeast donut with comstock blueberry filling & iced cream cheese frosting was very sweet & not very cheesecake-like.

Oreo Birthday Cake Donut- Yeast donut stuffed with an Oreo cookie inside. Although the Oreo was soggy if I had to choose, I liked this donut out of my 3 picks.

I was also bummed to see they no longer had the cartons of Stump Town coffee and only a bottled version of cold brew which brought my bummer level down further.

In my eyes I prefer Mr. Donut & Donut King so for Oahuans don't fret too much if you can't get to Donut Bar on your next trip to the 9th Island. You have very good options at home.
Me & my kids love the Vegan donuts at this place!!! Best Vegan donuts in town! They have a nice lil patio area in the back that we also enjoy. Everyone is super nice & friendly.

So okay donut fans!  I didn't think I would ever break away from my 40 year DD habit, but I found something better than those "wicked donuts from DD".  I had forgotten how tasty a donut can be until I stumbled upon this place while hanging in Downtown LV.  Seriously, these guys know how make a donut explode with tastiness on your tongue.  Somehow they found a way to artistically create a culinary composition of a clever captivation that just wows your senses.  This is the kind of experience that one must repeat, and I would strongly urge you to make this a regular spot for you and yours!

Need to consider opening earlier than 7 am. I was very discouraged yelp did not have the hours posted & I drove across town and was told they were not open. I saw the donuts and employees, but didn't get to try them yet.

Is the hype real?

I'm still sitting on the fence about it, but I've been here a few times (if that says anything)! Creme Brûlée is definitely my favorite and worth coming back for. I love that they have vegan options! I've tried The Big Poppa and Strawberry Split, which are raved about via social media and they aren't bad but elaborate donuts just aren't my thing. So maybe I'm writing this review from a sort of biased stand point.

Customer service is on point! Always. Any time, any day. Chef Jeff is fantastic and I love that he is so involved! You can see him here as soon as they open and even during the last few minutes before they close. That speaks volumes to me.

The one thing holding me back from giving it a 5 star review is the texture. They are more bread-like in texture and taste vs a traditional donut. When I think of a donut, I think of an almost fluffy, light, fried piece of heaven. It's not heavy (unless it's a cake donut, which in that case.. YUM) but it's not airy either. Am I making any sense? I hope so. 

That being said, as aforementioned, I have been a repeat customer and will continue to do so in the future. I have a few more vegan ones to try. Love that their menu changes daily and that they post it on Instagram!

I wanted to give the place four stars, but the doughnut quality bordered on "day--old bread." The kids loved the decadence of it all, though. The Mexican chocolate doughnut was fantastic. The one awesome thing about the Donut Bar is the monstrous portion sizes.

Each individual donut is an edible work of art... ALMOST as good to look at as they are to eat (ALMOST)!  Fair prices, cite place, friendly welcoming staff...
It's a winner!
Not only are the donuts amazing, but the people have such a great attitude. The flavors are awesome and unique which pairs well with the cold brew they have. I had such a great time there!
Only place close in fun and deliciously creative donuts is Hurts Donuts in Springfield, MO.  Great espresso here!

AMAZING!!!!!!  Growing up in Vegas we used to stop at Winchell's on our way to school.  I tend to compare today's word of donuts to those of my bomb ass childhood.  Anyway, the cream filled chocolate bars at Donut Bar are to die for.  

They have an awesome and creative assortment of donuts so there is something for everyone.  The best part of our stop was the iced latte's.  Good Lord the coffee here is incredible!  I live way up in Summerlin but I can honestly see myself take a spin to Downtown Vegas just for some of their donuts and crazy good iced latte's.

While we felt prices were a bit steep, I guess you get what you pay for as we, Cesar Q. and I left happy and wanting more!  The staff is outgoing and quite helpful when you don't know exactly which donut to indulge in.

There is street parking right our front of the shop so it's very easy to run in and out.

Damn, as I write this review I feel the need to go NOW for my afternoon pick-me-up!

Wow....vegan donuts and the price is great. Usually the vegan donuts don't sell out, so go later and get them at half price. Creme brûlée donut had vanilla inside and a toffee crunch topping. Pb&J needs no explanation....taste like the sandwich. We'll keep coming back. Oh...great drip coffee too!

Love this place. They have THE most amazing donuts. Their staff is very friendly, and everything is reasonably priced. Get there early because they close when they are sold out of the daily batch of donuts already made. With each donut purchased, (at least for my kids) you get another free large sized donut in your box. So cool. My kids loved this place. We got the Double Chocolate Donut and the Birthday Cake Donut, pictured with this review, along with our two freebies. Oh, and they also hand out balloons for the kids!! They have some seating inside, but most is outside in the back of the bar. Such a great place. I highly recommend.
Donuts are the size of my 2 yo daughters head!! Staff is super nice and helpful! Nutella stuffed donut is delish!!
Went here for the first time. A little difficult to find but really good donuts and everyone was friendly.

This is an update from my orginal post.  This is now my second time visiting Donutbar and unfortunately it will be mt last. I totally understand the excitement about this location and how it reminds people of Voodoo Donuts from Portland but it's not the same. What makes Voodoo Donuts different from Donut Bar here in Las Vegas is that they never out.  They are continuously making their popular donuts for the people.  For example, if Donutbar knows that their French Toast donut is only sold on the weekend, then they should make enough, due to it's popularity. 
   In regards to their donuts they are super soft and fresh I truly enjoyed the split open strawberry donut because the strawberries are fresh and whipped cream is really smooth,Fresh & Light.  The strawberry cheesecake donut simply tastes like a strawberry jelly filled donut.

Used to go to O Face Doughnuts for maple bars so I thought id give this place a try. Was surprised to see the variety they had. Almost too overwhelming but I didn't let that stop me from trying a variety of things. There's maybe too many to list, but what definitely stood out was the French Toast Donut. It's only a weekend run but who really needs doughnuts 7 days a week ;) I did the FTD on a weekly routine for awhile with my bf. It came with hot Vermont maple syrup, whipped butter, and house made blueberry jam. It was usually big enough for me but he's a bigger guy and would also get the blueberry cheesecake donut which he said was the best sweet pastry hes ever had. In addition they also have homemade chocolate milk and cold brew on tap which alone is worth the trip. Awesome friendly staff and a quick in and out experience. I suggest you get here before the donuts run out

This place was ok from all the reviews I thought it would have been different and omg my 13 year old son had the bourbon donut and I know they said the alcohol is burned out but oh man this donut had my son acting and feeling weird he was not his self at all but I won't ever go back it's ok nothing to brag about

This place is wonderful. The donuts are as delicious as they are creative. I like how they change up what they offer daily, and keep some of the staples. French Toast Donuts? Creme Brûlée Donuts? Hello! 

Also, the soft-serve in a donut cone is to die for. 

The place is pretty tiny, and the line can be confusing since they have two front doors and don't specify which you should enter from to get in line. I've seen some shade thrown over people jumping ahead in line because they came in the out door. For future reference, it's the easternmost door. 

They have a good concept with keeping limited hours, and closing when they sell out. Sad when you want a donut when you're waking up at 1:00 pm after closing a restaurant the night before, but smart for them.

Interesting donuts for the adventurous donut eater in you.  The staff was attentive and they had good coffee (not Maxwell house....).  The location might be a challenge for folks on the strip but it was worth an Uber ride....

Items Sampled:
Cinnamon Roll
Blueberry Pop Tart
Blueberry Meyer Lemon Cake
Maple Bacon Bar
Vanilla Cream Bar with Chocolate Glaze
Red Velvet
Triple Chocolate
Samoa
Vanilla Glazed
Chocolate Glazed with Peanuts
Snickers - Peanuts, Chocolate, Caramel
Twix - Peanut Butter, Caramel

Fresh off an Orange County shutter reportedly due to inflated real estate rates, an import from San Diego intended to replace O-Face Doughnuts which recently closed in Downtown Las Vegas for reasons just the same, it was during the soft-opening that a stop was made at Donut Bar, the friendly manager and his team all-but giving away product - a total of three purchased by myself and a friend yielding a total order of sixteen.

Having myself already visited the San Diego location, parking a serious issue for good-yet-expensive goods that failed to wow in the same way as Sidecar, Blue Star or Stan's in LA, arrival at Donut Bar Las Vegas shows little to have changed from the space's previous occupant and although coffee has been replaced by Stumptown the prices are equally as aggressive while a general lack of seating remains.

A bit picked over at 1:45pm on Saturday, the Fritter gone but a dozen novel options including cake, raised and Specials all accounted for, service at Donut Bar takes a page from the youthful kids at O-Face and currently using a few staff from sunny SoCal to educate cashiers as well as customers the knowledgebase and readiness speak to experience and the Turn-Key location, though quality of the fried dough will certainly need some tweaks.

Taking the goods elsewhere to eat, conversation about everything from music to donuts and the local dining scene spanning across two-plus hours of small tastes, a first look at Donut Bar's raised options speaks of sharable portions that may help to soften the $3/each pricing and with a soft center somewhere between Brioche and Angelfood the texture shines in the setting of several glazes, classic candy bars no doubt playing a role in several of the variants.

Clearly needing some time to adjust to the desert with items featuring cocoa powder, both the triple chocolate and red velvet far too dry to be enjoyed, additional cake options were hit-and-miss in terms of consistency, the Blueberry Meyer Lemon unfortunately tasting as though it comes from the same mix sold for 69-cents elsewhere while the Girl scout themed Samoa was far more toothsome, perhaps as a result of coconut oil that several local Vegan bakers use to retain moistness in their cakes.

Not really shocking anyone with Maple Bacon Bars in 2016, the Vanilla Cream-filled Long John equally yawn inducing but more tasty overall, Cinnamon Rolls kept under warming lamps fail to hit the same highs as nearby Glutton or other artisans like Mothership or CRAFTKitchen despite a similar price per portion, the signature "Big Poppa" appropriately compared to "Fair Food" by a youngster joining in our tasting, the added jelly almost admitting that the Pop Tart alone is nothing but a gimmick and nowhere near the housemade quality of jams, creams and compotes made daily at O-Face.

TWO AND A HALF STARS:  Recently seeing a growth in diversity as relates to donuts, nearby Pawn Donuts and Coffee sourcing better from Donut Mania while Real Donuts on Charleston fares slightly better in texture at nearly half the price only half a mile away, one hopes that Donut Bar received a more favorable lease than that which doomed O-Face or their OC Location...or that they have some tricks besides freebies to help bolster their branding before they are too far out of the gate.

Super happy there is another vegan friendly donut place in Vegas!!! The donuts are unique, classic, and delicious. The coffee/tea is spot on and the perfect addition to your morning or afternoon pick me up. Make sure you get there early....the like to sell out fast! But, remember, they are now open late for those downtown bar goers! Enjoy!

Honestly, I don't understand the hype at all. We went with a large group and had a good selection of all donuts. They were comparable to grocery store donuts. The more simple donuts were dry and almost seemed stale, and the creative flavors were pretty gaggy. The saving grace was the cold brew iced coffee, that was very good. Unfortunately we were going for the donuts not the coffee. Not impressed!

This place exceeds expectations, the customer service is phenomenal and the donuts were HUGE!! I tried the delicious raspberry iced with pistachio nuts, it looked fake, like a Homer Simpson donut, but the taste was as far from 'fake' as you can imagine! It was moist, sweet (not overly sweet) and melted in my mouth. I know this place is very popular and sells out quickly, so thankful I got to try one!!

You can definitely taste the QUALITY within these donuts. They are more than just good...they bring magic and sparkle to your life. The selection they have is just amazing. Yesterday was my 1st visit to the location. I tried the following donuts: blueberry cheesecake, Homer's donut, and Boston creme. Let me tell you...this place will over exceed your expectations! 

I WILL BE BACK...very soon!

A friendly donut shop with flavorful selections. Their donuts are thicker than something most would got from Dunkin Donuts or 7/11. Donuts range from $1 upwards to $5. It's a cozy little bar with stylish furniture. I recommend those visiting here to try this place out for breakfast, just expect nothing but donuts and coffee/alcohol.

Donuts taste fresh and the flavor choices were unique. Bought a dozen on my way out of Vegas to bring home to my kids. We all enjoyed sampling the various flavors. They especially enjoyed the Harry Potter butter beer donut :) i'll definitely be back the next time I'm in town.

Accidentally stopped in. Saturday morning after a 3 mile walk to mail 2 post cards at the USPS across the street to no avail,    Ugh...... Low and behold........ a "Donut Bar" across the street. 

And many folks know me and donuts. 

Well, even though I have 4 donuts waiting for me back at the hotel (which I have to walk back to), I figured.. What the heck. 

What discipline. After serious consideration, talking to other patrons and using the boys room.... I settled on 1 donut. It was the cream brûlée. $2

Was it worth it?  Yes. Yes it was. 

Now to roll back south. 

Happy eats. 

BTW, the other donuts I have waiting are from a very early run to Pink Box Donuts. Pretty darn good there too and at reasonable cost. I guess this is what helped me stop at 1 donut at Donut Bar. 

A wise choice. Go with the Brûlée.

Get here early if you have a specific donut you want. We got here around 10:30 and they were down to one vegan kind left and only a handful of regular flavors. We got the salted caramel and cake batter. You can't go wrong!

I went to the soft opening and it surely pays not to have a salty attitude because we got great service and a free doughnut! Sweeeet! I've been waiting for this place to open for quite some time now. I've been stalking them on social media and you have to pay attention so you don't miss out - you snooze, you lose!

I got a few doughnuts: Caramelized Pineapple, Caramel Latte, Red Velvet, Big Poppa Tart, Samoa, Homer, Apple Fritter, Mexican Hot Chocolate, Nutella, Maple Bacon, Banana Caramel, and Cinnamon Sugar. They're most famous for Homer, Big Poppa Tart, Strawberry Split, and doughnut ice cream cones. I would have to try the Strawberry Split, Creme Brûlée, and doughnut ice cream come at a later date as they weren't available/ran out. 

But what I like the most from the ones I did get include Caramelized Pineapple, Mexican Hot Chocolate (sweet, cinnamony...then a spicy note. Yum!), Banana Caramel...Nutella was ok.

They have Stumptown coffee, puppy treats, and milk. My pup, Ralf absolutely loved the puppy cookies I got him. 

Welcome to Vegas!

You have to see these donuts to believe them. On top of the sheer size of some of them, the selection is awesome and they taste incredible. So worth the visit. Don't get there late. You'll miss out and you'll regret it.
Never a bad experience here! Love this place because of their mind blowing donuts!! I definitely recommend going right before they open because they do sell out pretty fast!

The hype is not real unfortunately. To each their own I guess, but I was only impressed with a few of their donuts. The pop tart ones are good. Strawberry being the best by far. The blueberry was ok and the smores one was WAY too sweet, like eat one bite and get diabetes sweet.
Creme Brule is a good idea but that sugar coat on top makes for difficult chewing. 
Their apple fritter was actually pretty bad. I took a bite and threw it away, had a burnt quality to it.
Personally, I enjoy donuts with a glaze AND something on top or filled. Most of these are plain donuts with something on top. 
I wanted to love this place. I was there at their grand opening and even met the owner. But I couldn't love it, only like certain things.
That being said, their french toast donut is amazing as well as their churro donut ice cream cone. Both of those things along with their strawberry pop tart are worth it.
These donuts saved me. I once was lost, but now I'm found. I once was blind, but now I see. Thanks do the Donut Bar, my chains are gone and I've been set free.
The Best Donuts, I have ever tasted! They are so light and fluffy, just goodness. Only bummer was the ice cream machine was down, we wasn't able to try, the donut cone. Overall, loved this place!

I never got to try the donuts because the manager at this establishment was very rude.  We were so excited to try these donuts so we showed up at 7 am on Sunday morning because when we called the day before the employee told us that we could preorder and pick up at 7 am.  However, we decided to just to go right when they open.  So once we got there we were greeted rudely by the manager telling us we weren't allowed in to buy any donuts since they don't open until 8 am.  We then decided to call to make an order on the phone which the employee told us that we could pick it up right away even though they haven't opened.  So we decided to place the order and were so excited waiting outside for our donuts: however, we waited for 40 mins and no one came out.  We decided to give them a call back and the employee stated that the manager wouldn't allow him to sell us the donuts at that point we were fed up and decided to leave because they were rude and unprofessional.  They should have given us a call back instead of making us wait for 40 mins.  Now I will never go back to an establishment that has bad customer service even if they are rated highly.

Thus far every time we've gone to Donut Bar, we've pre ordered the night before in order to get the donuts we want. I love the Crème Brule donut! My husband is a fan of the Butter Beer Donut and anything Chocolate. We tried a couple new ones this time and they weren't that great...i.e. The Apple Fritter (not Apple-y enough), Pumpkin with filling. I thought the Strawberry Split was fabulous though and would certainly get it again.
We do the free coffee with Yelp check in each time and we've never liked the coffee.
Whether you are a fan of fluffy donuts or cake donuts I'm sure you'll find something to make you go mmmm!

Greeted when entering the shop in a very friendly way and it was packed with customers! Really cute and clean! A $1.50 for an above average glazed donut is awesome! $1.50 for a SHARABLE glazed donut is even more awesome! Will be back the next time we're in town!

Homer Simpson has die and gone to Heaven!  Man the best donuts in Las Vegas, in the world!  I had the maple and Bacon bar, I just couldn't have one I had to have three and a cup of hot coffee.   

The best thing to do, first thing in the morning it to stop the Donut Bar and put up a cake donut and hot cup of coffee.. You want to be a hero at your job, pick up a dozen on the way to work and bam your staff will love you......

Great Donuts....  Las Vegas Best hidden secret.....
Tasted like a regular donut place. I prefer krispy kreme than this place. The donuts here are unique, but their donut bread was dry.

To be honest, I have had wayyyyyy better donuts.  Although the donuts here are cute, they are also on the dry side.  Wish I had a picture, but I'll my pics got deleted on my old phone.  If you decide to get a donut here, I would say the maple bacon is my favorite.

I woke up this morning... 7 AM... because I was going to go try The Donut Bar. There was so much hype about this place from USA today to the food network to Ellen. I was energized and ready to go!
I got there at 7:50 in the morning and it was easy to find parking. There was already a line of at least 40 people ahead of me who were also waiting for a shop that was about to open at 8 AM. The wait time to get in once the shop opens at 8 AM was 30 minutes in line outside. Luckily, it was a pleasant day. 
As I approached the inside of the store, I was surprised to see that I wasn't all that excited. I saw many very large looking donuts with hard tacky frosting that weren't at all appealing. The oversized amount made them less appealing rather than to appear yummy. The smaller donuts looked good and, by smaller, I mean normal size like Dunkin' Donuts regular donuts. 
The service was just OK. Whoever chose to run this place really doesn't seem to understand what the best environment for customer service is. It was glaring super loud music over the speakers where I could barely hear the person helping me and I'm not sure if they could hear me. I had to order several donuts for a party and thought this is a good place to try because it gets so much publicity so it has to be good. I decided to put my instincts aside because so many people were waiting in front of me and behind me to get into this place and it has gotten all these reviews.
As I ordered, after two dozen donuts, the server just went off to help somebody else without even asking me if I was finished with my order. I couldn't believe it! I was very friendly during the whole interaction which is why this shocked me. I did not bother calling her back because I am not confrontational and simply will let something like this go, but won't let it go during a review. 
The donuts range from two dollars that are very small to some pastries that are upwards of four dollars. I ordered several donuts including the Twix, Samoa, blueberry with lemon, chai, Nutella, Red velvet, and the crème brûlée. Here is what I have to say: firstly, you have to eat these donuts the day of because they are not as good the next day. With that being said, most of the donuts were not that impressive to begin with. They were just ok or disappointing. In fact, the crème brûlée donut, which gets all of this amazing hype, was one of the worst ones of the bunch. The hard sugar/Caramel crust on top of the donut was so burnt that it carried a foul aftertaste. The donut itself had a yummy crème brûlée center within the dough. The topping of the crunchy burnt sugar/Caramel ruined it. I also did not like that many of the donuts were grossly over sized with a great deal of tacky frosting on it which was glazed and dried off. I did order a couple of those and they were not very good.
This place is OK. I did not try the coffee and I wonder if that would've changed my mind and increased their ratings. The donuts are so so. They aren't that much better than other places or don't cost a lot less so I do not know what people are talking about. Also, the wait time and price just isn't worth it. It is a very popular place and a lot of people come here. Not sure if there are people that love donuts so much that this is considered great quality??? I love food and have been very fortunate to taste some phenomenal food internationally at some of the best places. I know donuts and sadly, the donut bar does not have anywhere close to the best donuts around. The two stars are because it is expensive, the service was disappointing, the wait time to get the donuts was way too long for this,and the donuts did not impress. I am glad I tried it just take the hype away and I should have gone with my instincts.

Yum, yum, yum! Never have I been so excited to eat a donut! 

I parked at the meters on 6th street and the walk was not bad at all. You just turn the corner and all the donuts are staring at you. You walk right in and the prices of the donuts are to your immediate right. They may have different donuts depending on the season, but majority of them are the same. They're all very delicious though! 

I just got a variety of donuts, choosing the ones that looked good. You NEED to get the Birthday Cake donut with an surprise Oreo inside. I was so excited for it. I heard a lot of hype for the creme brûlée donut because of that *crack* when you break it... I tried doing that while recording it... fail. LOL. It's harder than it looks, literally. And I wasn't a big fan of the taste of it. So I went back to enjoying my birthday cake donut. YUM. 

Come early because I've heard that donuts sell out quick and once they're gone, Donut Bar closes. Enjoy!
This place has the best donuts by far. My favorite is the "Brad". It's an apple fritter drizzled with maple frosting and topped with bacon.
Im the mánager from bomb tacos at durango.. but when í visit bomb tacos at carson í need to eat donuts from here!! Omg! Amazing!

Oh my gosh.  The donuts are the best here. I didn't go but my husband did. Said the people that work there are friendly and helpful. Huge donuts , fresh made daily. If you are downtown run don't walk go get you some donuts!  They also make the pink Simpsons donut there!
THE BEST HANDS DOWN. I have tried fractured prune... it's koo. But no shop I have ever been to in my whole life is better than DONUT BAR! Donut mania is good too. But something about DONUT BAR ?

Finally made it here after several attempts. Always too early on the weekend, so we hit other donut shops that open early mornings on weekends we are up and about with sunrise. This place opens 9 am on weekends!

So the donuts look appealing, several large donuts, glazed, chocolate, Nutella. These are twice the size of regular donuts. Today, the large glazed was a little under cooked for me. It was doughy, when pulling apart, the pieces could be rolled into an almost raw like consistency. I don't care for that. 

The old fashion was too dried out, dry and stale. They pulled it from a large tray but I don't know how long they where sitting out, but just to dry for me. 

Got two of the cream brûlée, good donut with hard glaze on top stuffed with cream filling. Tasted like vanilla pudding instead of real cream. Not bad for what it was. 

Next thing that we tried was the Boston cream bars. They where good, love the chocolate glaze, again the vanilla pudding cream taste and not truly the real cream flavor. 

I am not thinking it was a great choice today. Not completely opposed to trying again, but was not terribly impressed.

They stayed open into late afternoon for Life Is Beautiful so I was finally able to try these gems on our way into the festival! We tried Butter Beer donut first, which was delightful, but the crown jewel was the strawberry Big Poppa Tart with a full size Pop-Tart baked right in the middle. This donut was DELICIOUS, with what tasted like strawberry jam oozing everywhere. Nicely done, Donut Bar!

I'm not the type of pig that actively seeks out for Donuts in the morning (see what I did there?) but I enjoy it once in awhile...while they have great concepts and crazy creative donuts and items the excution of the finished product could be better as it let it dry. If Yelp had half star ratings this would be a 3.5/5....

I got the:

Creme Brulee Donut: I guess all big foodies have heard of this minus me...but my friends showed me the video of it. Like I said, concept is cool but execution was ehhhh...

Birthday Cake w/ Oreo: So it was a birthday cake inspired donut with an oreo in the inside...but again concept is cool but execution was ehhh....

Maple Bacon: I guess this was my favorite one out of all of them just cause they actually executed this fairly comparable to a lot of other Maple Bacon donuts...

I just felt that a lot of their donuts were dry compared to the place they replaced (O Face Donuts).

I came to Vegas before I'm the weekend and kept missing out because they were sold out before noon each day. I tried the chocolate Twix donut. Thumbs up.  I tried the strawberry cheese cake- that one was amazing!. Everything looked awesome. You will not be disappointed.

We finally made it to DB before they sold out and closed! 

I've been able to taste their delicious donuts at a Yelp Elite event, but never got to be in their store!

We made it in for "happy hour", meaning we were about to get the last of the day's donuts. We ended up with creme brûlée, cheesecake, apple fritter, blueberry Meyer lemon, strawberry shortcake, and chai. Creme brûlée was my favorite! The crackle of sugar on the top and filling was just like a creme brûlée dessert! 

I probably would've given DB a 5 had I had a fresh batch of donuts, and since we live so far south I'm sad we haven't been able to do that yet!
Wow wow wow there doughnuts are amazing delicious and there coffee is delicious also they have a cute patio are we're you can chill and have you coffee and donuts love this place.

If you love donuts, you should stop by the Donut Bar. They are friendly and they have an amazing selection of delicious, fresh donuts. They do sell out everyday so get up there before the donuts are gone! You'll be so happy you did.
Horrible. No variety. Dry. Burnt. No flavor. Not sweet enough. Expensive. And in the worst city in the world.

If there was an option to put more than five stars, I would. Got a baker's dozen donuts which was more than enough. I am not a fan of the designer donuts trend... but this place blows Pinkbox and O Face out of the water. We tried all the 'fun varieties' including the delicious and decadent S'mores pop tart donut. My colleague loved the vegan creme brûlée one the best even not as a vegan. I loved the maple bourbon and the caramel latte one the best. Absolutely delicious and welcome to Vegas. 

PS if you buy twelve they give you a free donut!

The Donut Bar was not something we had planned to visit, especially given the time of day but we decided to get some coffee and a donut.  Glad we did!  We got the donut stuffed with oreo and it was DELISH! Not only was it the right size and not too much donut, it paired very well with the coffee.  

My husband had a donut left the next day and he said the other donut wasn't as good the second day, but i think fresh is best earlier in the day - especially when there is a lot more variety.  Location is a bit small but its not like you sit and eat donuts at dunkin donuts, we take them to go.  I hope to try some other donuts next time we're in Vegas.

Their coffee was good and their simple creme brûlée donut @ $2 was a decent introduction to this place.

I walked in on a Saturday morning to find the place alive and buzzing with several excited families seeking donuts for breakfast.  Their regular donut options seemed overwhelmingly huge for $5/piece so when I asked them for their smallest donut they pointed me over to the creme brûlée near the end.  

Americano took a few mins but was delicious and complex.  The creme brûlée was yummy with a sugar topping that shatters when you bite into it and that custard that's to die for.

Worth the random wander off the downtown area but others may find the area too quiet for their own comfort on an early Saturday morning in Feb.

Bonus: the driverless shuttle they are piloting has the Donut Bar as a stop!
I got the creme brûlée. It tastes a little strange. The hard topping on the donut was tasty, but the inside custard like filling was strange. It kind of tastes like play-dough.

So glad I came here for breakfast even though it was out of the way for us. All the donuts are so cheap and massive compared to what we buy in LA. I loved all the novelty choices like banana caramel, creme brûlée, Nutella, etc and wanted to order more but ordered just enough for breakfast.

The Stumptown iced coffee at around $4.50 was delicious as always and seems to be in every store I visit!
Coming here again for some AMAZING Donuts!!

You bad dirty donut bar, you had me with your ginormous big poppa filled strawberry tart and cake batter donut not to mention your filthy minds when you created the birthday filled oreo donut concoction you guys need a spanking because these donuts are banging baby!  LOLZ their nutella  filled donut and triple choc threat definitely has a home in my belly too bwahah.  Thanks to UberEats you dropped by right before closing at noon Yas that hanger life!  #thebestdonutsintheworld it must be because it's on the box lmfaoooo!

Sister shop to the one in SD! Came close to closing so they had a BOGO special! Humongous donuts that are bigger than your face! We bought 4 that were a dollar each! Flavors change daily! Hope this place succeeds
Super cute space and amazing doughnuts!!! A must when in Vegas. The staple is the creme brûlée and it is definitely a must have. Two thumbs up for this donut bar.

HUGE donuts. Picked up a big poppa tart doughnut filled with a strawberry pop tart and jelly filling. It was big enough to split in half and share with another person. Also tried the creme brulee donut which was delicious, and got a free birthday cake doughnut because it was chef Jeff's birthday which was pretty good. Tried the cold brew which tasted just as good as  Starbucks. I also enjoyed a chocolate milk from the tap, it was good but nothing too special as far as chocolate milk goes. I will cone back to try some more doughnuts from their long menu.

Don't even ask me.how many times I've been here.

Okay. Just 3 times. 

The creme.brulee is a vegan donut that has a candy like carmelized consistency on top of it with a vegan made custard in that sucker. It's my fave out of all the donuts! For some reason when I bite into it-it reminds me of a Filipino dessert. Sometimes the top may taste a bit burnt minus it actually being burnt. You'll know what I mean when you try it. 

Weekends they give away free themed donuts to the kiddos. Nothing like seeing your 3 year old elated to bite into an angry bird, minion, or even an avenger. But nothing like imagining a parents face knowing your child is about to bite into his last chunk of sugar for the month. Lol.

I'm afraid to admit I've tried a lot of the stuff they have to offer and overall, think they're all right. Nothing worth setting your alarm to, although, coming in early would be ideal because duh...the fresher the better. Everyone knows going to any kind of bakery towards closing won't get the best bite. 

The big poppa tart donut they're raved about or known for is all right...says the person who can tolerate only so little sugar in one sitting. The one I've had was actually dry. =/ 

Overall, I'd still pop in on a Saturday morning with the fam...take our our donuts then walk over to the container park where the kids can release the sugar they just swallowed. Makes for a nice morning with the fam. It's worth giving it a try. I prefer this spot over Pink Box for sure...mainly because of their vegan.

I dont think theyre one of those must cross the desert for. If you happen to be by and feel like a donut, then definitely give them a try. But if youre coming without a donut craving at all, then more than likely you'll find them to be all right and overhyped.

Long lines some mornings. I'd skip bringing the stroller in if possible. But if you must...then you must...especially if you're in then out. Their strawberry milk on tap was pretty deelish too!

And something I've learned...these donuts have beers out there that pair really well together. Mind blown.

The Las Vegas Donut Bar is one of the best donut places anywhere. It offers both classic and creative donut creations and the bonus is the friendly service. I will definitely come back when I am in Vegas! #deadliftsanddonuts
Unbelievably delicious and unique. I've been to VooDoo donut and this place tops it in deliciousness. Not only that, but the staff and owner were so friendly and welcoming!!
I have made every attempt to come here for either donuts or there churro cone ice cream and each time they are either closed or they ran out. I'm done trying.

If you've ever thought that strawberry shortcake wasn't an appropriate breakfast food, but wanted to do it anyways, get the strawberry split. This was by far my favorite of the donuts. The cream brûlée was a close second. The glazed sugar on top gives a perfectly satisfactory crack when hit and/or when bitten into and the filling was delicious. 

We purposefully visited on the weekend for the expanded menu and, of the specials, chose the French toast donut which did not disappoint. We'll try the grilled cheese on a later visit. I suggest you do the same. (Or take enough people that you can order all the donuts and do a sampling.) 

The staff was very friendly and the donuts, yummy! 

They are open until they sell out, so get there early.

Even though Donut Bar is brand new to the Las Vegas area, I've been twice already Haha. They are killing it! I've heard people say it is the old location of O-face donuts? Not positive about this because I never went to O-face. Anyways the original location of Donut Bar is from San Diego, really glad they brought  it to downtown Las Vegas. 

 I have to say I was pretty impressed, they had Stumptown coffee! I am a bit of a coffee snob and Stumptown coffee has got to be my favorite. They serve Stumptown at the famous Voodoo Doughnuts in Seattle/Portland area to give you a better idea of how serious this coffee is. The outdoor patio seating behind Donut bar is also on point! Very spacious and surrounded by artwork. However, the customer service was a bit lacking to me. I felt pretty rushed to order by the girl behind the counter. She almost seemed annoyed that we didn't automatically know what we wanted to order. 

Pros: vegan options, outdoor patio seating, Stumptown coffee, cool bathroom decor, amazing coffee selection (nitro cold brew coffee on tap), location 

Cons: Small space (wouldn't like dining inside), really loud music for early morning, close at 1 pm or until all sold out, have to pay for parking (only a $1 but still), customer service 

Vegan donuts you must try: Banana Caramel, Strawberry split, Creme Brule  

Tip** for every dozen donuts you buy, you get 1 free.  

All in all, pretty cool addition to the downtown Las Vegas area. Definitely recommend people to go check out this mouth watering new donut shop!
Thank you yelp for helping me find this gem! Every donut was delicious!! Best I've ever had! Please open one in San Francisco!
Oh my gosh, these donuts are to die for!!! Stopped in on my walk thru downtown. Great concept, gourmet donuts with a awesome atmosphere. Try the soma donut, can't go wrong any of their donuts.

I shouldn't have stopped by when they were closing because the donuts were buy 1 get 1 free. I ended up leaving with way too many donuts. The strawberry cheesecake and vanilla bean are my favorites. The staff are always nice, I will be back when I'm in the area again.

This place is a hidden gem!  The donuts are amazing and so creative.  It's the perfect spot for a quick breakfast, and afternoon snack!  Get there early because once they Sold out they are closed for the day.  Dont miss out! We will be back every year we come to Vegas.

I don't understand the hype. They taste mediocre at best.  Super bready, if you've ever been to NYC and had Dough Donuts they're reminiscent of those, but still not as good. Dough has a good balance of fluffy, bready and chewy, these are just bready. TBH they kinda taste grocery store esque with more unique flavors (not that grocery store donuts are all that bad...just "standard") I've tried a lot of donuts ever since moving to Las Vegas and so far these have been at the bottom of the list...I'd rather wait for the red sign to go on at Krispy Kreme. Again they're not bad, they're cute but not up to the hype that people have been reviewing or talking about. Is it bc they're downtown in the "cool hipster area?" I say hit up Glaze at S. Fort Apache in SW

These are donuts!

OMG. Get the pop tart donut - strawberry was my fave pick out of a dozen we sampled. Staff was super friendly - we even got to meet the owner and Chef Jeff.

All donut places should be like Donut Bar.

Just a fun place to visit. Really enjoyed the art in the bathroom. They are so friendly and have great donuts. The milk on tap is pretty cool. Would recommend the French toast donut. They are very kid friendly as well. My son loved his Captain America donut. 

5/5 would recommend.

You must try place if you are staying in the down town area. There donuts are huge so it will keep you super full until lunch. You can refill your coffee for free which is always a plus. We eat our donut in their outside seating area, which was quiet and had a lot of shade.
Love these donuts and I dont even eat donuts often, but if I do I come here! You gotta get there early though before all the good ones run out!

5:5 for the customer service!!! Everyone was smiling and helpful and dressed in Halloween costumes. They gave my 4 year old a free mummy donut which stained his entire face black, lol. But it made his day anyway. 
The donuts- I went with the intention to try the French toast and creme brûlée, I ended up buy the French toast, blueberry lemon, apple fritter pumpkin filled. By far the best was the French toast. It was actually pumpkin French toast. I would make the 30 minute drive just for that donut, but the rest were a little too sweet for me. I still would recommend this place bc of how unique the donuts are and the awesome customer service.

Terrible experience!
My fiancé and I are getting married in exactly 2 weeks and wanted to have Donut Bar cater a section with donuts in Las Vegas. She had emailed them in the beginning of the year and didn't get a response. I had to stop there when I was in Las Vegas to personally get information about what we wanted. They took my information and then I followed up with them to get the figures. After getting that squared away I was told to get them paid for about 2-3 weeks prior to the event. I emailed them to have someone call me to take payment, no response, then called today to give them my card and the person on the phone was authorized to do so and he person that was wasn't available for about 3 hours. I left my name and number for them to call me back and never did. By far the worst customer service I've seen in a while when a person is trying to "give" you money. I wouldn't recommend using Donut Bar to cater any event in fear of them not getting back to you when time is of the essence.

OMG! This place is awesome! The staff was knowledgeable and friendly the product (donuts) were two die for! Made with love! The manager was very friendly and his brother looks just like him. Blessed family. Can't wait to visit again I think my next victim will be Lemon cheesecake and Creme Brulee. Delicious gang! Left with a full tummy and a big smile

So, with this place receiving so much fanfare I had to stop in and see what all the fuss was about. I arrived when almost all the donuts were gone but still managed to score a dozen with the help of my good friend. We walked right in and were greeted by the friendly and fun staff. We viewed the menu for the day and could not believe the variety of donuts. There were at least  20+ flavors to choose from and this included vegan choices which I can totally get behind. These aren't just donuts, some were like mini cakes and were almost big enough to cover your whole face (No Joke)!  I had never seen such large donuts before and could not believe how creative these people are with the large variety of choices. We managed to score some delicious options, such as the Strawberry Split, Mexican Hot Chocolate, Blood Orange, Boston Creme, The Oreo Donut (with an Oreo inside) and a couple of creme brûlée'. My favorite donut from this batch was the Boston Creme. The creme oozes with flavor and tasted heavenly. The donut itself was moist and fresh. The creme was so rich that I found it a little overwhelming to eat in one sitting so I ate half the first day and finished it off the second day. Yeah, it was rough....

 The Strawberry Split was layered with fresh strawberries and whipped creme in the middle of a large sugar donut. A different take on the strawberry short cake and perhaps a step up. I almost added a small drizzle of chocolate since I had it for dessert that night. I shared the other donuts with my staff and family and they were all very complimentary.  My daughter really liked the Oreo Donut and was surprised when she found the cookie in the middle. The service was outstanding and so friendly. The shop is quaint and very clean with not a whole lot of room and it makes this place nice and cozy. They also have a new t- shirt for advertising that is available for purchase. It has a great color scheme and it gives a shout out to our city! I can hardly wait to go back early in the morning when the donuts are fresh out of the fryer. I think I can hear a Homer donut calling my name.

This. Place. Is. Amazing.

I have been to the Donut Bar in SD, and I think I like this one more! Chocolate and strawberry milk on tap... But beware, it can be loud.

The staff here are all very helpful! It is a quick-service type place, with lines usually out the door (although TOTALLY worth the wait!). My recommendations are; blood orange, Creme brûlée, birthday cake, caramelized pineapple, and Oreo. I haven't tried the French toast yet (but fully intend to), and I hear they now have Blue Moon as well, which is also on my donut list.

Word of warning: Get there early! Because once they sell out, they close up. No matter the time!

We were looking for a donuts on our way out of Las Vegas.  After looking at the pictures we deciding to go here.   

The donuts look wonderful, but unfortunately that is where it ends.  The flavor was not matching what I was expecting.   I got two donuts but they were just sub par.  I had better in regular grocery store. It was a disappointment.

Best freaking donuts I've ever had!!!! No joke! Got the Homer, it was huge and delicious like the ones at universal studios. The peanut butter cup was the best out of the three, it was a dense yet moist cake donut with peanut butter cups on top, it was perfection . Last but not least the creme brûlée donut that was super fun to crack and the combination of the hard sugar on top and a creamy filling was heavenly. The donutquarium made my entire life I live in summerlin but will drive all the way downtown to get these again for sure!!!!!

Hello, My name is Scott Bianchi, and I have a donut problem. 

     I'm a huge fan of the Donut Bar in San Diego. They have great donuts, they have great people. It's a good place. When I heard they were opening a store in Las Vegas, I was jealous of Las Vegas. They're supposed to open a store in Santa Clarita. However, when I suddenly planned a trip out to Las Vegas, I knew a stop here was primary on my list.
     Saturday morning I woke up early. Having been to the San Diego location, I know there's a line a block and a half long Saturday mornings.  However, when my WAZE lady told me I had arrived at the Las Vegas store, there was no huge line. There wasn't even people out the door. It seemed fairly quiet. There was also a parking issue. 
     The lot directly across the street has signage all over it saying 'permit required' and 'we will tow your car' so when I parked in it initially, I was a bit concerned for my ride. I poked my head in the door of the Donut shop, and asked about it. The nice guy behind the counter said that the lot didn't belong to them, but there was free parking on sixth street on the weekend. So I ran back out, and relocated my car to the warm and fuzzy, safe free parking area just down the street. I then returned, knowing that I could sit for a lil while and have my ride be there when I left.
     I entered the shop, and the familiar donuts smiled up at me from their case. They were holiday decorated even. I walked down the case and picked out four donuts.  I was going to stop at three, but then the rudolph donut just had to go along too. So, I paid for the four donuts (ended up at about twenty dollars) I then sat down to admire the donuts, and the fish tank from the fish tank tv show when I heard somebody order a french toast donut.
    "French toast donut?" I asked, still composing my yelp photo.
    "Yes, we have them on Saturdays and Sundays..."
    "I loooove the french toast donuts. I want one."
    "Excellent!"
   I paid for a french toast donut, and sadly put the lid back onto the box of donuts I had. I sipped on the juice I had also paid for. After a lil while, another donut box was brought out. This one had a plate and containers inside. Atop the plate was a french toast donut. In the containers were toppings. One had maple butter, one had jam, and the third had maple syrup. 
     I've never been a syrup kinda guy, so I put that one aside. The butter I smeared on top of the donut, and the jam I also used. There was also a plastic fork and knife wrapped up in a napkin. I used them to surgically cut apart my breakfast and enjoy it as long as I could. It was good. After this french toast donut, I was actually pretty full. So I thanked the store for their tasty treats, and walked back to my car.
     
    It turns out they're a just block away from old Fremont street. So knowing my car was in a safe spot, I spent several hours wandering the area. Lots of very neat things to see right around here. Including 'old' Las Vegas, and container park with their colossal mantis. (Just in case you're looking for things to do around here)

   The four donuts actually went home with me. They were still tasty and fresh when I got home the following day.

Tasty donuts! So many flavors it was hard to pick. The donuts are giant! Reasonable priced at $3/donut. We ended up with one red velvet, chai, strawberry cheesecake, and creme brûlée. So good! I also got a creamy chai latte made almond milk, yes they have ALMOND milk, and stumptown coffee! They also have coffee brew on tap and I'm pretty sure they serve alcohol. They also have the option of putting frozen yogurt on your donuts. Wow! Try it! 

Uber Eats delivers from there and they have been featured on many food websites such as Food Network, Thrillist, and Forbes Magazine. Eat up!
Loved it! So much variety and a great venue just off the beaten path. The maple bacon was amazing!
I had the creme brûlée donut as well as few others! Great coffee and amazing donuts. I especially loved the caramelized sugar on top for the perfect crunch! Amazing donuts!

Very good, quality doughnuts and friendly, patient staff while you decide on the numerous options. I really enjoyed their strawberry split. I went on an early morning Saturday about ten mins before opening and of course there is already a line forming! I've also had their blood orange at First Fridays which was yummy too!

Before I go or I get out of court I am tempted to stop at the donut bar and choose some of their delicious donuts and a nitro iced coffee.  Great spin on traditional old fashions, fritters and bismarks with creative pastry creations which are mouth watering and delicious.  Lattes and other expresso drinks as well.  Usually parking is available and friendly service.  Not cheap but worth every penny.  Good after an all nighter.

Awesome donuts, more expensive than the Krispy Kreme and Dunkins of the world for obvious reasons. Don't go expecting a dozen for 10 bucks, but go expecting some awesome donuts in flavors you never thought of.
Who doesn't love a great donut! I couldn't decide so I got the Homer and the Creme Brûlée and both are delicious. I love fresh and soft and they are both.

We went and ordered strawberry cream donut and maple bar.  My daughters were in absolute delight.  They loved the strawberry and cream.  My husband loved the maple bar.  The owners are extremely nice and pleasant.  The place is clean and inviting.  Long line but they move very quickly.  This vegan will definitely be back!!!

I ran my first 5K this morning!  Just kidding...I'm on my third donut.  

Went on Sunday 5-1-16 at 11:30AM to grab some donuts.  I ordered four donuts.  Don't judge me.  For $16 we got four donuts and two drip coffees.  

$4.00 "big poppa tart" is a ginormous donut which looks like a poptart on the top.  You need a fork and knife for this!  It's kinda greasy but fluffy and filled with a generic cheap-tasting  jam.  

$3.00 "DB's nutella donut" is a standard donut with chocolate on top and what I think was crushed nuts.  It was fluffy, huge, and nicely yeasty.  It didn't taste much like Nutella to me. 

$4.00 "strawberry split" is a huge donut dusted in sugar, split down the middle, and filled with cream and fresh strawberries.  The donut itself was kinda boring but the strawberries were ripe and juicy.  The cream they use is the super-white kind that never melts....kinda like the type they use on the desserts at Golden Corral.  It doesn't taste good and I'm sure it's not good for you.  I'd pass on this one next time, even though it's very pretty.  

$3.00 "Pb & J" is a vegan jelly-filled donut with peanut butter glaze on top.  My husband really liked this one.  

They gave my son a free donut...it was a round one with a red face on it...maybe it's a character from a cartoon or something?  I'm not sure cuz' my son is two and hasn't started watching TV yet.  It was a very nice gesture on their part!

We both got drip coffees which were actually good but they only had regular sugar, sugar in the raw, and stevia.  Gimme some splenda or nutrasweet, ya hippies!!!  Let me kill myself slowly with artificial sweeteners.  

Usually donuts give me heartburn but I felt fine all day after gorging myself on these donuts.  I'll be back to try the creme brulee donut!  This place will definitely do well because they are catering to the hipster vegans and they have unique donuts. 

I had a lot of leftovers since the donuts are so big but they ended up in the trash...which means they weren't very good because I will gladly eat a krispy kreme donut that is 4 days old that i found on the ground somewhere.

Fantastic Spot for Premium Donuts

When I heard San Diego's Donut Bar set up a location in Vegas, I just had to have it again. In SD, I had the Strawberry Split (an unforgettable fruity donut stuffed with whipped cream, $4) and I was pleased to see it again here in Vegas. But on this trip I had to try something new.

On this Saturday morning we got there pretty late, around 10:30am, and it seemed like a lot had already been sold.  Of what remained, I had two donuts: Creme Brûlée ($2) & the Twix donut ($2).

I gotta say, both Donuts were unlike anything I've ever had before. The brûlée had a sweet sticky crunch layer of molten sugar and filled on the inside with sweet cream. I knew going into the Twix I would be smacked with an explosion of chocolate and it did not disappoint - Twix bar crumbs covered the top layer of thick chocolate dressing on chocolate dough.  Amazing!

For your coffee craving, there're several options to choose: espresso, mocha, chai latte, drip, etc.  I had the Americano - a super smooth black coffee.

Plans for my next visit, try two new donuts, try the drip coffee, and ARRIVE EARLY!!!

Pretty sure this donut changed my life - for the much better. I LOVE these - Mexican hot chocolate is my favorite, I don't know why it's better than the regular chocolate or the Nutella, but for me it is the best. Blood orange is good, really liked the blueberry lemon, and bc I am a health nut - the Cadbury egg inside the Easter donut. 
Actually scratch all this - the Homer is the best. And the fritter. Damn, just order a dozen and wear your sweats, these donuts are amazing. 
I got these for my last birthday instead of a cake. 
Sent my friend down to get the Easter donuts.
Came for Mother's Day... you get the picture. The location is great, you can go to the vintage stores on Main Street or walk Fremont. They have a garden, a donut aquarium, cute art on the walls, nice staff, Chef Jeff is usually there, OH, and banging coffee. 

Ok one thing - they bake their masterpieces in the AM and close the store when they sell out. Run don't walk to Donut Bar, as their selection winds down as it gets closer to closing - around lunchtime

Man oh man can you drop a pretty penny here. Donuts start at $3 and go up to $6! Watch out for those pricey ones though, they're monsters..

I believe between four friends, we ordered to our hearts content (which ended up being 8 donuts and about $35, including chocolate milk for all). They supposedly have homemade strawberry milk on tap but I have my doubts since they were sold out the last two times I tried to stop in. (Maybe the trick is to go early? But how do I know the strawberry milk is worth getting up at 7am???)

In any case, the donuts were magic. I highly recommend the creme brûlée donut since it was one of the more unique ones we had. Personally, not my favorite. The caramelization on top tasted more like honey to me than anything else but I still recommend giving it a go since I've never seen anything like it anywhere else. Also the big poppa tart donuts are INSANE. Way too much volume for my belly. It was tasty but hard to enjoy such a monstrosity. I ended up taking two-thirds of it home. We also tried the strawberry split though I wasn't all that impressed. It's a sugar donut with whipped cream and strawberries in it.. plain and simple. There are definitely better options here, in my opinion..

If I were to offer a few pieces of advice: stick to the classics (they do their simple donuts very VERY well) and GO EARLY TO GET THE STRAWBERRY MILK. I think it's one of those mystical menu items that may or may not exist in real life.. hmm...

I was staying at the El Cortez last week and I decided to take a short walk up the block to try out Donut Bar. It's a small little shop but with a great selection. I had the Green Tea doughnut and a Chai Latte then bought a bunch more to take back to my family. I know I was excited to bring back a Homer doughnut for my sister because she loves when she gets Simpson stuff from me. Good doughnuts, cute place: A+ doughnut shop.

This is place is certainly one of the best places I've gotten donuts from in Vegas. 
When I walked by the window I could see all the special donuts on display and just had to go in. 
Its basically an assembly line of donuts.. pick your size box.. walk down the line and pick donuts to go inside box. Employees are always great to share their favoriets and try and squeeze one more donut in the box without smashing everything. 

The day I was here it was Friday afternoon and since it was towards the afternoon they offered my $10 box of donuts as many as I could fit in the box. I walked away with some bacon donuts, PopTart Donuts and some other great fancy items for sure.

Love that its in downtown Vegas and even if its a drive from my house, its certainly worth the drive and time. 
They also serve coffee drinks and has a small seating area. 
Be sure to pay attention to parking during the week downtown.

Another aweosome place on my list that I return to!
