While I applaud their marketing strategy (Large 'Sold Out' sign in the window makes one wonder what they've missed out on and make an effort to come back and see) to say I've had better donuts is an understatement. 

Getting there early one is greeted by rows of elegant looking donuts with creative names and flavors and a helpful staff.  Donuts aren't cheap but not as expensive as some have complained about ($5.00 for 2 - what do you expect for the "Best Donuts In the World").  I opted for a creme brulee donut for the BF and a (huge) Mud Pie one for me.  My friend got a Boston Creme for herself. 

As soon as she took a bite of the Boston Creme I knew this was not the "Best Donut In The World" entirely too doughy not enough creme.  Creme didn't go all the way through the bar. 

My Mud Pie tasted like a donut with chocolate sprinkles.  Fancy name for a less than average donut.  Again the thing was HUGE which meant a lot of dough for not nearly enough topping.  I ate about half and got bored (BORED! With a donut!!!)

The BF's review was the worst.  He took one bite and said it was the worst donut he'd ever had and that the cooking oil needed to be changed (he works in the food industry and I don't so he is more aware of such things).  He refused to eat any more (however, helpfully offered me a bite - which I declined).  He puts the creme brulee as "worse than Dunkin' Donuts" which is about as low as it goes in his book. 

Maybe I don't have the refined donut palette of some of the other clientele, maybe I'm just looking for something different in my breakfast pastries.  But I will skip this one next time.

I've been to the location in San Diego and thought it was just OK SO I have been looking forward to trying Vegas location out. I was pretty disappointed. The donuts didn't seem fresh. They seemed almost stale . The famous French toast was just OK. I wasn't expecting just a soggy warm donut. Prices high and just not worth it. I wouldn't recommend or go back to either location at this point.

Went here for the big poppa donut as I am a poptart fan. It was good but extremely sweet. Also tried the apple fritter just ok have had better and the plain was ok. The girl working there was friendly and explained all the flavors. This place is definitely not worth the hype.  I have had better donuts and is not worth the trip and certainly would not wait on line. Their claim to be the best donuts in the world is a definite no while I give them credit for creativity  they are not anything special.

Simply the best! Just went to an event and was blown away by every little detail. Not only were those donuts just decadent, but just the way they came out and looked won huge in my eyes! I'll be at donut bar tomorrow morning for that French Toast donut in the AM and some good ol coffee

#OMG ??? wow blown away on how good this #frenchtoast #Donut was @donutbarlv  #Crazy #Good ?? Younhave to come here if your #Local OR ON VACATION !! Yes if your coming to #Vegas on #vacation  you need to make time for this place skip the cafe at your #Casino lol trust me!!!
Great service and yummay sweets ! You can also preorder online to avoid the line ! Love it

Not to long ago I tried donut bar for the first time at the farmers market at downtown summerlin. I enjoyed just about every single donut they had and the guy who had helped me pick out some of them was super nice and friendly. So today I decided to drive from the other side of town to get some more of their donuts cause I enjoyed them so much the first time. Well I got there, first off the building is way to small they need to have a bigger space to walk. People kept running into each to get to the line or from the line to check out. Second off we were waiting in line and no one was helping us it seemed to be they were helping everyone around us, including the people that were behind us. Finally I had to ask someone to help us. Third after I had gotten home I dug into the donuts and they weren't as good. I had bought some that I knew were good from my previous experience at downtown summerlin and some new ones to try. I had gotten a maple bar, how can someone mess up on a maple bar? Honestly their donuts need more flavor. The donut itself is amazing, it's soft and moist but they have lack of flavor from the fillings and from the frostings.  Honestly you'd be better off going to a grocery store than here.

Presentation: 5/5
-every single donut looked mouth watering. If I was immune to diabetes I would have tried everything

Taste: 3/5
-Mixed feelings on the creme brulee, strawberry shortcake and strawberry cheesecake. Don't get me wrong, it was good but I was expecting mind blowing donuts based on the overall ratings and reviews

Coffee: 2/5
-Wasn't impressed with the coffee either. It just tasted like generic coffee, nothing special

Best Donuts Ever,,,, Great taste .. And always Fresh! But get there early! Once they run out. they close for the day. Their coffee and hot chocolate are not to be missed. One last thing. I enjoy sitting in the courtyard in the back of the store.

I've heard great things about this place and for a good reason. First, the owner (who I forgot his name--my apologies!!!) was amazing. He was super friendly, and patient (willingly to deal with my awe of his menagerie of donuts.) If you like--love donuts, this is the spot for you. I was surprised it wasn't busier, because this business is definitely a force to be reckoned with in the Downtown scene. 
I will even go so far as to say it's better than Pinkbox. So if you're craving something to satisfy that sweet tooth, look no further. Also, can we talk about the milks they have on tap? Innovative, creative, and fun!
I will be back and with friends ;)

Fabulous amazing splendid incredible!! I don't know if I love Nicole or hate her for turning me on to this place!  I had a PB & J bar, out of this world.  My very picky husband had a Boston cream bar and couldn't stop talking about it.  The owners Jeff & Joe are sincere men who rely care about the products they are serving.  I wish them a long life here in Las Vegas.

Donut Heaven. Nuff said. But for real this place is insane!! The donuts are gigantic and taste delicious. Their coffee is also great. The service is cheerful and professional. The only thing you need to know is get there early. They are open only until the donuts run out. I recommend getting there early in the morning to ensure you get the best selection of awesome donuts.

We had 5 donuts to try, 4 were stale and we didn't even want to try the 5th. I don't understand the hype here nor do I understand how people can sell stale/dry donuts and claim to be the best donuts in the world. Disappointing and definitely NOT worth the drive.

Donuts are okay. They have an interesting selection. Pricier than average, but you pay for the novelty. Had a caramel espresso donut. Seems like a regular yeast donut heavily iced. It was huge. I didn't taste coffee but it was covered in caramel. Tried the birthday cake donut. It was okay. After the hype from others, I expected more. I prefer Crunch donuts for novelty.
The donuts here are incredible - and so is the service! The owners work the counter, and treat customers like friends. These Creme Brulee donuts were among my favorites.
Great Donuts. Went opening weekend a while back and they were super friendly. Great for kids as well.

Just happened to see the donut bar sign and decided to quickly stop by and grabbed a red velvet and coconut donuts! I must say they taste as good as they look. They also have variety of different donuts and they almost too pretty to eat. It's a small shop around Fremont but it can hold all those delicious donuts!

Well I'm on a donut review writing spree right now, so I may as well write about one of my top 3 donut places in Las Vegas.   I dare say Donut Bar actually makes my top 3 donut places in North America too!  (The other two being Blue Star donuts in Portland and Cartems Donuterie in Vancouver Canada)

Why is Donut Bar so darn good?

Donut standards keep going up, and these days, you can't just have a good donut.  You need something that stands out to make your donut shop - 'worth a journey'.  At Donut bar, they've got TWO things that I gladly journey out for - their ice cream donut, and their creme brulee donut.  That's not even mentioning their other donuts (strawberry, vanilla bean, maple bacon) that are full of flavourful donuty goodness and excellent in their own right.  

Unlike Pinkbox, Donut bar closes when they run out of donuts.  That's usually around noon?  Depending on how picky you are about your donut options, come early.  They only make about 25 of their ice cream donuts every day, and they usually aim to have those ready by 10.  I know eating an ice cream cone at 10am in the morning feels a little strange, but it was worth it for me.

I haven't had their horchata donut, but I've seen photos -- looks pretty amazing.  As soon as I lose my donut weight I'm going right back to hunt for this donut!
Honestly Donut Heaven right here!! The level of Quality and Service was Awesome!! Cant wait to come back!!

And for my obligatory donut stop in Vegas, I bring you Donut Bar. Very cool selection of donuts. You've got some unique donuts to choose from here. I grabbed half a dozen. From the crop one of the notables was the poptart donut. An entire poptart in a donut. I was skeptical but it turns out to be a winner. A few others that were tasty was the butter beer which was enormous and the creme brulee. Also the ladies who work there are very friendly. Very nice donut shop.

Love it how they have so much to choose from
And also it really satisfies your cravings that's for-sure I love this place overall amazing and I really can't wait to bring my family here to try them out well worth it I appreciate this place for not only having a good selection but amazing service

I read about this place on fb...i know exactly where it is becuz it was o doughnuts b4 n i would go to nomnomnom...but still i hav this place to go nomnomnom on donuts! Luckily i got there n no line..aftr i left very long line out the door! I was greeted by friendly staff...i drooled looking at display of yummy looking donuts...i finally decided to try the strawberry pop tart donut...there is actual pop tart inside of donut..donut itself was huge..me likey alot!!! Deelish! lol..i got a coffee too n sat at inside counter..there is also an outdoor patio seating in back...staff was wearing leis n said its hawaiian theme day..they had donuts malasadas n choco coconut flavors..very cute! ..awesome donuts n awesome service! I will be back! Oh n i bought a cute tshirt to wear back home..hawaii!

Was in the area for a jury summons and decided to give this place a try. It's a cool little donut/coffee bar and the selection is on point. Me and my GF shared a Mexican Hot Chocolate, Strawberry Big Poppa Tart and the Creme Brûlée. We both agreed that the Creme Brûlée had more flavor to it and much more filling. This is one of those occasions where bigger isn't necessarily better.  We both felt that the other 2 looked more appealing but were mostly bread. I would probably go back and try the Brad Fritter w/Bacon (was told it was Brad Pitt's favorite), Blueberry Cheesecake and the Nutella Filled powder donut. The donuts were all fresh, as well!

This. Place. Is. AMAZING!!! 
Their donuts are unique yet so delicious! Delicious enough to make me wake up early enough to wait in line! Lol and it's in a cute little place downtown! Glad to see they're doing so well!

Four stars for creativity. Donut Bar knows how to knock your socks off. 

Located Downtown LV, there is plenty of street parking. Get there early because a line can form quickly that will run outside along the building. Once you are ready to have your order taken, the staff is there to load your belly. Take note that the donut selection runs outside of the case. There are layers of trays behind you ready to be eaten and don't forget to look at their menu board. 

The Oreo Birthday Cake has been my favorite so far. There is a full Oreo inside. I mean, don't. Who doesn't love Oreos?? You also can't go wrong with the classic maple. It's a must for me. 

The selection here is fierce. So many donuts to try, so little time. Stop by the donut fish tank and snap a photo. Grab a cup of Cold Brew and go (do)nuts!

Five words - CHURRO DONUT ICE CREAM CONE!!! Seriously the best thing in Vegas especially on a hot summer day. But you have to go early bc they run out of their yummy goods so fast!

So besides this delicious cone, we also got a few regular donuts. But of course these are far from "regular"! We ordered the oh-my-bday-cake-Oreo, blueberry cheesecake, blueberry with Meyer lemon, toasted coconut, birthday cake, and chocolate twix. My favorite (besides the donut cone with the vanilla soft serve AND chocolate sauce over the top) was the coconut and blueberry cheesecake. They were all good but seriously, I could not get over that darn churro cone! WITH SOFT SERVE! MY FAVORITE! I love soft serve ice cream! And to put it in a churro donut cone is freaking geeeenius! 

We went back a few days a later but went too late! I seriously almost cried when I saw the sold out on the window!! 

This is a DEFINITE stop if you're just visiting Vegas or if you live in Vegas. But go early, they run out of everything pretty darn fast, by lunch time, you're gonna be outta luck! Def worth it to wake up early and get that donuts and ice cream!!

Based on the two mornings I went to The Donut Bar I can say they have amazing presentation but the basics are lost in the details. For example, this morning I had the fritter with bacon, the bacon was high quality and perfect, but the fritter was so done the edges were almost black. I could only eat the center of it. Yesterday I had an Old Fashion and a Strawberry Cheesecake donut. The Old Fashioned was dry , maybe cooked a bit hot, and the Strawberry Cheesecake just tasted like strawberry filing, no tangy cheese to give it that cheesecake vibe. 

The staff are friendly, the donuts are very beautiful, and they brew Stumptown coffee. These are all good things but I have to have more substance with my flash.
Go there in the morning, but after a few hours after opening, just plain really bad.

What is the hype about? I have been want to try this place for a while and I was so disappointed. Got there at 1140 on a Friday so there were only three types of donuts left; Crete brûlée, strawberry cheesecake, and Nutella overload. I wasn't disappointed with the lack of selection as I would have chose two if the three anyway. They were dry, and all disappointing in flavor. The brûlée topping tasted burnt and not sweet and the cream was almost tasteless. The strawberry cheese cake was a jelly filled with cheesecake icing I guess? Not enough filling , couldn't taste anything like cheesecake, and the filling tasted cheap. The Nutella overload an underload with not enough filling. It was straight Nutella which was the only saving grace of the donut experience. They did have nitro cold brew which I tried and it was good but their cold brew was bitter and not smooth. Will not try this place again.

Now I may have showed up at 11, so they had painted outside that they were sold out but when I came in to double check he did have some they didn't sell yet. Wasn't a huge variety because it was the leftovers some chocolate bars, coffee bar, and some massive sugar donuts. They were absolutely delicious! I got a good deal and more than I could eat for a great price. I got to make it on time tommorow .

From a donut standpoint, Donut Bar is simply dope. They were one of my favorites while in San Diego, so for me, the fact that they took over where O-face used to be is a straight up upgrade. Every donut they do is gourmet and you can tell they make them with care and keep them at top quality. They are also very community oriented and are always doing things hat put them out there so that people can put a face to the names. They were absolute life savers at Life Is Beautiful. They are also super cool because they post their menu for the next day on all their social media, so you know if your favorite donut is gonna be there and you don't have to guess. My only gripe is that they open relatively late for a donut place at 7am and it's super cool that they are open until sold out. This works out well for me since I work downtown so it's easy for me to get to but if you're not as lucky as me then you better make sure to get in as early as possible. Also, another super cool thing I'll say is that you should heck out their bathroom. It lets you know exactly how dope these people are. 
Long story short, find a way down here. Eat some donuts. Walk out like a boss

I have a big problem with this place... 

I cant stop wanting to go there.. 

Best donuts ever!   

I'm getting fat... BUT its so good!

Ended up in Vegas for way too long. Thank god for this donut shop. After moving from the strip to downtown, this was a daily go-to. We actually got healthy smoothies (from the market down the street) and donuts for lunch 4 days in a row :) sweet staff, vegan options, 2 for 1 happy hour. Overall great experience!
Amazing donuts, but go early as when they run out that's it ! Nice team working in there ! Can't wait to return my next visit to Vegas.
Best donuts I have ever tasted and I have tried almost every shop in town. Get there early otherwise you may miss out!

By far the best donut shop I have been too. There was a line and I can definitely say I understand why. This morning I ordered a dozen donuts and I had to try the French toast one and thankfully I got one of the last ones!!! it is by far the most delicious scrumptious, warm, perfect amount of sweetness,! it was just delicious. 

I can't believe this was my first time trying this I literally work right around the corner how come I didn't know it existed so delicious hats off to the chef and the gentleman and woman working hard I would defiantly recommend this place! 

#bestintown
We love this place!!' Delicious donuts! My hubby loves the chocolate euphoria donut. Going to bring my sister here for bachelorette as well

Wow. Can I just say...MIND BLOWN! These delectable morsels are far from your everyday mom and pop donuts. Depending on the type you get, you're definitely in for a sugar rush! These donuts are definitely too pretty to eat, but I'm happy to accept that challenge. I've tried a variety of them and the only one I don't think I'll be trying and kind of disappointed about is the Mexican Hot Chocolate (i think its called). All others are very worth the hour I waited in line and 5 blocks I walked yesterday due to the walk-a-thon happening in downtown LV. You should also try their house made strawberry milk. Soo smooth and soo good!

The Donut Bar Las Vegas is absolutely, hands down the best place to get your morning started. I eat here almost daily. The donuts are always consistent, and the service from Joe, Jeff, and their staff is always superb! Highly recommended!!!!

Incredible! The vegan whipped cream is better than any whipped cream I have ever tasted! The donuts are fresh and delicious. They are made in house daily and you wont be disappointed with any selection!

Spontaneity wins!

At 9am on a Thursday, my friend and I decided to check out Donut Bar. There was no line! 

The photos don't do the donut size justice. The large ones are truly huge and easily split-able, which is great for trying multiple with friends.

I tasted 3 "small" donuts: toasted coconut, creme brule, and nutella explosion. They were all great - loved their consistency and Donut Bar's playfulness with the decorations.

To top it office, the prices were great! Totally reasonable for a "craze" food, quality, and quantity.

What a food adventure! Definitely check this spot out.

At the time of this review, this place surprisingly does not have a line out the door.  They have many, super good items here.  

My favorites were the maple bacon donut with super good chewy dough in the middle, and the churro cone soft serve ice cream.  These two items were incredibly orgasmic.  

Do yourself a favor and go to Vegas for this.  Do it now.  Please.
The donut was a little stale. Not hot or fresh as I would've expected it. The location was cute, restaurant was cute as well.
